He has been able to stay in business and cover his family's needs.  He wants to continue increasing his production in order to meet his commitments.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Elisabeth, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans est mariée à un ferrailleur nommé Grégoire. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Elisabeth et son mari. Elisabeth a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Elisabeth vend des produits de mercerie et des divers produits à son domicile. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de mercerie.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 23 years old. She is not married and lives in Iringa District, Tanzania with her mother. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches secondary school students life skills, which helps them to improve their academic performance. Juliana requests a Kiva loan to open up a clothing shop where she can sell a variety of clothes near her village. The profits will help Juliana to buy many clothes and help her mother in paying for household expenses.

loans.use: to open a clothes shop

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde’s husband worked as a truck driver but in 2000 he was fired. Because of this, economic problems appeared for Matilde's family.

Matilde's husband did not get a job and Matilde knew how to build bricks so she told him that it was necessary to build a furnace in her house to make the bricks. They invested part of the money they had and started their microbusiness. Matilde has three sons and now everyone in her house knows how to build bricks because they all work together in the business.

Matilde is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to invest in raw material. She comments that if she invests right now she could be prepared for December and January because these months increase her demand according to her past experience.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

El esposo de Matilde se desempeñaba como Trailero, pero en el año 2000 lo desemplearon y con ello se vinieron los problemas económicos. No lograba volver a contratarse con ninguna empresa. Matilde conocía el oficio de fabricación de ladrillos, por lo que lo convenció para construir un horno en el patio de su casa y ponerse a fabricar ladrillos. Fue así como invirtiendo parte de la liquidación iniciaron su microempresa. Tiene 3 hijos y ahora todos conocen el oficio de la fabricación de tabiques, pues todos trabajan en el negocio. Matide esta solicitando apoyo para poder invertir en materias primas, necesita un crédito por la cantidad de US$925 el cual piensa pagar en 6 meses. Esta inversión le permitirá solventar la inversión inicial, pues existe todo un proceso de fabricación y hacia diciembre y enero, la demanda aumenta, por lo que necesitan estar preparados con suficiente mercancía. Comenta que la experiencia de años anteriores le ha enseñado a sacar ventaja de la oportunidad que se le presenta.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of electronics, accessories utensils and crockery

loans.name: Ni

texts.en: Ni is 53 years old, and is single. She provides for her 86-year-old mother and her mentally ill sister. They have no land aside from the 30 square meters for their home. Ni’s family earns only $5 per person per month from Ni's small grocery store. Ni requests a loan of $75 to increase the items she can sell in her store and grow her business.

loans.use: To supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Tran

texts.en: Mrs. K. is 44 yrs. old and together with her husband she lives in Ngoc Thanh commune, a rural area in Hung Yen province, approx. 50 miles south of Hanoi. They have 2 children, 24 and 18 yrs. old, who are both at school (college and university). A long time ago they realized that education is expensive in Vietnam, so they started saving. Their income is $62.50 per month and education is $80.00 per month. They have rice paddies, raise pigs, and make clothes, but their main business is making rice wine. The loan will be used to buy rice, so they can make more wine and increase their income.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Kneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kneang N. is 39 years old and the mother of one school-going child. To service her family’s living expenses, she rents rooms to the people in her area, which earns her around $7 each day. Her husband (pictured here because Kneang N. is not available) is a motor-taxi driver, earning on average $3/day in revenue.

Mrs Kneang N. hopes to used this $1,000 loan to open a shop selling soft drinks and some kind of grocery products to earn more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and save enough money for her child’s education.

loans.use: To open  a shop selling soft drinks and grocery items

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Ni MAde S. is a model of extraordinary mother and wife. In her daily life, she helps her husband as a construction labor, runs a farm. These works are done just to supplement her family's income and pay tuitions for her two children. She has run her pig farm for a while, however high cost for feeds and piglets makes it impossible for her to expand her business. She understands that pig farm can be promising financially. The profit from the difference of selling revenue and daily cost and additional revenue stream from selling excrement as fertilizer is quite promising. This increases her motivation to expand her farm and increase her pigs. With additinal funding and training from DINARI, Ni Made S. can add 2 more pigs to her farm so she can have 3 pigs at a time. Piglets costs her $33 each and feeds supply for 4 months costs her $55,so she can earn $100 per 4 month periods. With this additional business income, Ni Made S. can afford to send her two children to school.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Made S. merupakan potret seorang ibu sekaligus istri yang luar biasa. Dalam keseharian hidupnya ia mampu membantu suami dalam pekerjaan membangun rumah , bertani sekaligus beternak babi. Pekerjaan itu ia kerjakan semata-mata untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga sekaligus membiayai sekolah kedua orang anaknya. Usaha beternak babi telah lama ia geluti, akan tetapi harga pakan dan bibit yang tinggi membuat istri dari I Wayan Kariasa ini tidak dapat mengembangkan usahanya. Ia paham betul beternak babi sangat menjanjikan, keuntungan dari selisih penjualan dan biaya yang dikeluarkan sekaligus limbah berupa pupuk kandang membulatkan tekadnya untuk menambah jumlah babi yang dipelihara. Dengan tambahan modal dan pelatihan dari DINARI, Ni Made S. bisa menambah populasi babi lagi 2 ekor. Sehingga total ia memelihara saat ini sejumlah 3 ekor. Dengan harga bibit Rp. 300.000.- / ekor dan biaya pakan selama 4 bulan pemeliharaan sebesar Rp. 500.000.- maka ia akan mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 900.000.- / 4 bulan. Dengan tambahan pendapatan dari usaha ini, Ni Made S. mampu menyekolahkan kedua orang anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum K. H., 47, is a mother of four children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a stand in front of a secondary school selling various kinds of biscuits and candies to students passing by. She can earn on average around $4 per day of profit, while her husband is employed as a high school teacher, making around $2 per day. Mrs. Sum K. H. is humbly requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing a food cart and icebox to also sell sugar cane juice on the street in front of the school. (Her husband who is a teacher is pictured because Sum K. H. was unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase a street cart to sell sugar cane juice

loans.name: Ayayi

texts.fr:
Mr. Ayayi A. is 32, married, and the father of three children. He lives in Bè-kpota, a neighborhood in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and runs a little restaurant where he prepares only pork, a dish the local inhabitants dearly love. Very ambitious and intent on improving his little business, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to refurbish his restaurant and hire some new waitresses so as to better satisfy his clientele. He would also like to sell drinks since his customers are asking him to do so. This will allow him to earn more and thus support his family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Ayayi A. est âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Il habite le quartier de Bè-kpota et détient un restaurant où il prépare uniquement la viande de porc très apprécié par la population. Très ambitieux et voulant rehausser son activité, il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour l’aménagement de son restaurant et acquérir de nouvelles serveuses pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Il veut aussi associer la vente de boissons sur demande de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son revenu pour le mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use:
Refurbishment of his restaurant

Aménagement de restaurant

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Mrs Lan is 24. She has a young child. Her family raises poultry and sells eggs, this is their main income. On average, they make 3-5 USD a day. It's enough to make ends meet. She has never borrowed money before. When she learned of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) and its loan condition, she has applied for a loan of 150 USD to invest in her poultry business. She will use the loan to buy feed for her poultry thus raising her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lan, 24 tuổi, có một con nhỏ. Cuộc sống của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi gà, vịt và bán trứng. Thu nhập trung bình của hai vợ chồng từ 50000-70000đ/ngày. Nói chung cũng tương đối đủ sống. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nhưng được biết tới những tiện ích mà Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc đem lại, chị đã vay 2006000đ để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi, tăng gia sản xuất.

loans.use: To buy feed for poultry

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started selling chicken by chance. 28 years ago, together with her husband, she would breed chicken and hens. Nevertheless, at some point she sold the eggs that she had in excess and later on she also started selling chicken.

Nowadays, she only breeds chicken on special occasions, like Christmas, when she receives special orders from her clients. Thanks to her business, to the help of her husband and to her inner-strength, she has been able to support her children and provide them with an education.

Isabel just turned 60 and she would like to open a store at her home to sell the chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Vender pollos solo fue una casualidad para Isabel. Hace 28 años ella, junto a su esposo, se dedicaba a criar pollos y gallinas ponedoras de huevo. No obstante, en un tiempo tuvo la oportunidad de vender ella misma huevos, ya que los tenía en grandes cantidades.

Poco a poco fue incluyendo a sus ventas los pollos que ella criaba. Hasta que se dedico por completo a la venta de pollos y dejo de lado la crianza de ellos. Solo por temporadas vuelve a la crianza, como en Navidad que lo hace porque recibe pedidos de algunos clientes. Gracias a su negocio, a la ayuda de su esposo y a la fuerza que nunca la abandona, ella ha podido mantener a sus hijos y darles educación.

Isabel acaba de cumplir setenta años y está pensando abrir una bodega en su casa.

loans.use: To open a  butcher shop at her home (to sell chicken)

loans.name: Satupaitea Satufia 2 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these four women of Satupaitea Satufia on the island of Savaii, passed theirwritten tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faleieiroma S., 23, is married to a farmer and has two children. She grows cabbages and tomatoes in her vegetable garden. She wishes to use her loan to purchase a weed killing sprayer and pesticides, vegetable seeds, fertilizer and 2 bush knives. She will sell her produce three days a week to the public and people from her village.

Aveina T., 32, married, has five children. She has over three years of experience baking donuts and pork cakes and growing taro. She will use her loan to purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, a knife, a filing, cabbage seeds and fertilizer.

Fuatino U., 33, is divorced with three children. She maintains a taro plantation and sells her produce at a fair price twice a week. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, a spade, a shovel, a knife filing. This will also pay for her transportation needs.

Loimata A., 28, is married with two children. With over two years of experience, she grows cabbage and cucumber and sells them twice a week. She will use her loan to purchase pesticides, a wheel barrow, 2 knives, a shovel, a spade, a filing and laborers.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Santos Margarito

texts.es:
Santos O. has been a farmer for 15 years in the municipality of Condega in Estelí, Nicaragua. Through his many sacrifices he is characterized as a great worker who has helped maintain his household.

Mr O.' family has passed through some very difficult economic times. Ceprodel has helped him with credits that have allowed him to improve his situation through the purchase of and investment in fertilizer for his crops. Once again Mr O. asks for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other products to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos O. se dedica al negocio agropecuario desde hace 15 años en el municipio de Condega en Estelí de Nicaragua. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha caracterizado por ser un gran trabajador que ha logado mantener su hogar compuesto por su esposa e hijo.

Es de mucha necesidad recalcar que a través de los años la familia del señor O. ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas sin embargo, Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que le han permitido mejorar dicha situación por medio de la compra de semillas para siembra e inversión en los cultivos. Una vez mas el señor O. solicita un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos que den lugar al trabajo en el cultivo.

loans.use: To improve his crops

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 24 year-old Ester S.. She is married, and has two children ages 1 and 18 months. In 2007, Ester established her takeaway kiosk business. Ester requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, candy, snacks, and phone credit vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soda, candy, snacks, and phone credit vouchers for her takeaway kiosk.

loans.name: Sokona

texts.fr:
Ms. Sokona S., age 22, is the mother of two and currently lives with her children in her aunt's home in Sanoubougou, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). At a young age, she started earning money because she quit school due to social reasons. Two years ago, she became specialized in a sector where there is a strong demand, that is, the sale of clothing and articles for women.

Because of difficulty obtaining sufficient financial resources, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is on her first loan.

She gets her inventory in Bobo Dioulasso (a city in the Republic of Burkina Faso, in West Africa). Then she displays her goods in her shop in Sikasso. She sells retail as much as she does wholesale. With this loan, she intends to buy two lengths of Wax-brand, one length of men's fabric, three dozen of Gel, four dozen of beauty cream, one dozen women's hair extensions, and one box of bath soap. This business is run year-round. Her high business turnover enables her to realize a monthly benefit of 100,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, she will pay the loan interest, ensure covering her own expenses, and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle Sokona S. agée de 22 ans est mère de 2 enfants et vit actuellement avec ses enfants chez sa tante à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Elle a commencé très jeune les activités économiques en raison de l’abandon de l’école pour des raisons sociales. Elle s’est spécialisée dans un secteur ou il ya une forte demande à savoir la vente des habits et articles feminins il ya de cela deux ans.

En raison des difficultés d’obtenir des ressources financières suffisantes, elle intégra le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et est à son premier pret .

Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (une ville de la République de Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’ouest). Ensuite elle expose ses produits dans sa boutique à Sikasso. Elle vend aussi bien en détail qu’en gros. Avec ce pret elle compte achéter 2 Pièces de Wax, 1 pièce de tissus pour homme , 3 douzaines de Gel, 4 douzaines de crème de beauté 1 douzaine de Mèche pour femmes et 1 carton de savon de toilette. Cette activité est menée durant toute l’année . La rotation de son activité élévée, lui permet de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA.. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA par mois. Grâce à ce bénéfice elle paiera les interets du pret; assurera certaines de ses propre dépenses et investira le reste dans son activité..

loans.use: To buy cloth and various items for her shop

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Benkadi Group are all married and average 41 years of age and five children. They live in large traditional families that are mostly monogamous in the village of Dagala Wèrè, in Ségou Prefecture, the Republic of Mali. They essentially work in small-scale commerce: dried couscous and grains, kitchen utensiles (calebasses), and condiments.

Connected by ties of community and friendship, the women of the Benkadi Group have mutual trust in each other. So they decided as a group to request a collaboration with the the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They generally get their supplies in Cinzana, Gare, Ségou, and locally in town. Millet seeds are pounded, sifted, and steamed before being dried in the sun and protected from flies and contamination. Next, the finished product is placed into a calebasse (a bowl made from a gourd) for selling. Sales are generally made either with cash or credit, in the home or door-to-door, in Ségou and in Soro Wèrè. The customers are composed of all social categories: men, women, and sometimes children.

With this loan, they each intend to buy two sacks of grain, sixty calebasses, and a large quantity of condiments. They each hope to realize a monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA, which will serve to cover the loan interest, and the rest will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles à majorité monogames dans le village Dagala Wèrè Préfecture de Ségou République du Mali. Elles exercent essentiellement le petit commerce : de couscous séché, de grains de céréales, d’ustensiles de cuisine (calebasses) et de condiments.

Etant liées par des liens de voisinage et d’amitié, les femmes du groupe Benkadi se font mutuellement confiance. Alors elles décidèrent ensemble de solliciter la collaboration de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles s’approvisionnent généralement à Cinzana gare, Ségou, et sur place au village. Les graines de mil sont pilées, tamisées, mis sous vapeur d’eau avant d’être asséché au soleil à l’abri des mouches et des saletés. Ensuite le produit fini est mis dans une calebasse pour la vente. Les ventes se font généralement au comptant ou à crédit, à domicile ou en ambulant à Ségou et à Soro Wèrè. La clientèle est composée de toutes les catégories sociales : hommes, femmes et quelques fois des enfants

Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter chacune deux sacs de grains de céréales, 60 calebasses, une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7 500 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans l’activité.

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Leticia De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Leticia H. works very hard in her business of selling shrimp and seafood in the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, kindly attending to her clients in her home.

She is the mother of two small children who she is responsible for supporting and because of this she tries so hard in her shrimp and seafood business.

To continue with her business, today, she asks for a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of seafood with the goal of marketing it. With this loan, she will benefit herself as well as her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leticia H. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de camarones y mariscos en el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega atendiendo a sus clientes muy amablemente en su casa de habitación.

Ella es madre de dos pequeños niños los cuales tiene la obligación de mantener y para ello es que se esfuerza grandemente en el negocio de venta de camarones y mariscos.

Para continuar con su negocio hoy en día ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los mariscos con el propósito de comercializarlos. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su amada familia.

loans.use: Purchase of Shrimp and Other Seafood

loans.name: Maria Ignancia

texts.es:
Mary necesitaba aumentar ingresos, para mantener a sus 3, ya que es madre soltera por lo que hace 10 años empezó su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una parrilla y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Mary needed to increase her income in order to support her 3 children, as she is a single mother. 10 years ago she began her business making and selling food and little by little she has been able to get ahead and be successful. She needs a loan for US $300 which will be repaid in 6 months to buy a grill and be able to continue with her business. With your help she will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a grill

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida began selling food in Zanzibar ten years ago. She is now able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $50. For the first time, Faida has access to capital and she is hoping that with this loan she will be able to increase her inventory and grow her profit.

Faida is married and has a 5-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
As a mother, Severina M., a 45-year old resident of Basak, Loon, Bohol, always wants the best for her 5 children. She desires to change her life and build a good future for her kids by paying more attention to how she could run her business well. Now, she operates a “carenderia” (food stall) in front of their house with her husband helping her run the business. From her earnings, she was able to send 3 of her children to secondary school.

She is requesting her first loan of PHP 6,000 from CEV to purchase additional ingredients and food items to expand her business.

“With my loan, I could compete well with other food stalls, and attract more customers,” she uttered with confidence.

By joining the program of CEV, she has access to credit, trainings, and insurance services that she believes could help improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Buying ingredients and food items

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This is a loan for four borrowers all of whom are residents of Toultaek Commune in Battambang Province. The leader, Mrs. In N., 28, earns income from selling various kinds of groceries from her home. She started her business about 3 years ago. She looks after one lovely young child that attends school. Her husband, Sem Ratmony, age 37, drives a motorcycle taxi. In hopes to expand her business and is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to store and resell.

Mrs. Prom S., 43, sells fruits and is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of fruits to sell.

Mrs. Suy V., 52, is a vegetable seller. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Mrs. Teng M., 33, sells clothes in the market and is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is twenty-five years old. She is single and seriously looking for her "better half". She owns and operates a Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood at Babiani in the Western region of Ghana with her other two siblings. Rasta hairdo is what most people call it: plaiting one's hair with mesh.

Martha is very skillful and a talented hairdresser who adds lots of beauty to the hair of her many customers, and she says that is her secret. Martha uses "weavons" and mesh extensions to plait her clients' hair to add beauty. She has been doing this for the past four years now. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, mesh extensions, threads etc. to avoid shortage and poor servicing. As a result of this, she has one beautiful young lady as her apprentice whom she is training for her future career. Training was organized for her, so when your help is lent to her, she will use it to achieve her business goal of increased efficiency and profitability.

Grace's picture was taken when she was busily plaiting her customer's hair. She also believes the loan will enable her to rent a better store and furnish it with ceiling fans, lights, tiles etc. She believes in physical evidence.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, mesh, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Aun K. is a villager in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field but her field is infertile. She also has a lot of insects who damage her crops. She requests a loan buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field to make her fields more productive and crops more successful. 
Mrs. Srey Aun K. is a 37-year-old widow with a child, who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field and make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. sells beef. She hopes to expand this business so as to meet the demand of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cows to slaughter and sell. Joy is 39 years old and she is married with 6 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith lives in Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells utensils and other items, like plates, spoons, coolers, and pots. She needs a loan in the amount of N70000 to purchase more utensils to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
B. Murodjon is 30 years old. He is married with three children. He lives in Isfara town with his parents. Despite his young age, Murodjon works hard in order to provide his family with necessary food and education. He has a business selling cement at the building materials market. He has been in this business for 2 years and gained a rich experience. He has a special warehouse where he keeps his goods in safety. He knows how to protect cement so that it doesn’t deteriorate.

All this allows Murodjon to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family. Currently he needs to restock his goods as the number of his clients is increasing day by day. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 800 USD for a term of 12 months. Murodjon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cement in order to increase his inventory

loans.name: Ivania Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Ana Julia S. H. , Petrona del Socorro G. B. e  Ivania del Socorro B. C..


El grupo solidario Ivana está conformado por tres señoras originarias de la ciudad de Masaya mujeres con excelente record crediticio, sus actividades son diversas, doña Ana Julia vende frutas, frijoles cocidos y comidas en su casa, le vende a los vecinos. Tiene tres hijas jóvenes que le ayudan a realizar la actividad.

Doña Petrona vende ropa usada y nueva de forma ambulante, dos hijas que ya son adultas le ayudan a esta actividad, cada dos días venden comidas como sopas en el barrio donde viven, esto para ayudarse con la alimentación del hogar. Su esposo vende en el mercado, ofrece frutas y verduras.

Doña Ivania es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es muy responsable, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Tipitapa durante la mañana y tiene una pulpería en su casa que le ayudan sus hijos a verla y vende tortillas en la tarde. Ella es madre soltera y ha sacado a delante a sus tres hijos que aún son pequeños.
Ella sueña con mejorar su casa y asegurar la construcción, esto para que su familia tenga un mejor nivel de vida, espera dar estudios a sus hijos y que sean profesionales. Ella está en proceso de legalización de su propiedad y así hacer mejoras.
 
Doña Ana Julia S. es mujer de 53 años, vende frutas, verduras, frijoles cocidos y comidas rápidas como: enchiladas, tacos y platanos con queso; en estas actividades participan sus hijas que son jovenes de 18,20 y 14 años. Su sueño es que sus hijas terminen sus estudios y puedan obtener empleos en oficinas, así como mejorar la casa para cuando ella sea más adulta; con los gastos del hogar le ayuda su esposo que trabaja vendiendo verduras en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Ana Julia S. H. , Petrona del Socorro G. B. and Ivania del Socorro B. C.. The supportive Ivania group is formed by three women from the city of Masaya; women with an excellent credit record. Their activities are diverse. Mrs. Ana Julia sells fruit, cooked beans and foods from her house to her neighbors. She has three young daughters that help her with her business. Mrs. Petrona sells new and used clothing as a traveling saleswoman. She has two daughters that are already adults and help her with her business. Every other day they sell foods such as soups in the neighborhood where they live; this is to help her to purchase food for their home. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables in the market. Mrs. Ivana is the leader of the group, she is very responsible. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Tipitapa Market in the mornings and has a store in her house that her children help her to run where she sells tortillas in the afternoons. She is a single mother and has worked hard to help her small children get ahead. She dreams of bettering her home and securing the construction so that her family will have a better quality of life. She hopes that her children will be able to attend school and that they will become professionals. She is in the process of finalizing the papers on her property. Mrs. Ana Julia Sanchez is 53 years old. She sells fruits, vegetables, baked beans and fast foods, such as enchiladas, tacos and plantains with cheese. Her three daughters (aged 14, 18 and 20) help her with her business. Ana's dream is that her daughters finish school and that they obtain office work, so that they can improve their home when they are older. Her husband helps her with household expenses, he works selling vegetables in the municipal market.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is the purchase fruits and vegetables that are offered to the customers, these are oranges, tamarinds, lemons, melons, etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Justina M. from Mwanza. She is married with seven children between the ages of 15 and 24.

Justina has been running a shop since 2003. She sells tea, Blands, sugar, soap and cooking oil. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $198 from her business.

Justina is requesting a loan of $250in order to purchase soap, cooking oil, sugar and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Justina thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soap, cooking oil, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda T. is from the city of Dapitan City. She is 35 years old. Florenda is single. To make a living, Florenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Florenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Florenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es: Marizol tiene 30 años, es una madre muy querida por su familia, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su esposo Juan de 32 y sus 4 hijos: Jhon de 11, Daniel de 9, Karen de 7 y Ruth de 5 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle algo. Marizol refiere que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y más aún si las personas que compran son sus “caseros” (clientes regulares). Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es transportar la ropa desde la ciudad de Tacna (al sur del país), ya que le resulta muy cansado el trayecto. Marizol anhela tener una tienda grande de ropa donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus prendas y sabe que tiene que esforzarse mucho para poder salir adelante. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy activa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Marizol is 30 years old. She is a mother who is very much loved by her family. She lives in the house inherited from her parents. Her husband is Juan, who is 32 years old, and they have four children: Jhon-11, Daniel-9, Karen-7, and Ruth-5. They wish to give them a good life.

Marizol sells clothing from her shop located in the San José market (the largest market in the city of Juliaca). She is a very persuasive saleswoman who always convinces customers to buy something. Marizol says what she likes most about her job is making sales and even more that the people who buy from her are “like family” (her regular customers). She has been in business 10 years, and what she likes least is hauling clothing from the city of Tacna (in the southern part of the country) since it is a very tiring journey.

Marizol longs to have a large clothing store where she can sell her clothes more comfortably. She knows she has to work hard to succeed. This is her fifth loan with MFP and expects to make her payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank group, where she is a very active member. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase more clothing to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and has 4 children. She sells groceries and she has been in this business for the past 2 years. 
She is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nunuu

texts.en:
Nunuu is a member of the Kheri liwe borrower group. She is a 30-year-old woman and is separated from her husband.

Three years ago, Nunuu started her own business selling charcoal. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tsh.

This is Nunuu`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal to sell. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Nunuu hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 58 years old. He is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters. All are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Stephen is a trader. He runs a cold store. He supplies to food vendors in his community. He procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. Stephen has been in business for barely one year now and wants a loan to buy fresh fish and meat in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Redeemer Group

texts.en:
Juliana is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Wiawso, a town  in the western region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 

Juliana sells pastries. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Redeemer. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply to retailers and chop bar (small restaurant) operators in their town and in nearby communities. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: G. Angèle est née en 1975 à Comè, au Sud du Bénin et est mariée à AWO Edgard, un soudeur. Mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, Angèle réside à Abomey Calavi au Sud du Bénin depuis trois ans. Grâce au revenu de son activité de vente de matériels électriques (ampoules, réglettes, interrupteurs, etc.), des fournitures scolaires et de tissus, Angèle participe aux dépenses de la famille. Angèle achète ses produits de commerce à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin et à Lomé, pays voisin du Bénin ; et les revend à Cocotomey, à Cotonou. Angèle a déjà quinze ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. Pour continuer à développer son activité et plus tard créer une société de vente de matériels électriques, Angèle sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Angèle G. was born in 1975 in Comé, in the south of Benin, and is married to Edgard Awo, a welder. Angèle is a mother of 2 schooled children, and has been living in Abomey Calavi, in the south of Benin, for 3 years now. Her revenues made from the sale of electrical supplies (light bulbs, power bars, light switches, etc.), school supplies and fabrics, allowed Angèle to contribute to her family's expenditures. Angèle purchases her products in Dantokpa, a large international market in Benin, as well as in Lomé (in Benin's neighboring country of Togo); and resells them in Cocotomey, in Cotonou. Angèle has fifteen years of experience in this domain. To continue developing her current business, and to later create a sales company of electrical supplies, Angèle is requesting a loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 30 power bars, 50 light bulbs, 30 light switches...

loans.name: Gloria Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella pertenece al banco comunal Chaska ñahui, situado en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 59 años de edad, ella es  casada y tiene 1 hijo, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar y sus otras labores, con el servicio de hotelería, nuestra socia trabaja en un hotel de tres estrellas muy conocido y céntrico, ella se encarga de la mantelería y el servicio de alimentos dentro del hotel. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de un mueble, que irá pagando poco a poco con su sueldo del hotel.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Gloria. She is a member of the Chaska Ñahui Communal Bank, which is located in the city of Cusco.

Gloria is 59 years old, married, and has 1 child. She divides her time between her household chores and her other jobs. Gloria works at a 3 star hotel that is well-known and centrally located. She is in charge of housekeeping and food services for the hotel.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy furniture. She will gradually repay her loan from her hotel salary. She appreciates and values the loans that have been provided to her. Gloria promises to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Mrs. Nenita A. is a married woman living in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has two children and the eldest is 18 years old. She is in the rice-farming business. She joined CEVI a year ago for the financial service that she could use as a capital to run her farm. Now she is requesting to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos. One of the reasons she stayed with CEVI is because of the low interest rate. Nenita will use her loan to purchase farm inputs needed for her rice farm.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn P. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 30 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Junalyn owns and operates a business selling mineral water in the local community. Junalyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Junalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Junalyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leydis Lisbeth

texts.es: La joven Leydis U. tiene una pulpería  que desde hace un año administra con ayuda de su esposo la logro poner,  el vende queso de varios sabor, crema, el cual distribuye en las diferentes restaurantes del país, pulpería, y empresas han logrado vender al personal da al contado y al crédito. Su propósito es aumentar el inventario para obtener mejores ganancias, vendiendo una variedad de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, pote de leche, lo que mas compra el cliente para el día. Tiene 24 años de edad, y con una bebe de 6 meses. Por casarse no  logro terminar su carrera lo cual espera entrar el año que viene para lograr una mejor estabilidad social y económica para dar a su hijita lo mejor. Lo cual espera lograr ya que por falta de dinero no termino y por su bebe que se le complico. Contenta con la institución por la oportunidad de aumentar su negocio lo cual traerá mejores ingreso y poder recoger para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leydis U., 24, has run a small general store, that she was able to set up with help from her husband, for a year. He sells various kinds of cheese and cream which he distributes to different restaurants, grocery stores and employees of companies in the country; they sell for both cash and credit. Her goal is to increase stock with such things as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, milk, which are the items most sold on a daily basis, so that her profits will improve. She has a 6-month-old baby and, because she got married, was unable to finish her studies which she plans to restart next year in order to attain better social and economic stability so that she can give her daughter the best. She hopes to accomplish this since lack of funds and the arrival of her baby complicated things and she did not finish. She is happy with the institution for the opportunity to enlarge her business which will bring increased earnings and savings to earmark for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, oil to stock her store.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia es una mujer trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 55 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad.
Ligia se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, actividad que realiza diariamente. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Pucallpa” desde hace ocho años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò calzado.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1500.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de prendas de vestir para ser vendidas en el mercado.
El sueño de Ligia es tener un local màs amplio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ligia is a hard-working woman who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region. She is 55 years old, separated from her husband, and is the mother of three children, all of whom are adults. She makes a living by selling clothing and footwear, which she does daily. For eight years she has been a part of the communal bank "Perlas de Pucallpa", and the first credit that she received was of 300.00 nuevos soles, with which she purchased footwear. Currently she needs a loan of 1500.00 nuevos soles, which will be used in the purchase of garments to be sold at the market. Ligia's dream is to have a larger place for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa como cuidante junto a sus 5 hijos: Antonia de 14, Karina de 12, Adolfo de 10, Samuel de 8 y Giomara de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ovejas. Todos los fines de semana Florencia viaja rumbo al pueblo de Acora (Distrito de la provincia de Puno) a comprar ovejas de sus proveedores, las cuales alimenta y cuida por unos meses, para luego llevarlas a vender a la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, ya que lo hace muy hábilmente, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las ovejas, ya que es una tarea muy difícil y cansada, la cual le toma mucho tiempo. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio siga creciendo, ya que así poco a poco su vida ira mejorando.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Florencia con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ovejas para aumentare la cantidad que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
50 year old Florencia is a hard-working simple woman who lives in a home as a caretaker along with her 5 children: Antonia age 14, Karina age 12, Adolfo age 10, Samuel age 8, Giomara age 7; who are the focus of all her efforts. Florencia buys and sells sheep. Every weekend Florencia travels to the twon of Acora (in the district and province of Puno) to buy sheep from her suppliers, which she then feeds and takes care of for a few months, then taking them to sell in the Sunday market in Juliaca city. What she most likes about her job is selling, as she does it easily, having sold for 10 years now. She considers transporting the sheep the most difficult, as it is a difficult and tiring chore which takes a lot of time. In the future she hopes her business will continue to grow, in this way improving her life little by little. This is Florencia’s second loan with MFP; she hopes to be able to make her payments on time and not disappoint the members of her communal bank, where she is very respected because of the responsibility she demonstrates. With the 1500 soles she seeks she will buy more sheep to increase the quantity she normally sells.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos en su casa propia.
Lleva 25 años desarrollando las diversas actividades del campo, paralelo a ello, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda. Pero el trabajo que más le gusta a Julia es la agricultura, debido a que tiene disponibles los productos de sus cosechas en cada temporada para la venta; los producto que ella siembra son la papa y el maíz. A su vez tiene vacas y ovejas que cuida en el establo que implementó en su misma casa.
Julia cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo, y para el futuro desea incrementar sus cultivos con la adquisición de otros terrenos.

Esta es la oportunidad número 13 en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa (alimento de sus animales).
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 7 children in their own house. For 25 years she has been doing diverse farm activities; in parallel, she has a grocery store in her house. But the work she enjoys the most is agriculture since she has the products of her harvests available to sell every season; she plants potato and corn. At the same time, she has cows and sheep that she cares for in the stable she built in her house. Julia has the support of her children and her husband, and in the future, her wish is to increase her crops by acquiring more plots of land. This is the 13th opportunity of a loan with MFP; she is very happy to belong to her community bank and she commits herself, one more time, to make her payments on time. The money she is now requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer to plant alfalfa (feed for her animals).

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma P. est mariée elle est âgée de 70 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY depuis 3 ans et demi et a eu 7 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle Fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diouma P. is 70-years-old and married. She has been a member of the « Banc Villageois » loan group of TOULY for three and a half years and had seven prior successful experiences with loans. She runs a small commerce of seasonal fruit. The activity provides her with income that enables her to participate in improving the family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Floriza

texts.es:
Floriza es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Floriza es soltera, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Floriza vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en un paradero de transporte publico, además los días domingos viaja a la feria de Acosvinchos en donde vende ropa.
Floriza necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Los sueños de Floriza son tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Floriza is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). She is 22 years old, single, and has one child. Floriza sells candy as a street vendor at a public bus stop. In addition, she travels every Sunday to the fair in Acosvinchos to sell clothing.

Floriza needs a loan of 800 soles in order to buy candy. Her dream is to open a wholesale grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa C. has always been spending her loan from ASHI wisely in a business which enables her to have an income for her family. This time, she is requesting for a much larger loan from Kiva through its field partner, ASHI to be able to finance her dream of growing her small variety store business into a big grocery store which can give her customers convenience in accessing their daily basic needs. 

With this loan she is planning to purchase rice and animal feed such as for hog-raising and chicken-raising to be sold in her store. For her family especially for her two children and grandchildren, she really works hard to sustain the business and increase its profit. In this fashion, her family’s way of life will be improved and will be raised above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her variety store.

loans.name: Sayfullo

texts.ru: Джураев Сайфулло проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Сайфулло имеет средне- специальное образование. Работает зав. складом. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. Сажает пшеницу и получив урожай вывозит на рынок. Этой деятельностью занимается уже 9 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Sayfullo J. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Sayfullo has a specialized secondary education and works as a manager of a warehouse. He also does agriculture. He plants wheat and sells the collected harvest on the market. He has been in this business for nine years. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Ya Sarin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of ten people who all live in Khpob Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ya S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Ya S. is a mother of three children who all attend the local public school. She is a pig breeder and her husband is a noodle seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, in order to improve her breeding pig, Mrs. Ya S. is asking for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Katumpe Ole

texts.en:
Katumpe Ole N. is 28 years old. He is married to Norparko N. and he is a father of two school-going children. Katumpe is a farmer and he has been doing this work for the last six years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet-registered client. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to plant more wheat. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat produce.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have his own farm machinery. Katumpe is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To plough the land for wheat planting

loans.name: Belita

texts.en:
Belita S. has been dreaming of pulling her family out of poverty. She does not dream of becoming wealthy, though. Her dreams for her family, especially for her only child who is now 16 years old, are very simple. She hopes for: food on the table every meal for them to share and enjoy, a college degree for her daughter, and a house to shelter them from any form of calamity.  

By growing her manicure and pedicure service through the financial assistance of ASHI loans, she hopes to have more profit to support her hopes and dreams for her family. Now, she goes house to house to serve her customers, yet she is given just a small amount of money for a payment. Someday, she hopes to have her own beauty shop with complete facilities for her customers to enjoy and relax in when they come to her shop. She believes that, if she and her husband (who is a hired carpenter) work hard to earn money, it is possible that they will succeed.

loans.use: To purchase materials to provide manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly D. is a 42-year old married woman who lives in Brgy. Jantianon, Amlan, Negros Oriental. She earns her living with her general store and pig fattening.

Merly's 38 year-old husband, Allan, is a driver and they have three children who are between 13-16 years old. The children go to school and also help their parents in the businesses as part of their daily chores.

Merly joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through a general store and a pig fattening business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 25,500 from her business activities.

Merly is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 30,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store and the pig fattening business.  The loan had a positive impact for both the businesses and the family living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 13th cycle loan in the amount of Php 29,500 which she plans to use for both businesses. Merly is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, Teodora vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que se encuentra a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde tiene una tienda en su casa y vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todo los días, también compra tara y cochinilla que luego de acopiar los vende a un intermediario y la tuna lo envía a la ciudad de Lima. Además Los días domingos vende comida en el estadio de su comunidad. Los sueños de Teodora son construir otra casa de material noble y tener una tienda mas grande porque el que tiene es muy pequeño.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Teodora is single and has one son, who is studying. She lives in Huayllapampa, 30 minutes outside the city of Ayacucho. She has a small shop at her house where she works every day selling groceries, including vegetables and meat. She also buys 'tara' plants and cochineal [a natural dye that grows on the leaves] which she then gathers and sells to a middleman, and sends the prickly pear fruits to the city of Lima. On Sundays she also sells food at the local sports ground. Teodora dreams of building a new home out of better materials, and having a bigger shop, as the one she has is very small. She needs a loan of 1000 soles ($375), which she will invest in buying rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. S. Sophat, 43 years old, lives in Chheal Phlouh village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soy Yiv, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to increase their income to improve and support the family's standard of living, Mrs. S. Sophat decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her new business. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her farming crop. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mohamed S.. Born in a village call Malal Mara, in northern Sierra Leone, this husband and father of eight children is a businessman with a small-scale business in Makeni city. His wife is a businesswoman too and three of his children are attending either primary or secondary schools.

Mohamed has been selling shoes for twenty-two years now. His shoes business has enjoyed a massive growth, thanks to previous SMT/Kiva loans. Nevertheless, he is still not complacent; having repaid his last loan successfully, he now wants a new loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to further improve his business.

With the help of this SLL 3,000,000 loan, Mohamed will be able to buy at least a bale of shoes to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy at least a bale of shoes to add to his stock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita C. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao. She is 58 years old and is married with four adult children. Lolita owns and operates a business planting assorted crops and selling her harvested crops in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for medical purposes. This loan will be her 18th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for medical purposes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 53 años, vive con su pareja Osvaldo de 54 años y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años que tiene un bazar y librería a la vez, ubicada en su propia casa, negocio que la da grandes gratificaciones, pues es su principal ingreso económico para ella y su familia. Desde entonces trata de abastecerse, adquiriendo productos al por mayor siendo útiles de escritorio, adornos y artículos para el hogar. Hay momentos que no cuenta con el producto que busca el cliente, por lo que pierde el cliente, es por ello que desea surtir mejor su tienda con el préstamo.  Alicia Tiene pensado en el futuro mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, techarlo y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos comestibles y útiles, para que los clientes puedan obtener todo lo que necesitan. Es la décima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas porque es muy responsable y además porque no quiere quedar mal con su grupo de trabajo que le han dado mucha confianza. Con el crédito que solicita, tiene pensado comprar mayor cantidad de útiles escolares por campaña ya que empiezan las clases y necesitará abastecerse de esta mercadería.
texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and lives with her fifty-four-year-old partner, Osvaldo, and their two children in their own home. For four years she has run a general store and book store from her home. This business gives her a great deal of satisfaction since it is the main source of income for her family. Since the beginning, she tried to see that the store was well-stocked. She acquires at wholesale stationery supplies and adornments and articles for the home. Sometimes she doesn't have the product a customer wants, and she loses the customer; therefore, she wishes to add to her inventory with this loan. In the future, she wants to improve her store by installing a roof and by offering a wider variety of food and other items, so that her customers can buy what they need. This is her tenth loan from MFP. She promises to make timely payments because she is very responsible and because she doesn't want to disappoint her work group, which has placed much faith in her. With this loan, she plans on purchasing a greater quantity of school supplies for this year. Classes have already begun, and she needs to stock up on this merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan T. N. is 29 years old  and has 2 children who attend secondary school. She is a very hard-working farmer. She grows rice in a paddy of 1,440 square meters and raises 8 pigs. She has been a client of our credit program for 7 years. During that time, she has repaid very well. Currently, she wants a loan to buy food and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy food and fertilizer

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia P. is from the village of Seaside, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Herminia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Herminia owns & operates a business buying and selling used-clothing in the local community. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Herminia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Herminia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tseepil

texts.en:
Tseepil C. is a 24-year-old single woman who lives with her two sisters in their own house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Tseepil had been working as a knitter in the Gobi Co.Ltd until 2009 when she started her own private business by selling a variety of clothes and wool products in a rented stall at the Hantalst trade center. Within a short period of operation, she has built a successful and stable business. Her middle sister works as a teacher in the Mongolian National University while her other sister helps her with the business. She is a very modest woman. She hopes to continue to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase a new sewing machine for her wool knitting production.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok S., 24, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

S. sell Cambodian noodles, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. Her husband is a tuk tuk driver, earning an income of about USD 7 per day. Each month the family spends USD 25 on food, USD 6 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 550 to purchase a new compartment to attach to the motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

[S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.]

loans.use: buy a new compartment to attach to the motorbike

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more Jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Monica is 31 years old and is married to a man who is an NGO staff member. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Raquel Marie

texts.es:
Raquel de 46 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales estudian y trabajan.  Ella labora para la UNAN como docente desde hace 12 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su vivienda, pues los creditos anteriores han sido utilizados para pintar y continuar la construccion de su casa.  En este momento lo que necesita hacer es ponerle el piso a la casa, ademas construir el porche de la casa.  

Expresa sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC y Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que gracias a los creditos ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su casa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 46 years old and married.  She has two children who go to school and work.  She has worked for UNAN (University of Nicaragua) as a teacher for 12 years.

She is requesting her seventh loan to continue making improvements on her house.  The previous loans were used to buy paint and continue building her house.  What she needs to do now is put down the floor of the house and build a porch.

She feels grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva for the support they have given her.  Thanks to the loans she has been able to continue improving her house little by little.

loans.use: Put down a floor and build a porch

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo P. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 40 years old. Leonardo is separated from his spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonardo owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish, like sardines and mackerel, and also shrimp in the local community. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fishes to buy and sell. Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leonardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: María Del Milagro

texts.es: María del Milagro L. D. M. D. 44 años D. edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y con mucha experiencia en lo que se dedica a hacer, vive en el municipio D. Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, una hija y un nieto D. 6 años D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, lugar en el cual durante más D. 5 años ha tratado D. seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que es este el que le permite solventar todos los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo, así mismo comercializa las prendas D. vestir D. forma ambulante. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, sobre todo ropa para jóvenes la cual esta muy D. moda, lo que le permita ser más fácil D. vender. Esto es vital para María ya que la estabilidad D. su hogar depenD. en gran manera D. las ganancias obtenidas por ella. Para María el bienestar D. su familia es primero, razón por la cual cada día D. 8 D. la mañana a 6 D. la tarD. ofrece su producto y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
María del Milagro L. D. M. is 44 years old.  She is a very hard-working person who has a lot of experience in her business.  She lives in the town of Soyapango together with her husband, a daughter and a 6 year-old grandchild.  She owns a business selling men's, women's and children's clothing.
