She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. Ama sells the kenkey with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustin es originario de la comunidad de Juchanep a ocho kilometros de la ciudad procer de Totonicapan su actividad principal es la carpinteria lo vine ejerciento hace mas de treinta años  con todos los conocimientos adquiridos, dos hijos tambien han aprendido y para ello necesita de mas capital para poder surtir su mercaderia en la compra, madera, pintura, clavos, cola blanca ya que tiene un pedido por motivo de la fiesta de la comunida y por las graduaciones en el mes de octubre necesita surtir su mercaderia
texts.en:
Don Agustin is from the community of Juchanep, which is eight kilometers from the city of Totonicapan. He has worked as a carpenter for more than 30 years and has become very knowledgeable over that time. His two children have also learned the trade.

Don Agustin needs additional capital to purchase goods such as wood, paint, nails, and glue. He has received requests for a community festival and a graduation ceremony in the month of October, so he needs these items to complete his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric D. S. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old. Ric is married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ric owns & operates a business venture in the services sector, operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for his business comes primarily from providing hairdressing services to local community members. Ric has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ric joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation as well as his ability to engage in business activities. Ric has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Ric is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve his business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ric from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 34 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 3 hijos de 12, 6, y 2 años. Hace 2 años decidió que la mejor forma de generarse ingresos económicos era con la venta de animales (cerdos). Ella compra estos animales en la feria ganadera de su localidad y luego los vende a precios más altos; en esta oportunidad, como se muestra en la foto, ya no contaba con ningún cerdo, pero cuando no logra venderlos todos, los cuida en su establo durante una semana. 

Cristina cuanta con el apoyo de sus hijos para la venta de sus animales y con la experiencia ganada durante este tiempo aprendió a seleccionar a los cerdos para no ser engañada con animales enfermos. Su deseo a futuro es continuar con este negocio pero incrementar su capital de trabajo. 

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y en su anterior préstamo fue puntual en sus pagos, además de sentirse contenta porque aprendido el valor del trabajo en equipo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más cerdos y aprovechar esta temporada que es cuando se venden con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Cristina is 34 years old. She lives in her parents home with her 3 children ages12, 6, and 2 years. Two years ago she decided that the best economic way to generate income was with the sale of animals (hogs). She buys these animals in the livestock market of her area and then she sells them for higher prices. In this endeavor, as she is shown in the photo (although without any hogs), when she fails to sell them all, she takes care of them in her stable for a week. Cristina counts on the income from the sale of her animals for the support of her children. With the experience she has gained during this time she has learned to select the best hogs and not to be deceived by sick animals. Her wish for the future is to continue in this business and to increase her working capital. This is the second opportunity in which she has requested a loan from MFP. In her previous loan she was punctual with her payments, besides being happy because she learned the value of teamwork. The money that she now requests will be used to purchase more hogs and to take advantage of this season when they are sold with greater frequency.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more hogs that she sells.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es madre soltera, tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa de un tío de avazada edad en el caserío La Capilla Central de Ñaupe, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas quince minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años es propietaria de una pequeña bodega que funciona en su casa. Allí vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite). La continua demanda de sus vecinos por los productos que ofrece ha hecho que se vea en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos y ampliar su negocio.

Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que siempre trata se sacarlo adelante, por otro lado es de importancia para la comunidad en donde vive ya que es el único establecimiento de ese tipo en la zona.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hijo mayor terminar la carrera técnica de farmacia que con mucho esfuerzo le está brindando. Además desea ver convertirse a sus otros dos hijos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 43-year-old single mother. She lives with her three children in the house of an elderly uncle in the La Capilla Central de Ñaupe neighborhood in Olmos District, located two hours and fifteen minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, she has been the proprietor of a small grocery store in her home, where she sells basic items like rice, sugar and oil. She has steady demand from her neighbors for her products, so for the first time she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 soles so that she can buy more products and expand her business. This business is her family's main source of income, so Sabina is always trying to grow it. It is also very important within the community where she lives, since it is the only business of its kind in the area. Her greatest dream is for her oldest son to finish his studies at technical school, where thanks to her efforts he is currently studying Pharmacy. She also wants to see her other children grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic goods to expand her grocery store

location.town: Capilla Central de Ñaupe - Olmos - Lambayeque

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela has owned and managed a mini-canteen for a long time. Her canteen has been her way of helping her husband to provide for the needs of their children. Angela sells different kinds foods in their village. She is now borrowing PHP 8,000 from the KIVA lenders to buy cooking ingredients and improve her business. She hopes that the lenders will grant her request so she can also meet the demands of her customers. 

Angela is 40 years old and married. She is blessed with five children. They live in the village of San Isidro in Ilagan, Isabela. Angela and her supportive husband dream of improving their living condition and experiencing a more comfortable life. They hope that, through their business, they will able to achieve what they have only dreamed.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es: El señor Elvis L. trabaja como cadete de un taxi que es propio el cual desde hace cinco años lo trabaja, anteriormente tenia un negocio de venta de sorbete, también trabajaba como cargador en una bodega, con ahorros y ayuda de sus hermanos logro comprar el vehiculo. Ya que dos de sus hermanos están en los Estados de América el cual con remesas logro recoger y ponerse a trabajar. Como todo trabajo la clientela ha bajado, debido al desempleo en nuestro país, pero hay día buenos y también hay que recorrer varios kilómetros para poder hallar cliente. Tiene 36 años de edad, con tres hijos los cuales estudian para un mejor futuro. Su esposa vende ropa, cosmético el cual lo apoyo con los gastos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz, teléfono entre otros gastos de los niños. Con este financiamiento quiere dar mantenimiento al vehiculo, comprar llantas, pintura y enderezado en la parte de atrás que tiene malo el taxi para poder dar un mejor servicio de carrera al cliente. Contento por l aprobación del crédito el cual será para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvis L. works as a taxi driver, with his own taxi. He has had this business for five years. Previously, he had an ice cream business and also worked as a stock clerk in a small shop. With his savings and the help of his brothers, he managed to buy his vehicle. Two of his brothers are in the U.S., and sent money to help him start his business.

Now, the number of customers is down as in all businesses, due to the unemployment problem in the country. Still, there are good days, though he often has to drive farther to find customers.

Elvis is 36 years old, with three children who are studying for a better future. His wife sells clothes and cosmetics, which helps with household expenses like water, electricity, telephone, and expenses for the children.

This loan will go toward maintenance of the taxi: tires, paint, and body repair in the back. This will give better service to the customers. Elvis is happy he was approved for this loan which will help the well being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tires, body repair, and paint for taxi

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
María Benita es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 48 años, es madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es operador de maquinaria pesada.
Marìa se dedica diariamente a la venta de jugos desde la vereda de su casa y forma parte del Banco  Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar telas, elásticos y adornos para vestidos.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sillas, mesas y utensilios para implementar su negocio. 
El sueño de María es hacer màs conocido su quiosco de jugos y néctares.
texts.en:
María Benita is a dynamic and collaborative member who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha in the region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, is the mother of four older children, and has the support of her husband who is an operator of heavy machinery. María dedicates herself every day to selling juices from the sidewalk in front of her house. She has been a part of the community bank "Las Fresitas" for eight years. The first loan the she received was for 300 PEN with which she was able to buy fabrics, elastic, and adornments for dresses. Currently, she needs a loan of 3,000 PEN with which she will buy chairs, tables, and tools to set up her business. María's dream is to make her juice kiosk better known.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and tools to set up her business

loans.name: Evelyn Rosaura

texts.es: La señorita Rosaura es originaria del municipio de Totonicapan con residencia en la zona cuatro del mismo municipio su principal fuente de ingreso es la elaboracion y venta de pan en casa en casa dicho oficio lo aprendio de su querido padres desde cuando hera una ñina con los ingreso que obtiene ha colaborado economicamente en los gastos de la familia hoy necesita del apoyo de la institucion ASDIR en un credito para incrementar su capital para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosaura is from the Totonicapán municipality, and she lives in Zone four in the same municipality. Her primary source of income is making and selling bread from house to house. She learned this job from her dear parents when she was a girl. She has used the income she gets to help with the family expenses. She now needs help from the ASDIR Institution. She needs a loan to increase her capital to be able to satisfy her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Ramon Daniel

texts.es:
El Señor Ramón Daniel D., Labora como Mercado logó en el Dpto. de Capacitación del Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, el tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado un créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 1 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y para terminar de  construir un baño por lo que este se encontraba en mal estado.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Daniel D. works as a market specialist in the Training Department of the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He has one school-aged child in his care, is married, and has worked with CEPRODEL for one year. Over this period of time, he has invested 1 loan into making improvements to the house where he lives. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he is an excellent client. The loan requested would be invested into purchasing construction materials such as: cement, iron, and items to finish building a bathroom to replace an existing one that is in a state of disrepair. His goal is to provide greater security and a higher standard of living for his child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to, and to expand, his house.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Genesis, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, an area known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Juana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling work boots, women's shoes, assorted clothing and perfumes by purchasing merchandise to sell in her ambulatory business. She will use the profits to invest in food for her family and shoes for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy boots, shoes, clothes and perfumes

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Delia es soltera, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Delia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12de abril en donde vende cereales variados, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Delia son seguir trabajando y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the communal bank Las Brisas. She is single, 35 years old, and has four children. She has a booth in the 12 de Abril market where she sells various cereals every day. Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of cereals. Delia's dreams are to continue working and to have her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yamoussa Dembélé  est âgé de 27 ans, marié et sans enfant, il réside avec son épouse à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Yamoussa Dembélé a très vite abandonné les études pour des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, qu’il décida d’apprendre le métier de tailleur brodeur depuis l’année 2002. Son atelier de couture se trouve devant son domicile à Sanoubougou I où il dispose déjà 4 machines dont une machine de broderie et trois machines simples. 
Monsieur Dembélé est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui,  il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter une machine de broderie dans le souci de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yamoussa Dembélé is 27 years old and married, but he has no children. He lives with his wife in Sanoubougou 1, one of the popular districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Yamoussa Dembélé abandoned his studies at a very early stage in favour of finding an income generating activity. Only after having unsuccessfully carried out a number of activities did he decide to learn the trade of a tailor/embroiderer in 2002. In his sewing workshop, which is just in front of his house in Sanoubougou 1, he already has four machines, one of which is an embroidery machine and the others simple sewing machines. Mr. Dembélé is in great demand from his customers owing to the quality of his service. In order to satisfy better the ever increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance company, with which he in on his first individual loan. With this first loan he is planning on buying an embroidery machine in order to respond to customer demand which continues to increase. He hopes, by taking up this loan, to make a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA which will be used primarily to expand his business, to contribute to family expenses and to pay the interest on the loan; he will invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new embroidery machine

loans.name: Mallika

texts.en:
Mallika is a 55-year-old woman living with her husband and two children in the town of Dickwella, Sri Lanka.

Mallika has a business growing bananas, which she runs with her husband, and they have done this for a long time now. The household is entirely dependent on their income from banana cultivation. Over the years, Mallika has developed a good knowledge of agriculture, and considers herself to be an innocent and honest lady.

Mallika is seeking a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC to expand her enterprise. In fact, this will be Mallika's 3rd loan with BRAC, as she has successfully received and repaid loans in the past. In the future, Mallika and her husband hope to be able to provide employment to another person in the community through the expansion of their business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products to aid her banana cultivation

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
61-year-old Roberto L. is a hardworking fisherman. Despite losing his wife, he continues to go on with his life. He has four children to take care of. He dreams of his fishing business prospering so that he will be able to help improve his family’s living conditions.

Roberto is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used to buy fishnets and other fishing tackle. This loan will truly help Roberto achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and other fishing tackle.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. A. is fifty years old.She is married and has eight children between the ages of twenty two years old and thirty five years old. Her business is located at Musoli, a busy market place in Kakamega. She sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics to the local people. She says although this business is good there is a lot of competition and low purchasing power of the people in the area. This is the reason why she has decided to diversify her business by getting into the motor cycle transport business(Boda boda). 

She is using her loan of KES 85,000 to purchase a motor cycle. She, however, hopes that in the future she will be able to open boutiques in other areas and to make more income to educate her children at the university. She also hopes to purchase a plot of land of her own. She is a very hardworking person and describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur, Mrs. Arlyn T., is a single-seat motorcab operator and an owner of a sari-sari store. She is 29 years old, married to Mr. Yoshihiro T. of Japan (a government employee), and blessed with one infant-aged child. She is a resident of P1 Garang, Tangub City. Even though she received a monthly allowance from her husband, Arlyn still had a passion for business. At present, she has a sari-sari store with an average net income of 1,500 PHP per month, and has two single-seat motorcabs for hire that bring in an average income of 240 PHP daily. These earnings are so helpful in supporting her family. Arlyn joined Kiva partner, PMPC, in 2009. She was given the privilege of borrowing 25,000 PHP as her first loan, which was used to purchase a single motorcab for hire. This time, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to add to her capital for her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to make her loan repayments and also as savings for future use. She is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a widow with two adult children. When her husband died working in a coal mine, she needed to generate income herself to raise her children. Olga moved to another town and started a small business selling clothing. She has been in this business now for eight years. The business is working well, she has a good location and many customers who keep returning.
Olga would like to purchase a second location for her business. She needs to borrow 10,000 UAH to do so. She is going to create a workplace for her daughter to allow her to generate income for her own family.

loans.use: To purchase a second business location

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Phun L., 50, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells fish and earns about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow their rice field. She plans to use any additional profits to support the children’s education.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. L.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Ramdie

texts.en:
Ramdie L. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 39 years-old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Ramdie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bamboo products in the local community. Ramdie has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ramdie joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramdie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ramdie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Ramdie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old and is single. To make a living, Guillerma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says she is happy to be helping her family financially.

Guillerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Guillerma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita  P. is 54 and married with 9 children (ages 14 - 32).  She owns a business venture, providing suit-making services and doing 'elei' prinitng (on cloth) for local community members.  Makerita  has many years of experience in this business.  Makerita  needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials & some paints for making the 'elei'.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2005, Makerita  joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Makerita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials & 'elei' printing materials & paints

loans.name: Cu

texts.en: Cu  T. T. is 38 years old and has 2 children who are at high school. She has a grocery shop in her village. Her business started in 2000. Since that time, her shop has provided a stable income with which she can manage her family life. As a client of our credit program, she is very dynamic. Currently, she needs 8,938,000 VND to buy products to meet the growing demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy products to meet customer demand

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong T., 42, is married and lives with her four young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver making $3 each day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Hong T. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband’s motorbike. This will allow him to transport more people at one time.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Jacob Saulo

texts.en:
Jacob Saulo is 22 years old and single. He has been in the business of selling eggs since 2007 in Kariobangi, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. His clients are mostly shopkeepers, who buy his eggs wholesale, and residents within that area.

He has never borrowed from any other micro-finance institution (MFI) and was introduced to KADET LTD by another client. He is happily applying for his second loan of Kshs. 30,000 with KADET. With this loan, Jacob plans to boost his business by purchasing more eggs, as this will enable him to serve his customers well. In the urban setting, eggs are a protein food that is very affordable for the majority of people in the community, and for this reason he believes that it is a profitable business.

His main aim in the future is to grow his business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando L. is from the village of Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 50 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Rolando owns a motorcycle transportation business. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rolando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Rolando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair vehicle and improve service

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 38 years old and married with seven children. Donathile's husband does not have a job. That's why she has to work hard in order to get everything her family needs. Before starting her business, she was not able to get whatever she needed. Now that she is in the business, she is able. This is her 12th year successful in her business and the hours of her business are from 8 in the morning to 4 in the evening every day. In this business, Donathile employs two people from her community.

Donathile is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing more bales of clothes, which will allow her to earn more profits with large quantities of clothes to be sold.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Nelsa Abigail

texts.es: La señora Nelsa Abigail M. A., tiene la edad de 54 años es una mujer adulta, madre soltera de una hija mayor de edad, casada que labora en el exterior pero apoya a su madre en los gastos en los que esta incurre, ella habita en una humilde casa del municipio de Esquipulas, es para su vivienda que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales que le permitan la instalacion de una malla en el muro de la parte trasera de su hogar, que brinde una mayor seguridad, y a futuro las comodidades necesarias para recibir a la familia de su único hijo, y/o un lugar digno donde habitar sus días de retiro.
texts.en: Sra. Nelsa Abigail M. A., 54, is a single mother.  Her daughter, married and working abroad, helps her mother with daily expenses.  Sra. Nelsa lives in a small house in the township of Esquipulas.  She is applying for a loan to improve the house.  She wants to buy materials for building a screen on the wall behind the house, a project that will make the house safer.  She wants the house to be more comfortable in case she has to take in the family of her only son and to give herself a decent place to live her retirement.

loans.use: Install a security screen.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn B. is from the village of Tapican, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 26 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Jenalyn owns & operates a retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jenalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
la sra. Martha R. S. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, dichas tortillas son por encargo ya que son especiales para elaborar TACOS FRITOS, asi mismo elabora para la venta en su casa de habitación en la Colonia Flor del Campo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de sus tortillas.
las ganancias las necesita para comprar unos materiales de construccion para remodelas unas paredes en su casa de habitacion, ya que con las fuertes lluvias de los meses de septiembre y octubre su casa se vio afectada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Ramírez S., 52, lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood and is a tortilla merchant.  The tortillas are sold by special order because they are special and used to make Tacos Fritos (fried tacos).  She makes the tortillas in her house located in Flor del Campo.

She will use the loan to buy tortilla making ingredients.

She needs the profits to buy building materials and supplies to repair some of the walls in her house because they were damaged by the heavy rainfall in September and October.

loans.use: To buy firewood, flour, water, lime powder.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. has a pharmaceutical shop at Abura. Nana has received a senior high education. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more drugs to fill her shop. She wishes to increase her business with the additional income.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to fill her shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. was born on the 06/28/1958, she is married to N. Jacob Fon and they are blessed with six children and live in Azire New Church, a quarter in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon.

Alice has faced some challenges in life. The most difficult have been the problem of paying for her house rent and building a house of her own.  She plans to invest this loan in frying akra beans, gateau, sales of row food stuff, purchase of sugar, palm oil, groundnut oil, salt, flour and some plates. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Alice will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy coki beans, flour, sugar, groundnut oil, salt, and firewood.

loans.name: Sucy Missel

texts.es:
la joven Sucy C. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Carrizo Marcovia y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tambien se dedica a la venta de gallinas.
tiene 3 años de tener su negocio y con la venta de gallinas lo hace en Choluteca ahi vende a varios clientes los cules tienen comedores.
Sucy trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su hija y al mismo tiempo que su negocio crezca.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que tiene su negocio con el cual obtiene ganancias para poder darle lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Sucy C. is 22 years old.  She lives in the village of Carrizo Marcovia and sells daily use items.  She has a small grocery store in her house.  She also sells chickens.

She has had her store for three years and she sells the chickens in Choluteca to several customers who have eateries.

Sucy works hard to support her daughter and to grow her business.

She will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

She commented to us that she feels very happy because she has her business with which she obtains profits to be able to provide her daughter with everything she needs.

loans.use: To buy wheat and corn flour, beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, soups, pastas, sauces, lard, oil, eggs, salt, condiments, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juices, sweets, margarine and shampoo.

loans.name: Luis Jhonathan

texts.es: Luis es soltero tiene 21 años de edad vive en casa de su tia ubicada en la calle Santa Isabel el se inicio como chofer de manera dependiente aproximadamente tres años actualmente cuenta con dos mototaxis propias la cual una trabaja él de forma independiente y la otra da en alquiler el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para el mantenimiento y reforzamiento de su dos mototaxis, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Luis is single and is 21 years old.  He lives in his aunt's home, located on Santa Isabel Street.  He began working as a driver, as an employee, about three years ago.  He now owns two motorcycle taxis. He uses one to work independently and rents out the other.  The financing he is granted will be used for maintenance and improvements on both of his motorcycle taxis.  He is receiving this financing because of his strong references and his will and ability to repay it.

loans.use: Maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is a young woman from Jenin city. Tahreer is married and has no children, Tahreer decided to start treatment in order to have a baby.

As Tahreer, who is photographed in the picture above in FATEN's office, and her husband are working in a police force with a decent salary that doesn't cover the treatment's expenses, she decided to take a loan from FATEN to pay for the fertility drugs and repay on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To cover fertility drugs and treatment

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom K., 34 years old, is a humble villager living in the capital of Cambodia, Phnom Penh. Prom K. is married and blessed with a young school-aged child, while her husband is a soldier in the province of Kompong Speu. 

To earn a living, Prom K. sells many kinds of products around her community such as soft drinks, food, cooking ingredients, perfume, plastic products, and some essential products. She is able to earn a profit of around $2.50 a day to help support the entire family. 

Recently, this family is not comfortable because their fence is getting old, and it often needs to be repaired. She also says that she really wants to build a new one, but her cash on hand is not enough. To solve this problem, Prom K. is asking for a loan to build a new fence.

loans.use: To build a new fence.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Doña María, D. 58 años D. edad, resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y pupusería, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos.
Los negocios los inicio hace 3 años, y actualmente quiere invertir en los cosméticos, comprando productos D. belleza y artículos para el uso personal, este será un gran impulso al negocio, fortalecerá y garantizara mejor sus ganancias.

Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio, proveer siempre lo necesario para sus hijos, velando por todas las necesidades basicas.
texts.en:
María, 58, lives in Concepción Batres, Usulután Department.  She sells cosmetics and has a pupusería (Salvadoran fast food); she lives with her husband and two children.

She started her businesses three years ago and she currently wants to invest in cosmetics buying beauty products for personal use.  This will be a big push for her business that will strengthen it and guarantee better profits.

Her goal is to expand the business, to always proviD. what is best for her children and to see to all their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
In the rural areas of Kompong Chhnang province, fishing is the most popular career. Roeun R. and his wife have spent most of their lives catching fresh fish in local lakes and rivers using a variety of fishing equipment. This work generates an average daily income of 3.75 USD that the couple uses to support the whole family.

Roeum is requesting a loan to buy fish traps and purchase a used motorbike to transport his catch to the local market as his current motorcycle is broken.

loans.use: to purchase fish traps and a motorcyle for transport

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben K., 29, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. K. buys chickens to resell, earning an income of about USD 7 per day. His wife sells bamboo at home, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 60 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase supplies to run a cafe. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy supplies to run a cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 36 years old. Mary Jane is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, breads, biscuits, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Rayen Mapu Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Rayen Mapu” y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, pero principalmente venta de ropa usada y nueva, además de artesanía. 
María quien en la foto aparece en el centro del grupo, vistiendo un chaleco color verde y su cabello tomado. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas, cervezas, cigarrillos, confites y alimentos, todos estos productos los vende puerta a puerta en un sector rural de la ciudad de Temuco, puesto que en el campo no hay negocios, para esto María traslada su mercadería en una camioneta.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas cada 15 días. María se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 2 años. 
Con el préstamo comprará bebidas, cervezas y fardos de ropa usada, ya que también aprovecha de vender ropa en el campo. 
Sus metas en su negocio son seguir invirtiendo en mercadería para abastecer a éstos sectores rurales de productos, ya que sus clientes no cuentan con un local establecido para comprar. 
María vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 15, 10 y 2 años de edad.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta de las reuniones a las que asiste, ya que ha aprendido a organizar sus gastos e ingresos de su negocio y la grata compañía de las demás socias del banco comunal. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Rayen Mapu” and it has 18 members who live in the city of Temuco.  They all work in different businesses but they mainly sell used and new clothes and make handicrafts.

María appears in the center of the group wearing a green cardigan with her hair tied back.  Her business is selling drinks, beer, cigarettes, chocolates and food.  She sells all these products door to door in a rural sector of the city of Temuco since there aren't any businesses in the countryside.  María transports her merchandise in a truck.

María buys her merchandise in wholesale supermarkets every two weeks.  She has been in this business for two years.  She will use her loan to buy drinks and beer, and bundles of used clothes since she also sells clothes in the countryside.  Her goals for her business are to continue investing in merchandise so that she can supply these rural sectors with products since her customers don't have an established store where they can buy goods.

María lives with her husband and her three children aged 15, 10 and 2.

María is very happy and grateful for the support that Fondo Esperanza have offered her since her loans have allowed her to invest in her business.  She also likes the meetings that she attends since she has learned how to organize her business incomings and outgoings and she enjoys the pleasant company of the other members of her bank.

Temuco is the capital of Araurcanía region.  The city is located 670km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the surrounding areas there are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and very striking native flora and fauna in nearby nature reserves.  50% of the country's population of mapuches (indigenous people) live in this region.

loans.use: to buy drinks, beer and bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. En el distrito de Yarinacocha en la ciudad de Pucallpa, se encuentra el negocio de Sarita, su puesto esta ubicado en la plaza de la comunidad, en donde vende gallinas y pollos, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es alimentar a sus aves, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, planea alquilar una tienda donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad a la hora de atenderlos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más alimento para sus aves.
texts.en:
Sarita is 21 years old.  She is a very cheerful and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home and is ready to work very hard in order to do well in life.

Sarita's business is to be found in the city of Pucallpa, in Yarinacocha district.  Her stall is located in the square in her community.  Here she sells hens and chickens which are very well fed and well cared for.  For this reason, she has a lot of customers and her income is good.  What she most likes about her work is feeding her birds since she raises them with a lot of affection.  She has been in this business for three years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her stall all day waiting for customers.  In the future, she plans to rent a store where she can provide her customers with more comfort as she serves them.

This will be Sarita's second loan from MFP.  She knows that she must make her repayments on time and she is ready to do this.  Sarita is a very cheerful and responsible member of her community bank.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more feed for her birds.

loans.use: to buy feed for her birds

loans.name: Angelica Cecilia

texts.es: Angélica Cecilia tiene 36 años, su forma de salir adelante es muy humilde. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y disfruta cada día de su actividad como es la panadería, Angélica tiene 5 años de administrar su negocio. Inicio por su esposo quien tenía los conocimientos fue así que juntos decidieron iniciar este medio de vida y proporcionarles a sus hijos los ingresos que necesitan, Angélica tiene 2 hijos a su cargo de 13 y 15 años respectivamente. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mantequilla, queso, harina, sartenes, leche, huevos entre otros.
texts.en: Angélica Cecilia is 36 years old.  Her way of making a living is very humble.  She is a hard-working woman who enjoys working in her bakery.  Angélica has been running her business for five years.  She started out through her husband who had knowledge in this area.  Together they decided to set up a business and provide their children with the income they need.  Angélica has two children in her care who are 13 and 15 years old.  She has requested this loan to buy butter, cheese, flour, skillets, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy butter, cheese, flour, skillets, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Encarnación, con doce miembros, está el comité denominado Kuña Guapa, el cual viene trabajando con la Fundación desde el año 2007. Todas las miembros van creciendo dentro del comité, dentro de un ambiente de respeto y responsabilidad. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo numero once.
Las mujeres son muy trabajadoras, desde el primer ciclo han demostrado su responsabilidad y entusiasmo. Todas están con miras hacia un objetivo común, que es el de generar mayores ingresos, con lo cual podrán mejorar su nivel de vida.
La Sra Angelica tiene una despensa, ella es muy conocida en el barrio ya qyue la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre van a comprar de su tiendita. Por medio de este negocio ha podido obtener un poco mas de ingresos con lo cual puede abastecer su negocio y mejorar su estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su despensa con comestibles, lácteos, bebida y demás.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee has 12 members and is located in the city of Encarnación.  The group have been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2007.  All the members are growing within the committee, in an environment of respect and responsibility.  They are currently on their eleventh loan cycle.

The women are very hard working.  Since their first loan cycle they have shown responsibility and enthusiasm.  They are all aiming towards a common goal which is to make more income so that they can improve their standard of living.

Angelica has a grocery store.  She is very well known in her neighborhood as most of her neighbors come to buy from her small store.  Through this business, she has been able to earn a little more income which she can use to stock her business and improve her lifestyle.

Angelica is requesting a loan to stock her store with groceries, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Edferina's Group

texts.en:
Edferina is 49 years old, married and has a daughter who is studying in class 5th. Edferina has studied until intermediate. She operates a tuition center at her home and teaches different subjects to her students. She is also a very good housewife.She performs her household duties very actively and takes care of her child very well.  Her husband works in a government sector for a low income. 
 
Edferina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her tuition center. With the loan, she will buy furniture and books to provide better learning facilities to her students. 
  
She has been operating her tuition center for the past four years and hopes that after the loan, she will be able to provide better facilities to her students and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy furniture and books

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Elsie has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, canned goods and breads. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena integrante y tesorera del Banco comunal “La Santiago” perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Centr4al, ciudad de Santiago. Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 15 años, específicamente venta de confites, estas las realiza en un carro en las afueras de un colegio. Trabaja de lunes a viernes durante algunas horas en la mañana y durante la tarde. Los fines de semana, vende sus productos en una feria libre. Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda son durante los meses de marzo y abril, el resto de los meses las ventas se mantienen y durante el mes de octubre tienden a disminuir. 
Su mercadería la compra en la vega (lugar de abundante comercio de productos del campo y distribuidoras que surten a comerciantes).
Con el crédito comprará confites y también invertirá en pequeñas banderas chilenas para adornar los autos en fiestas patrias. Su marido es quien confecciona y vende banderas chilenas para la temporada de Fiestas patrias. 
Sus metas en su negocio son contar con un carro más grande, que le permita abastecer su negocio de más mercadería.
Ximena vive junto a su marido y sus cuatro hijos de 20, 15, 12 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia, para esto ya se encuentra gestionando la documentación, ya que quiere comprar la vivienda en la cual vive junto a su familia. Otro de sus sueños es costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos, para que sean profesionales. 
Ximena está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos de Fondo Esperanza, ya que le han permitido invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, estas le han permitido implementarlas en su negocio. Además paralelamente se encuentra participando de unos talleres de micro emprendimiento.
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
Ximena is a member of the Communal Bank "La Santiago", and is the Bank's treasurer.  The bank is in the community of "Estación Central", in the city of Santiago.  She has been working in business for the last 15 years, specifically selling candy, which she does from a cart outside a school.  She works Monday through Friday, for several hours in the morning and afternoon.  On weekends, she sells her products at the open market.  She comments that her high demand season is during March and April; in the other months sales stay steady, and during the month of October they tend to decrease.

She purchases her merchandise in the "meadow" (a place with many agricultural products and distributors who supply the traders).  With her loan, she will buy candy and also invest in small Chilean flags for decorating cars during patriotic holidays.  Her husband makes and sells Chilean flags for the patriotic holiday season.

Her goals for her business are to have a larger cart which would allow her to stock more merchandise for her business.

Ximena lives with her husband and her three sons aged 20, 15, 12, and 3.  Her dream on a personal level is to buy her own home.  She is already putting together the documentation, as she wants to buy the house in which she and her family are currently living.  Another of her dreams is to pay for higher education for her children, so that they may become professionals.

Ximena is very happy and grateful for the loans from Fondo Esperanze, as they have allowed her to invest in her business.  In regards to the trainings held at the Communal Bank meetings, she has been able to put these into place in her business.  Additionally, she also participates in several workshops for micro-entrepreneurship.

Estación Central is a community located in a central area of Santiage (the capital of Chile).  The community takes its name from the Central Railway Station, which dates back to 1887 and was declared a National Monument in 1983.  In its early days, this station, together with the Mapocho station, was the entrance to the capital for the Valparaíso -  Santiago route, and also routes from the southern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy candy, and also invest in small Chilean flags for decorating cars during the patriotic holidays.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 26 años de edad, convive con Julián de 29 años y tienen un hijo en etapa escolar llamado Ezequiel de 05 años, y juntos residen en la localidad de Sirenachayocc donde cuentan con casa propia y lo que más desean es brindarle una comodidad a su hijo. Sarita, acentúa que todo lo que va obteniendo es a base de tenacidad y entrega a sus cultivos de cacao, café y ajonjolíes, es por ello que trata de dar el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones y bajo esa premisa es que muchos de sus compradores se han sentido satisfechos  por la calidad de sus producto agrícolas, sin embargo ella trata de esmerarse a diario y le dedica buen tiempo a sus sembrios y lo realiza conjuntamente con la ayuda de su pareja, sin embargo en tiempos de cosecha necesariamente contrata jornaleros para acelerar en la extracción de sus productos y fruto a su esfuerzo cotidiano está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos. Sarita con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de cacao ya que tiene previsto injertarlos a medida que van desarrollándose. Su plan a futuro es invertir sus ingresos en otro tipo de negocios como crianza de cuyes. Este es será su primer crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con el rol de sus cronogramas de pago. Con el dinero del crédito adquirirá plantas de cacao para ampliar sus sembrios y así obtener mayores ingresos posteriormente.
texts.en:
Sarita is 26 years old. She lives with her partner Julian who is 29 years old and Ezequiel, their school-aged child who is 5 years old. They live in the town of Sirenachayocc where they have their own house. What they most want is to provide their son with a comfortable environment. Sarita emphasizes that everything she obtains is through her tenacity and devotion to her cocoa, coffee and sesame crops. It is for this reason that she tries to give her crops the best possible care and under this premise many of her buyers have been satisfied by the quality of her agricultural products. Nevertheless, she strives to do her best every day and devotes a good amount of time to her crops. She does this with the help of her partner. However, at harvest time she has to hire labourers to speed up the harvesting process in their daily efforts to obtain a good income. With the requested loan, Sarita will buy more cocoa plants and hopes to graft them as they grow. Her future plan is to invest her income in other businesses such as guinea pig breeding. This will be her first loan and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support. She is willing to comply promptly with her repayment schedule. With the loan she will acquire cocoa plants to expand her crops and obtain higher revenues later.

.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 62 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  She is living in her own house in Masindi, Uganda. Her family goal is to have a commercial buliding in town for business purposes.

Joyce is a markert vendor dealing in clothing sales.  She has been in this business for seven years. Joyce started by buying one bundle of clothing  materials but now she buys five bundles which she can sell within two months.  Her hardships in the business are bad weather leading to poor sales or no sales at all, and bad roads making transport expensive.   Her dream is to have a boutique.

The purpose of this loan is to buy a plot in town.

loans.use: buy a plot in town

loans.name: Oliftamo

texts.ru: Олифтамо проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 38 лет. Она замужем. Занимается животноводством десять лет. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Oliftamo lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 38 years old and married.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for ten years.  Oliftamo breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 38 años de edad, es casado con cuatro hijos.

Él se ha dedicado toda la vida a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, fríjol, maicillo, etc. Estas actividades fueron aprendidas de sus padres. Él debe adquirir los insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes y abono para el maíz, por lo que debe recorrer unos 18 kilómetros desde su comunidad hasta el lugar donde los compra en autobús.

El señor Mario solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para la compra de fertilizantes, para el cultivo de maíz y para pago de mano de obra. Esto le permitirá obtener una buena cosecha y garantizar la alimentación de su familia, él venderá una parte de la producción para cancelar el préstamo y la otra la ahorrara, ya que él desea mejorar su casa e instalar la energía eléctrica. Además de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación y seguir trabajando con Fundación Campo.
texts.en:
Mario, 38, is married and has four children.  He’s spent his entire life farming; he grows corn, beans, sorghum, etc.  He learned these activities from his parents.  He must acquire farming supplies like fertilizer and manure for the roots and to do so he must take an 18 kilometer bus trip from his community to the place where he buys his supplies.

Mario is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy fertilizer for his corn crops and to pay labor costs.  This will allow him to have a good harvest and guarantee his family’s food.  He will sell part of his production to repay the loan and will save the other part because he wants to make some home improvements; he wants to install electricity in addition to providing schooling for his children and continuing to work with Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Elivase

texts.en: Elivase is 26 years old and married with two children, aged 3 and 8. He runs a store where he sells hardware. He has been running this business for four years, and it has helped him provide for his family and increase his standard of living. The loan will be used to increase his inventory. He hopes to use the profits to make savings for his future and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy scrap for sale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 50 years old and has been farming actively for more than 15 years in his home area of Litein, which is the South Rift region of Kenya. He is married with 4 children, all of whom are in school. His farm produces milk, pineapples, and tea, which he sells to the local market. He also has low-cost rental houses that provide him with additional income. He currently employs two farmhands.

Julius has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says the additional cow will help him raise his income, part of which he plans to use to construct a modern dairy unit for his cows. This is his second loan with Juhudi, following his first of 30,000 KES.

Julius laments of lack of dairy feed, especially during dry seasons. He remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support it gives farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon, 62, the mother of six children, is a local rice cultivator from Kompong Speu province. Since her husband passed away, she has worked hard to raise her children alone but the family’s condition is not so good. Currently, some of her daughters work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. They are honest with their mother and regularly send a part of their salary home to help meet the financial needs. In the past few months, one of her children got engaged to be married in December, but Suon has inadequate capital to prepare for this wedding ceremony. Now she would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for the wedding expenses. She would like to say thanks to all lenders for their kind help.

loans.use: to pay for the wedding expenses.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, age 46, owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different home-use products to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PhP 5,000. She lives with her husband and childn in Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
 
She has requested a loan of PhP 30,000 to purchase products to offer for sale in her store. Julieta is been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria, solicita un nuevo préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir el negocio, ella se decidió por la necesidad de incrementar su inventario de productos, espera que con la compra sean mejores ventas y la respuesta con una buena atención a los clientes, ella comprará huevos, embutidos, gaseosas, jugo, galletas y boquitas, esperando tener buenos resultados y una mejor rentabilidad en este nuevo proyecto, ella logró tener un efecto positivo del préstamo anterior, ha mejorado el negocio y la condición de su familia.
texts.en: Gloria is asking for a new loan to use in the purchase of staple products to stock her store. She decided to ask for a loan as she needed to expand her inventory of products. She hopes that with this purchase her sales will be better and she will respond with good customer service. She will buy eggs, cured meats and sausages, soft drinks, juices, biscuits and snacks. She is hoping for good results and improved profitability with this new project. She managed to achieve a positive effect with the previous loan; her business has improved as has her family's situation.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cured meats and sausages, soft drinks, juices, biscuits and snacks.

loans.name: Unión Y Fuerza Group

texts.es: Valentina tiene 36 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos los cuales aún son menores de edad. Lleva 2 años como socia de Edaprospo y se dedica a la artesanía de pulseras con el cual lleva 4 años en este negocio. Comenzó con la finalidad de poder superarse y obtener ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado abastecerse con algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar. Sus ingresos los destina a los gastos de alimentación y al pago de agua y luz. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un local propio para su negocio de artesanía. Valentina piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la compra de mercadería ya que por campaña navideña sus ventas se incrementan. Ella pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Unión y Fuerza” con el cual lleva 4 meses como presidenta del grupo el cual esta conformado por 8 socias y que se formo por parte de la visita de uno de los analistas.
texts.en:
Valentina is 36 years old, single, and has three young children. She has been a member of EDAPROSPO for two years and has been in the business of selling handcrafted bracelets for four years. Valentina started working with the intention of succeeding and generating income to cover her needs. Through effort and work, she was able to purchase a few appliances for her home. Her income goes toward paying for food, water, and electricity. Valentina’s plan for the future is to open her own shop for her craft business. She plans to use this loan to buy merchandise for the Christmas season so that she can increase her sales.

Valentina is a member of the Communal Bank “Unión y Fuerza” (Unity and Strength) where she has served as president for the past four months. The group consists of eight members and was formed by one of the analysts.

loans.use: to buy craft merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius  is a 26-year-old greengrocer in Bamburi, Mombasa. 

He is married and the father of two children.  He has been operating a green grocery stall for the past two years and he is doing great. Since he was introduced to KADET, this marks his second loan to finance his business. 

He plans to purchase more fruit, kales, cabbages, and onions to sell to the residents of Bamburi. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children. 

He hopes to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, kale, cabbages, and onions.

loans.name: Zaphaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah is 28 years old, married to Elizabeth and they have been blessed with one child. He makes bricks for sale. He has been in this business for six years and earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.

He is taking his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to increase the brick-making capacity in the project. He will do this by employing casual laborers and purchasing brick-making equipment. With the anticipated profits he plans to buy more land and build rental houses. 

His hopes and dreams are to educate his kids in order for them to have a bright future.

loans.use: To increase the brick-making capacity of his business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has three children between 2 and 10 years old. Two of her children are in school and all of them live at home.  

For the past three years, Janet has been selling fashion clothes. She started this business with money loaned to her by her friend. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. In the future, Janet wants to build a house and buy a car for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader, who appears in the picture, is a 30-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one daughter. He is employed but gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Nader is requesting a loan of 3,000 US dollars (USD) from FATEN to help him cover the costs of building a wall around his house. This will provide privacy to Nader and his family from surrounding neighbors and enable them to live in better and comfortable home conditions.

loans.use: to cover the cost of building a wall around his house.

loans.name: Pedro Ronmer

texts.en:
My name is Pedro Ronmer. I have a small business in the center of my city. I sell products that are used in the home. The business earns enough to support my family and other commitments. I am a single father. I have one daughter. At the moment, my wish is to increase my business and have my own location.

Loan Use: Purchase creams, shampoo, toys, flashlights, washing powder, toothpaste and other supplies.

Mi nombre es Pedro Ronmer, cuento con un pequeño negocio ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, de venta de productos de uso en el hogar, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares otros compromisos, soy padre soltero y tengo una hija en mi poder, actualmente deseo surtir mas mi negocio y tener mi propio local.

loans.use: Compra de cremas, champo, Juguetes, focos de mano,paste de lavar trastes, sepillos de pila, pastas de diente y otros

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation has trained Auntie Doris how to preserve fish through the TEACH lending programs. She sells fried fish in the community. She needs a Kiva loan of $650 to expand her fried fish business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim is 57 years old. Her husband left her for another woman. Mrs. Kim must support her son’s family also, because Manh, her son, is mentally retarded. Manh works as a daily laborer but he can’t find work easily. Mahn's son, unfortunately, was born with a harelip and the family spent a large amount of money on his operations. Mrs. Kim has littL. land for rice cultivation, so selling confectionary is important to increase their income. Her average income is low, at $8/person/month. She wants to borrow $50 for her confectionary business and will work hard to repay her loan every month.

loans.use: Confectionary business

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en: Mrs. Geogina I. is 46 years old.  She lives in Benin City in Nigeria,  where she sells her goods to people in her community. She is married and has five children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO.  According to her, if provided with a loan of $450, her business will improve.

loans.use: to buy provisions and drinks to sell
