loans.name: Sekibuule

texts.en:
Sekibuule H. is a married man with four children: 3 boys and 1 girl. The children are all currently enrolled in school with the eldest (girl) in senior high, and the others in junior high, Fifth Grade and First Grade.

In 2002, H. bought a small taxi vehicle and operated a special hire business for 3 years. He then sold the taxi and used the proceeds to buy a small plot of land and build a house for his family. Since then, H. has been employed as a special hire taxi driver, which does not earn as much as his previous employment when he actually owned the vechicle he drove.

H. would like to secure another car to enable him to make sufficient money to support his family. He has already registered with Wandegeya Tour and Traveling Association, an umbrella organization for the special hire taxi drivers.

He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva and $1,181 from Share An Opportunity Micro finance, making a total of $ 2381 (four million Uganda Shillings 4,000,000) payable in 8 months. This loan will help H. become a self reliant person who is also able to meet all his family's living expenses.

loans.use: Puchase of a small taxi vehicle

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: I am Rehana B. and the mother of six children. All of my children attend school except the eldest one who did not like school much and dropped out. I make jewelry tassels on order from various shopkeepers whereas my husband owns and runs a sanitary store. The variety in the store is not great and that serves as a major cause for fewer customers. We need a loan of US$ 400 to expand the variety of the inventory for our store.

loans.use: EXPAND SANITARY STORE

loans.name: Zulakhan

texts.en:
I request a loan of $350 for my husband who operates an embroidered clothes business.

My husband has skill at his work, and he creates clothes with the latest trends. He needs this loan to expand his business and buy fabric, thread and sequins in a large quantity. This loan amount will help us to improve our business and improve our financial status.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: David Salomón

texts.es:
David Salomón Marica U. is a married young man, with two children, who finished his secondary education. He runs a wood and cabinet-making shop at home. He got into this business when he finished high-school, was unable to continue his studies and could not find a job. He started as an apprentice at one of the most important shops in the city. At some point, he felt he could work independently, so he started his own business with the savings he had accumulated.

He has been doing business with CEPRODEL for two years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been timely and granted quickly. Moreover, they helped him improve his business and offer more products. His business is presently located at his home, strengthened by the granted loans.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

David Salomón Marica U. es un joven casado con dos hijos, quien cursó hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Este cliente tiene ubicado el negocio de ebanistería y carpintería en su casa de habitación, habiendo comenzado en este negocio cuando sale de su bachillerato, ya que no pudo seguir estudiando y no encontraba trabajo. Él comenzó a trabajar como ayudante de carpintería en uno de los talleres más importantes de la ciudad. Llegó un momento en que él sintió que ya podía trabajar por su cuenta y fue cuando decidió iniciar el negocio, con ahorros que había obtenido.

Este cliente trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años, y nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le sirvieron para impulsar aún más el negocio y ofertar más productos. Actualmente este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, obviamente fortalecido por los créditos otorgados.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Kabawo Ii(E) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Maimuna is a 34 year old widow with six children. Four of the children go to school. She sells used clothes for a living. She earns about shs 70.000 in profits each week. With the extra business profis, Maimuna intends to  pay school fees for the children and also start a poultry business.Madina sells new clothes and wants to increase stock with the loan. Eva has a charcoal selling business while Betty runs a retail shop.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes

loans.name: Julia Lionila

texts.es:
Julia Lionila C. Alfonso, who belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, sells fabric. Her business is located in the district and province of Huaraz, in Ancash. With her previous loan of S/.1500 she has bought fabric, thus increasing her income. She will invest this new loan of S/. 3000, which will be paid off within 4 months, in buying greater quantities of fabric, of different quality, in order to supply her business with more products and increase sales. She is 49 years old, a single mother with 4 children who are now adults. Her income enables her to support her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Julia Lionila C. Alfonso, pertence al “Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, ella se dedica ala venta de telas, su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash, Con el préstamo anterior de S/. 1,500 nuevos soles, ha comprado telas al por mayor incrementando sus ingresos, Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en comprar mas cantidad de telas de distintas calidades par surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Ella tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes, su ingreso le permite ayudar a su nietos.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy fabric for her business

loans.name: Satupaitea Satufia 2 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these nine women of Satupaitea Satufia, from the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business endeavours to guarantee on-time payments. All the women of this group are involved in farming.

Aiga N., 48, married, with seven children, intends to use her loan to purchase a weed killing sprayer, fertilizer, chemicals, knife, knife sharpener and other farming equipment. She grows taro on her plantation and sells it once a week.

Fetalaiga I., 36, married, with one child, grows taro, bananas and kava. Taro and bananas are staples of the Samoan diet. Kava is a calming drink taken before all ceremonies and on other special occasions.

Fili F., 30, married, with six children; Potoae Fio F., 62, married, with five children; Repeka L., 63 and married; Masina F., 56 and married; and Sivaitoi U., 37 and married, grow taro and bananas and yams to sell at the Salelologa market on Saturdays and to local villages. They are requesting loans for chemicals, a weed killing sprayer, knives, wheel barrows and spades.

Sifiti R., 27 and married, sells taro and bananas and also pancakes (round lumps of fried bread). She will use her loan to buy farming equipment including chemicals, a knife and knife sharpener.

Vera Taavaomalii I., 25, married, with three children, is also in the vegetable business, selling cabbage, tomatoes and cucumbers. She will use her loan to purchase all the farming equipment needed to produce these vegetables and sell them 3 days a week.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Flor De Ventiila Group

texts.es:
"Flor de Ventilla" Association has been part of the Pro-Mujer (Pro-woman) family for over a year. The association was formed by a group of fifteen responsible working women within the center.

They were mainly engaged in the sale of second-hand American clothing, but due to legal conflicts with the city authorities they had to cease this activity and seek other types of activity. Currently, they are engaged in the buying and selling of consumer electronic equipment (radios, televisions, portable CD players, DVDs, etc.)

To buy these items, they need to travel outside the country, which requires a higher level of funding to purchase the goods and to pay for their traveling expenses. This is an investment, however, that in time will provide more profits and consequently their business will thrive.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La asociación “flor de ventilla” pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de un año, grupo formado por 15 personas que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad dentro el centro. Ellas en gran parte se dedicaban a la venta de ropa americana (usada), pero por conflictos legales con la municipalidad esta actividad quedara vetada por algún tiempo motivo que les llevo a buscar otro tipo de actividad. Ahora intentan dedicarse al comercio de equipos electrónicos ( radios, televisores, discman, dvds y otros, para poder comprar estos artículos necesitan realizar viajes al exterior del país lo que implica solicitar mayores créditos para la compra de estos y pagar sus pasajes de viajes, una inversión que con el tiempo les traerá ganancias y con esto sus negocios prosperaran

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase consumer electronic products

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ll Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu F. is 42 years old and married with three children. She is the Tawopaneh group leader. She and Adama F. have been in the same savings and rotating club for two years and, as the loan size has grown bigger, they decided to guarantee each other's loan.

Kadiatu and Adama sell dry fish in Magburaka market. They would like to expand their businesses by becoming suppliers to the retailers in Magburaka town and the surrounding villages.

They are therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 ($US700) for that purpose.

loans.use: To purchase stock of fish.

loans.name: Kocouvi

texts.fr:
A native of Atakpamé, Mr. Kocouvi T. was born on 28 May 1987. He is unmarried and lives with his little brother in Lomé. In 2004, he started a store selling cellphone accessories and rechargeable phone cards in the Totsi district in Lomé.

He has not obtained a loan previously through WAGES, but is asking for this first loan to buy 2 small boxes of recharge cards and some cellphone accessories.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire d’Atakpamé, Monsieur T. Kocouvi est né le 28 mai 1987. Il est célibataire et vit avec son petit frère à Lomé. En 2004, il a crée un magasin de vente d’accessoires de portables et des cartes de recharge dans le quartier de Totsi à Lomé.

Il n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES mais sollicite ce premier crédit pour achat 2 petits cartons de cartes de recharges et quelques accessoires de portables

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards and cellphone accessories

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is 36 years old, and has been living with Juana, 35, for the last ten years. They do not have children.

Luis comes from a poor family; his family's bad financial situation forced him to start working to support himself and help his family right after finishing secondary school.

Now Luis offers delivery and moving services using his small truck. His services take him to different places in town. He also uses his truck to sell all kinds of merchandise, from breads to cold meats and cooking oil. Juana is a housewife.

He began this business 15 years ago while helping his mother with her own traveling sales business. He used to travel to different cities offering different products. Little by little he made his own customers and began working on his own.

This time Luis is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle, and to buy a camper for the back of the truck to work more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Luis tiene 36 años de edad, vive en pareja hace 10 años con Juana que tiene 35 años. A pesar de la cantidad de tiempo que ya tienen viviendo juntos no han podido tener hijos.

Como Luis provenía de una familia humilde, sólo logró terminar la secundaria, debiendo a partir de ese momento salir a trabajar para lograr el sustento diario.

Actualmente posee una camioneta que utiliza para realizar fletes hasta distintos puntos de la ciudad ya sea para mudanzas o envío de mercaderías. También, cuando tiene oportunidad, sale a vender todo tipo de mercaderías en la misma: desde panificados hasta embutidos y aceites. Su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Hace 15 años que Luis se dedica a tales actividades. Cuenta que comenzó ayudando a su madre que realizaba viajes a distintas ciudades del interior ofreciendo todo tipo de mercaderías. Con el tiempo él fue ganando su propia clientela y logró hacerse camino por cuenta propia.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas reparaciones a su vehiculo y para la compra de cubiertas a fin de ponerlo a punto para trabajar más cómodamente.

loans.use: Pay for truck repair

loans.name: Sofia Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Sofia Mercedes V. is 54 years old, single and has one child who is now independent. Sofia rents plastic chairs and sells soft drinks out of her house, which is a reasonable alternative to unemployment, as she is trained as an elementary school teacher. She would like to earn a higher income than that of a teacher could offer her; her goal is to rent party supplies such as table cloths and plastic tables. She is hoping to find a helping hand which will giver her the support to carry out her project. Sofia has had the fortune to work under two loans through Leon 2000 in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

L aseñora Sofia Mercedes V., tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos a su cargo cada uno ya es independiente. La actividad economica de la señora es alquiler de sillas plasticas, y venta de gaseosas en su casa de habitacion, dando inicio como una alternativa al desempleo, ya que ella se desempeñaba como profesora de educacion primaria pero ya no esta esta ejerciendo dicho trabajo y como toda persona con deseos de superacion y contar con una fuente de ingresos, su deseo es poder contar con mas productos destinados para eventos sociales como manteles, platones, mesas plasticas, entre otros, su sueño es poder concretizar dicho proyecto esperando encontrar una mano amiga que le de su apoyo en realizar su proyecto, en la actualidad ha tenido dos creditos trabajados con leon 2000.

loans.use: Purchase party supplies to rent.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La Señora Natalia es una persona muy sencilla y trabajadora, se dedica a la  venta de leche, para ello tiene dos vacas lecheras, de las cuales obtiene aproximadamente 24 litros de leche al dia. Vive en una casita muy humilde en las afueras de la ciudad con su pequeño hijo, porque su esposo se fue a trabajar a la Argentina y envía remesas mensualmente. Ella cuida de su pequeño hijo con mucho amor. Es una cliente muy puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Natalia is a very simple and hardworking person, dedicated to selling milk, for which she has two milk cows that provide approximately 24 liters of milk a day. She lives in a very humble house in the outskirts of the city with her young son because her husband went to work in Argentina and sends remittances to them monthly. She cares for her small son with great love and she is a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de forraje

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes and slippers

loans.name: Agness B.

texts.en:
Agness N. is 41 and lives in Mbeya, Tanzania, with her three children aged between 11 and 19. Agness purchases crops from surrounding villages and then sells them in her retail bases. She works very hard with her elder sister between 9-12 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Agness currently earns about 190USD from her business. With the 425 USD loan, she wants to purchase crops in bulk. In the future she wants to expand her business. She thanks Kiva for the support she has received.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Hello from Tanzania! This is 43 year old Farida F. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with 4 children between the ages of 10 and 23.  Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one 14 year old who is dependent because she is an orphan. Farida has been running a duka business, since 2005. The business is a grocery business where Farida sells rice and cooking oils. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her children. Farida currently earns about $250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase additional stocks of sugar, rice, wheat flour, salt and other small items for her grocery. In the future, she plans to open another business. Farida thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, salt and other small items for her grocery.

loans.name: Litara

texts.en: Litara M., 69, is widowed with 11 children. She has worked for three years in the banana business. She sells her bananas to the people of her village once a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala.  SPBD loans are Litara’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Invest and expand her banana crop

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Orn N. was born in 1970, and she now lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Un Phun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. N. has five children, two of whom sell coconuts while two others attend the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta A. sells used clothing at Elmina. Alberta has received a junior high school education. She is married with 2 children, and her husband is a mason. Alberta has been selling used clothing since 1991, and is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sales of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to increase the sales of used clothing.

loans.name: Dick

texts.en: P. Dick is 44 years old and married with four children. His wife is a petty trader. He sells building materials. He needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Tukhtasun

texts.en:
S. Tukhtasun is 59 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. Tukhtasun is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Tukhtasun is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land, and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields.

Tukhtasun needs seeds and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of 2000 Somoni. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Tukhtasun.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of mineral fertilizer and fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Roca & Coronado Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Roca y Coronado", no presentan nexos consanguíneos entre ellas. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida por las noches y son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras comercian con artículos varios, el presidente del grupo es carpintero. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en lo que se refiere a cada uno D. sus rubros. Efectivamente las socias comentan que trabajan con créditos D. otras instituciones financieras. Lo que respecta a Agrocapital  se encuentran en su 1er ciclo.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Roca y Coronado" are not related by blood. The members of this bank participate in different activities: Some sell food in the evenings and sell cosmetics, others commercialize various items, and the president of the group is a carpenter.

Like with all industries, there is always competition of supply and demand. This loan will be used to diversify the products sold and to invest in each of the businesses. The members of this group comment that they have worked with loans from other financial institutions. This is their first loan with Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Maria Nakiganda ‘S Group

texts.en:
Maria is 45 years of age and married with six children between 6 and 20 years old.  All of her children go to school. She  owns a two-room house where she lives with six family members .She has access to electricity, but no piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

Maria sells cold drinks in Ndeeba Market, one of the city suburbs. She doesn't incur transport expenses because she buys from suppliers near where she works. Her monthly expenses include rent for her place of work and school fees for her children. Maria sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has been in this business for over ten years. This is her fourteenth loan since she joined MCDT seven years ago, and she has always worked with the same group mates. Maria wants to use this loan to buy another refrigerator and to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to see her business growing bigger and to rent a second corner where she can sell drinks.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un célibataire, afin de se prendre en charge il a appris la menuiserie , depuis 2006 il a fini sa formation et a commencé à exercer ce métier. Il fabrique lui-même des meubles en aluminium qu’il expose et vend à ses clients. Certains de ses matériaux de travail sont vétustes ce qui freine son activité, il souhaite les renouveler, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt pour acheter une tronçonneuse, une perceuse et 9 profilets.
texts.en:
This young man is single. In order to support himself, he learned furniture-making. In 2006 he finished his apprenticeship and began to work in his chosen trade. By himself, he makes aluminum furniture that he displays and sells to his customers. Certain of his material is worn out, which slows down his work. He would like to replace some tools, so he is asking for his first loan to buy a cross-cut saw, a drilling machine, and 9 T-sections for his metal work.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of tools

loans.name: Olamfruz

texts.ru: Камолов Оламфруз проживает в раоне Хамадони. Возраст 24 года. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Оламфруз имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует разными вещами: морожным, дисками и парфюмерией.  Этим бизнесом он занимается более 4 лет. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Olamfruz K. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 24 years old, married and has 1 child. Olamfruz has a retail stand at the market, where he sells various goods, such as ice-cream, discs and perfumes. He has been involved in this business for over 4 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 31 years old. He is married with two children. Currently, one child is in schooling and the other is still breastfeeding. Francis owns and operates a grocery shop where he sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market. He wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand his business. He hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable him to provide a quality education for his children. He wants to use the proceeds to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy bulk items for his grocery store.

loans.name: Gloria Lety

texts.es: Gloria Lety B. D. A. resiD. en Santiago Texacuango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Gloria tiene 52 años D. edad vive en casa propia con su esposo. Gloria posee un negocio ubicado en su casa, es una tienda donD. venD. productos D. consumo, Gloria manifiesta tener gran apego a su negocio ya que después D. 25 años D. tenerlo ya es la mitad D. su vida la que ha dedicado a mantener a flote y cuidar D. su fuente D. ingreso, A pesar D. tantos años que Gloria tiene D. tener su tienda ella sigue con el mismo entusiasmo D. cuidar D. su negocio y atender a su clientes D. la mejor manera posible es por eso que Gloria solita este crédito ya que desea surtir D. más variedad D. marcas y productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria Lety B. D. A. lives Santiago Texacuango, department of San Salvador. She is 52 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband. Gloria runs a business out of her home selling groceries. She has a strong attachment to the store since she has had it for 25 years, dedicating nearly half her life to staying afloat and caring for her source of income. Despite the many years that Gloria has had her business, she continues with the same enthusiasm of caring for her store and tending to her customers in the best way possible. It's for this reason she is requesting the loan, since she wants to stock her store with a wider variety of brands and products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora L. is now 55 years old. She is residing in the simple village of Barangay Rio Del Grande in Enrile, Cagayan together with her family. She is a widow and blessed with four children who all graduated from college and are now helping her in managing their welding and repair shop and also their general store. Flora is very proud to have responsible and hard-working children who have finished their studies and become successful in their chosen career. She believes that having them reach their goals in life is the fruit of her sacrifices.

Flora is engaged in a welding and repair shop business. Through her income from her shop, she was also able to put up a sari-sari store (community-based store). She is doing her best to improve her businesses and as much as possible without depending too much on her children because she believes they will also have their own families in the future and it is good for them to start saving money. Despite her age, Flora is still active and showing her strong determination to succeed in her own simple way. All she wants now is to have a sustainable business that will benefit her children and grandchildren someday. For this reason, Flora would like to take out a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 25,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Yevgeniy

texts.en:
Yevgeniy is single and is a small-entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze. He runs a business selling clothing and footwear in his home town and neighboring villages in his region.

Yevgeniy can boast a nice selection of items he offers for sale. He has many loyal customers who trust him and always come back for quality and durable clothes and shoes when they shop at the market. Yevgeniy has been in the trade for four years but already has 25,000 Grivnyas worth of merchandise and makes about 3,700 Grivnyas in net profit each month. 

Yevgeniy is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to increase his assortment of merchandise for the fall season. He is characterized as a hard-worker and a determined businessman with clear vision and sober thinking. We believe Yevgeniy’s business will benefit from the current loan and will continue to grow, bringing him a stable income in the future.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of merchandise for the fall season

loans.name: Manantiales Group

texts.es: El grupo “Manantiales”  esta representado por la señora Maricruz y conformado por 12 miembros de personas cariñosas, dinámicas y trabajadoras, tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo y sus edades varían desde 19 hasta 63 años.  La presidenta tiene 2 hijos, sus hijos trabajan de forma independiente su hija vende pan en todo el barrio y su hijo vive en otra ciudad.  Las socias se dedican a la venta de frutas y lo venden en una feria todos los lunes y las otras señoras venden comida como almuerzo y cena y las otras socias  venden ropa usada para niños. Todas tienen sus puestos en la feria cerca al barrio. Prácticamente las señoras tienen ya su clientes bien selecta y saben que la competencia es grande y que para combatirla necesitan de mas mercadería insumos y también agrandar su ambientes de trabajo es por esta razón que requieren el crédito que lesa ayudara a genera un mayor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas de salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maricruz represents the Manantiales group, which is comprised of 12 loving, dynamic, hard-working long-time friends, ranging in age from 19 through 63. Mrs. Maricruz has two children; her daughter works in her neighbourhood selling bread, and her son lives in another city. On Mondays, the Manantiales group sells fruit at a fair, where group members also sell lunch, dinner and second-hand children's clothing. Everyone in the group lives near the fairground. The group has established a base of regular customers, but they know that marketplace competition is stiff. In order to succeed, they need more merchandise, a bigger, better work area, and the necessary credit to make these improvements. They hope to increase their income and improve their families' quality of life. This will be the Manantiales group's third loan; they have always demonstrated determination, honesty, and unity-- all the qualities essential to group solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 46 years old and married with five children. For the past 15 years she has run a business selling foodstuffs such as tubers of yam, rice and garri. Margaret uses her years of business experience to attract and retain her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Vista Alegre, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 ciclos, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar de ganado vacuno para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las charlas,

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “SAN CARLOS”

“Siempre quise hacer algo diferente, porque al hacerlo bien se logra un mejor nivel D. vida”, son las palabras D. la señora Violeta que a sus 46 años es madre D. 2 hijos, uno D. los cuales ya es independiente, y el otro aun esta estudiando, Violeta es cliente D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desD. hace poco mas D. un año.  Ella es presidenta del grupo “SAN CARLOS” elegida por las socios por su carisma y entusiasmo.

Violeta o Viole, como le dicen sus amigas, tiene su negocio llamado “Confecciones Viole” donD. se dedica a la confección D. zapatos, un servicio D. aparado exclusivamente para mujeres D. todas las edades, lleva en este negocio 15 años, con ayuda D. su pareja, comparten tareas, mientras que él se dedica a la confección D. los zapatos, ella se encarga D. la promoción y venta, tanto en su casa como también haciendo visitas a sus clientes.

Gracias al esfuerzo que han dado en su trabajo consiguieron comprar y construir su casa hasta un segundo piso, dar estudios superiores a sus hijos, y tener una vida D. provecho.  Ahora con el préstamo que esta obteniendo, planea invertirlo en la compra D. insumos para su negocio, aunque sus mas grandes sueños son los D. terminar D. construir su casa hasta un tercer piso, para ampliar su taller, comprar un auto para ahorrar tiempo y dinero en la compra D. insumos, y terminar D. darle educación a su menor hijo, verlo profesional.
texts.en:
ALCOM “SAN CARLOS” "I always wanted to do something different because, if you do it well, you reach a better quality of life." These are Violeta's words. This 46-year-old, mother of two children, one of whom is now independent and the other still a student, has been a member of EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for a little more than a year. She is the group leader of the “SAN CARLOS” group, elected by the members for her charisma and enthusiasm. Violeta, or Viole, as her friends call her, has a business called “Confecciones Viole” where she manufactures shoes, a service for women of all ages. She has had it for 15 years and, with her partner's help, shares tasks. While he manufactures the shoes, she takes care of marketing and sales, both from her home and with house-to-house visits with her customers. Thanks to their hard work they managed to buy and build their house, even adding a second story, proviD. higher education for their children, and have a profitable life. Now, with the loan they are requesting, she intends to invest in raw materials for their work, although her greatest wish is to finish her house adding even a third floor, enlarge their workshop, and buy a car to save time and money in the purchase of raw materials and, finally, proviD. their youngest son with an education, to see him become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dolibeth

texts.es: La señora Dolibeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas por las mañanas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado en su propia casa . Hoy en día ha ganando mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad y se hizo muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local y es ella quien personalmente les deleita con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Dolibeth, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Dolibeth belongs to the communal bank "Active Women" in the district of Bellavista, Bellavista province, in the Department of San Martín. She is married, is 34 years old, and is the mother of two children who are still dependent on her. With the goal of generating her own income in her home, she had the idea to open a small business selling food in the mornings in the very comfortable environment of her own home. Today, she has gained a lot of experience in this type of activity and she has become well know and loved by her customers. She is currently continuing with this same business, serving customers who come daily to her premises, and it is she who personally delights them with her delicious flavors and her characteristic kindness. With this loan of $700 she will by rice, sugar, and potatoes in sacks, various vegetables, eggs and chickens. She will also buy some kitchen utensils to replace those she currently has and thus provide better service and attention to her customers. Dolibeth, as she is called with affection, feels very secure and eager to move forward and attain a quiet life for herself. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for making meals to sell

loans.name: Grupo Los Paisanos Group

texts.es: El grupo los paisanos con de la comunidad de Chimente San Jose a 42 kilometros de municipio de Totonicapan una comunidad muy pobre en donde los gobiernos   ha abandonado a dicha comunidad dicho grupo se dedica ha la venta de ropa  en los mercados municipales de Patzite y Santa Cruz del Quiche ellos manifiesta que ha querido siempre un credito por ser personas muy pobres no tiene acceso a los bancos, hoy necesitamos del credito para poder mejor su nivel de vida y las de sus hijos con el credito poder surtir su mercaderia para poder cumplir la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
The "Los Paisanos" (The Compatriots) group is from the Chimente San Jose community which is 42 kilometers from the city of Totonicapan. This is a very poor community that has been abandoned by the different governments. The group sells clothing in the municipal markets of Patzite and Santa Cruz del Quiche. They state that they have always wanted financing because they are very poor people with no access to banks. They need the financing to improve their quality of life and that of their children. With the funds they intend to stock up on merchandise so that they can meet the requests of their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Lely

texts.es:
Lely tiene 48 años, es madre de 3 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes. En la actualidad sólo vive con su esposo, quien es técnico dental.

Desde hace 6 años ella se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos, para ello cuenta con un pequeño taller que implementó en su propia casa. Para esta también cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas y lo que más le gusta es que sus clientes confianza en su buena labor y la recomiendan a otras personas. 

Este es su 9no préstamo con MFO, ella es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Trabajando juntos”, y lo que le gusta es que entre todos los integrantes se entienden y hay mucha comunicación. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará telas, hilos y otros materiales para confeccionar más prendas y así seguir activa en esta actividad que tanto le satisface.
texts.en:
Lely is 48 years old and she has 3 children of age. She only lives with her husband, who’s a dental technician. 6 years ago, she began making children and adults clothing. She owns a small work shop located in her house. She also has support from one of the daughters. What she likes the most is to have customers who trust her good work and recommend her to other people. This is her 9th loan with MFO. She’s a member of a community bank called “Trabajando juntos” (Working together). She likes it because members understand each other and have a good relationship. With the money she will buy fabric, thread and other materials to make more items, so as to keep being active in this activity that is so rewarding for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Señor José Núñez, tiene 41 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Marlene Medina, con quien tiene dos hijos menores.
El Señor José se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es una masa preparada a base de harina de maíz y almidón, cocinada en un horno calentado a leña. Esta venta la realiza en forma ambulante en una bicicleta, con el cual recorre toda la ciudad vendiendo su producto.
Nos cuenta José que para empezar con esta actividad, desde muy joven trabajaba con una Sra. que realizaba este producto y él lo vendía por la ciudad, posteriormente se independizó y comenzó a producir su propio producto, con la ayuda de su esposa, quien realizaba la preparación y el horneado del mismo.
Ya hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro y gracias al mismo logró hacer estudiar a su esposa la profesión de docente, que ya ejerce y está ingresando un dinero más a la familia.
El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación del horno.
La intención de José es la de lograr producir una mayor cantidad de chipas para un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
José Núñez, 41, is married to Marlene Medina and they have two minor children. José sells chipas, a traditional bakery product, prepared in a wood fired oven with maize flour and starch. He sells his chipas in the street, riding a bicycle around the city. José tells us that he started this business when he was very young and worked for a lady. Later he became independent and started his own production, with the help of his wife, who was in charge of preparation and baking. He has been in this business for the past 15 years and thanks to this income his wife could study and become a teacher and through this job could make additional income to support the family. This loan will be used to enlarge the bakery. José hopes to increase the production of chipas and achieve higher profit.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to enlarge the bakery

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna F. is from the village of Owaon. She is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. Two of them are adults while the youngest is a student.  To make a living, Paterna raises crops. Planting, harvesting, and selling  a variety of root crops and vegetables, while not the only means for generating revenue, is the business's main source of income. Paterna has been raising crops for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month, on average.

In 2009, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, fertilizers, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 3rd loan Paterna has taken out by from PMPC, and this is her second loan from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo. She sells footwear in one of the local markets in her hometown, right next to a bus station. Her inventory is always in high demand among market customers. Eva launched this small venture six years ago. Presently, she has about 50,000 grivnyas in turnover capital. 

Eva is a dedicated entrepreneur who has a desire to achieve further expansion, pushes to conquer problems and strives for a successful venture. One of her long-term plans is to continue expanding her trade. She is ready to take on even more responsibility to achieve her goals. Today Eva is requesting a loan of 8,500 grivnyas to increase the assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 51-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Mariam has been selling fruits and vegetables. She sells iceberg lettuce, pumpkins, tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, apples, oranges and more, depending on the season. Her products are all 'bio'. 

Mariam is special in her work because her customers feel comfortable buying from her. Her customers are her friends, neighbors and people in her region. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fruits and vegetables. Mariam has been a micro-credit client for six years now and has always repaid on time.

When Mariam first started her business, she didn’t use to own her shop, she used to sell her merchandise by knocking on doors. Therefore, she decided on doing her business because she saw that the number of customers she had was increasing and she was capable of opening her own fruit and vegetable shop. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sumbua

texts.en:
Sumbua B. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and charcoal to sell. Sumbua is 20 years old and is married to a driver. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en: Bayarsaihan is 30 years old and lives with his wife in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house, which they built themselves. During the day, Bayarsaihan operates a raw materials trading business in his town. He sells a variety of raw materials such as sheepskin to his many customers. Bayarsaihan has been operating his business since 2008. He also operates a transportation business. Bayarsaihan operated a grocery store business between 2004 -2009. He has been planning to expand his businesses in the future. Bayarsaihan is a very enthusiastic person who has good communication skills.  He says, “I am working hard to build a bright future for my family.” He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase raw materials at wholesale prices and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Patricia Q. esta agradecida con su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual decidió poner la cocineta a su casa ya que le estaba haciendo mas falta.
Nueva mente solicita un préstamo para poder empezar la construcción de una cuarto el cual será para su pequeño hijo que tiene pocos mese de nacido y necesita espacio en la casa y como esta muy pequeña, desea ampliarla un poco más.
Quien le ayuda ha cuidar a su bebe es su mama ya que ella tiene que trabajar para salir adelante, ya que con una parte del sueldo que recibe es para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Patricia Q. is grateful for the assistance of her previous loan, which was used to install a kitchen that her house was lacking.

She is requesting a new loan in order to begin construction of a room for her young son, who is only a few months old. Ana Patricia needs extra space in her small house, so she wants to expand it a little more.

Her mother helps with taking care of the baby because she has to work in order to stay ahead. Part of her salary will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of a room at the back of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for shoes

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita A. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 58 years old, widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Estelita owns and operates a business making and selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Estelita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2005, Estelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Estelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chang

texts.en: Chang C., 27, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries from home for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a logger and earns USD 6.60 per day.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Kanyinke Ole

texts.en:
Kanyinke Ole K. is 48 years old. He is married to Nalayian K. and is a father of two school-going children. Kanyinke is a farmer and has been farming his own piece of land for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from a friend in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare his 10-acre land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

Kanyinke's dream is be a large-scale farmer with his own farm machinery. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend on ploughing, hallowing, buying fertilizer and seeds, and planting

loans.name: Khalfan

texts.en:
Khalfan M. is a married man with no children. He owns a home with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport costs. He decided to join Yehu in order to obtain a loan to raise his standard of living in the future. 

Khalfan has operated a barber shop for three years, and he faces the major challenge of theft. His wife is a hairdresser by profession and she contributes to the family's basic needs. His wife's contributions are his other source of income. 

He would like to use this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) to pay the rent to start another barber shop. His potential customers are men and school-going children. Khalfan hopes to someday own a salon as well as another barber shop.

loans.use: To start another barber shop, purchase hair-cutting machine, and pay for rent.

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en: Qadir N. is a 53-year-old man who has been breeding cattle for the last 10 years. He is married and has four children.  He buys young cattle, raises them and sells for a profitable price. Now he would like to buy five sheep and start breeding them. Qadir applied for 1,000 AZN for this purpose. Sheep breeding is a very profitable business and Qadir has deep experience in breeding them as well as breeding cattle.

loans.use: To purchase five sheep and one calf

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia C. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Herminia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling health and generic medicinal products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Herminia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Margarete

texts.en: Margarete C. is currently in the business of selling sorghum and cassava flour at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and millet flour to sell. Margarete is 35 years old and is married to a husband who works in the service industry. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize and millet flour to sell

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en: Gnel N. is 43 years old and sells fruit in Takeo province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$ 5 every day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and makes US$ 2.50 a day. This couple has five children; two are students and two others are garment factory workers. Gnel N. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to operate a moto-taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias M. is a 42-year-old married gentleman who is in the carpentry business. He has been in this business for the past 17 years and he is able to make a profit of about Kshs 15,000 every month. This, together with the addition of his wife’s income, is able to provide for his needs as well as those of his wife and their three children. 

Elias is an old client of KADET and he is now applying for his sixth loan which he will use to purchase raw materials for his carpentry business. This will include things like timber, nails, glue, etc. He hopes to use the anticipated profits from this loan to grow the business.

Elias has dreams of expanding his business further in future and being able to earn a steady income.

loans.use: To buy more materials e.g. nails, timber, glue, etc. for his carpentry business

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn L., 34, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. L. grows rice, earning an income of $1 per day. Her husband sells spare parts for cars, earning an income of about $7 per day. The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity and $20 on other necessary expenses every month.  

Sourn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more spare parts for her husband to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more car spare parts to resell

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine was born in 1977. She is married with two children: the first one is 13 and the last one is 6 years old. Delphine is a business woman; her husband does not make any income for the family. Delphine owns a store which sells various products such as sacs of rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and so on. She is well known for her business which is well organized. Delphine has four years of experience in this business. She is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional products for her store. Delphine expects to earn more profit after expanding her business and she will be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es:
Feliza  es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda, con cinco hijos y con grado D. instrucción D. primaria  incompleta.
Feliza viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra y venta D. ganado ovino. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1300.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio. 
Su sueño  es tener un restaurant. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Feliza is a member of the San Salvador Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Capachica, Province and Department of Puno. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has five children. Feliza did not finish her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for seven years. The first loan she requested was for 300 PEN, which she used for buying and selling sheep.

Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1300 PEN to increase her business capital. Her dream is to open a restaurant. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: Additional operating capital for buying & selling sheep

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. is in the taxi transport business in Eldoret, Kenya. She is 27 years old, married to Julius Limo and has one child who is one year old. Her husband is also a businessman in the same transportation sector, he therefore also contributes to the family's income. From the transport business, Florence earns KES 25,000 per month. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 40,000, which she plans to use to service her taxi so it will be in better condition and to buy two tires. The anticipated profits from the expanded business will be reinvested in the business. In the future, Florence hopes to own a bus with a capacity of 80 seats, which will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs, and also see her child become enlightened through education and become successful in life.

loans.use: To service her taxi and buy two tires.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest

loans.name: Juana Constantina

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años, de estado civil madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos independientes, realizó estudios hasta 3º de educación primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosina y galletas.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cuál comprará golosinas, galletas y detergentes, lo ayuda su hijo y su sobrina, la señora sale con su negocio a las ferias.

Su visión es mejorar el negocio.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” communal bank in Puno district which is in Puno province and department.  She is 58 years old and a single mother of two independent children.  She went up to 3rd grade.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her sweets and cookie selling business.

Her new, 500 new sol, loan will be used to buy sweets, cookies and detergents.  Her son and niece help her.  She takes her business to the market. Her vision is to improve the business.

What she likes about the communal bank is what her savings earn.

loans.use: To buy sweets, cookies and other products, like detergents.

loans.name: John Kibue

texts.en:
John is 33 years old and married to Carolyn, who is a housewife. They have been blessed with one child who is 12 years old. John offers welding services in the area of Kirigu market. He has been running this business for the past 8 years.

This is the second loan he has taken from KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to buy a welding machine. If the loan improves the business, he desires to own a big hardware store in the area.

loans.use: John wants to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Dolores is the coordinator of her group, 'Mujeres Bendecidas' 1, 2 & 3 (Women Blessed), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in one of the poorest area around Santo Domingo city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Dolores is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She operates a fried food stall at her home, and she will invest in her business by buying a gas tank, six chairs and a table. She sells especially breakfast and dinner. She will use the profits to save and in the short term, she plans to buy a plot of land to start building her house. Her most difficult challenge has been studying. She likes to work and her future plan is to have her own house. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a gas tank, 6 chairs, and a table

loans.name: Linda's Group

texts.en:
Linda P. lives in the village of San Jose. She is 36 years old and leads an 11-person loan group, nine of whose members we see here, that is affiliated with ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Linda is married, has two school-aged children and makes a living by raising livestock. She has been in this line of work for more than five years and makes about 4,000 PHP when she sells one of her animals.

Last year, Linda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a  loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda G. is from the village of Namnama, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Imelda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling religious items. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling general religious articles to tourists and local community members. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Imelda joined Kiva's partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional items for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional religious items to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people make up this village bank loan and they will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. They have selected Mrs. Nget to be the village bank president. Mrs. Nget is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family, so she has a lot of free time. In order to improve her family's income, Mrs. Nget would like to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. She plans to use the rest of the loan to add to her savings so her family can buy a motorcycle in the future. Her husband, Mr. Houch, is a recycling salesman who earns some profit to support their family. Through these activities they support five children: two are employed in garment factories, one is a laborer and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Guasaule Group

texts.es:
el grupo Guasaule esta integrado por 3 mujeres que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y que son muy buenas amigas, trabajan juntas para sacar adelante sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividaded que ellas realizan:

doña Ingrid es una mujer joven emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Ingrid cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ingrid es madre de 6 hijos los cuales estan en la escuela y colegio de su comunidad.
Ingrid en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria al por mayor para surtir mas su pulperia.

doña Lidia A. es una mujer dedicada a su negocio el cual es produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, Lidia es madre de 4 hijos los cuales ya estan adultos, a pesar de su avanzada edad Lidia se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias para hacer sus ricas tortillas y  venderlas en su vecindario.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
 
la sra. Norma Z. es una mujer trabajadora y que se dedica a la venta de semillas en su casa de habitacion, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Norma es madre de 2 niños los cuales que estan bien pequeños, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que se dedica  al comercio en esta zona.
sus tiempos libres los dedica  a la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
The Guasaule group is composed of three members who have known each other for a long time and are very good friends.  They work together to support their families.  Following are details about each of their activities:

Ingrid is a young entrepreneur who sells daily use items.  She has a grocery store in her home.  Her husband helps her meet household expenses.  Ingrid is the mother of six children who go to the local school and high school.  During her free time, Ingrid goes to church.  She will use the loan to buy groceries to better stock her grocery store.

Lidia A. is a woman who is devoted to her business which is the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her home.  Lidia is the mother of four children who are all adults now.  Despite her advanced age, Lidia rises daily at 5am to make her delicious tortillas and sell them in her neighborhood.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials needed to make tortillas.

Norma Zuñiga is a hard working woman who sells seeds at home; she’s been in this line of work for four years.  She is the mother of two children who are still quite little.  Her husband, who is an area merchant, helps her.  She raises chickens in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime powder, corn, water, lard, oil, margarine, salt, soft drinks, rice, sugar, bread, coffee, cookies, soups, noodles, pasta, sauces, snacks and wheat and corn flour.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 46 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 17 and 21. He runs a store in the town of Grassfield in Sierra Leone.

Ahmed has been in this business for 5 years and sells rice, paint, cement, and mosquito spray at his store. He also earns income from renting a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is price control.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase some more store items. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him expand his business. In the future, he would like to be an importer.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, paint, cement, and mosquito spray

loans.name: Mov's Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Mov, who was born in 1961, was selected as the village bank president by the others members. 

Mrs. Mov is widow with a child who is seamstress in a garment factory.
 
Mrs. Mov earns her living by making baskets for selling, but with this business, she cannot earn enough money to support her family. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy beef and balut eggs for selling. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy beef and balut eggs for selling.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther de 51 años deedad,essosltera ,vive en casa de unos familiares, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz solamente, la cual queda en Paul Harris en el distrito de la Victoria la misma que pertenece ha la privincia de Chilclayo.  Toda ésta zona se diedica al comercio, agricutlura y turismo.
María Esther desde hace 10 años aproximadamente se dedica ha la venta de Periódicos y revistas  en una esquina del parque central de este distrito, ya que es un sitio muy transitado por los trabajadores de las distintas instituciones que se encuentran ahí, su negocio que tiene a incrementado sus ventas considerablemente y uno de los factores es que en la actualidad las personas necesitan saber que es lo que pasa en el medio; mediante prensa escrita o se interesa más por la compra de revistas de renombre.
Por eso María Esther se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1200 nuevos soles para surtir  más su negocio con todo tipo de periódicos y revistas, para que su clientela tenga de donde escoger y también es otra forma de  que sus clientes puedan pagar un poco más por tener productos (periódicosy revistas)de mayor calidad.  María Esther es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora y su sueño es que más adelante tenga una tienda propia exclusiva de periódicos y revistas, con la única intensión de cada vez mejorar más en la vida.
texts.en:
María Esther, 51, is single and lives in the house of some relatives in Paul Harris, in the Victoria district in the province of Chilclayo.  She has only light and water service.  The entire area is involved in agriculture and tourism.

For around 10 years María Esther has been selling newspapers and magazines on a corner in the park in the middle of the district.  It's a thoroughfare for workers in the various locales.  Sales are growing because, for one thing, nowadays people need to know what's going on in the media either by reading the paper, or they might rather buy popular magazines.  

Consequently, María Esther feels she needs to request a loan of 1200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to stock up on all kinds of newspapers and magazines, so her customers can have choices and also pay a little less for high-quality products (papers and magazines).  María Esther is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  Her dream down the line is to have her own newspaper and magazine shop, and her sole intention is to make life better and better.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers and magazines for her business.

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 34 years old. Richelle is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Richelle owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, dried fish, sugar in packs, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Richelle has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Richelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Richelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Richelle is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & rice per kilogram. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Richelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
