HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & rice per kilogram.

loans.name: Agustin Bisman

texts.es: El señor Agustin Bisman y la señora Maria Luisa, son casado desde hace cinco años tienen un hijo de 8 años Agustin, ellos viven en la zona del Plan 3000 en el departamento de Santa Cruz, en una casa en alquiler ya que no tienen casa propia, el señor se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano como taxista y la esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica; ambos trabajan puesto que lo que  ganan solo alcanza para subsistir y  su única herramienta de ingreso es su taxi, los riesgos de esta actividad son los accidentes y su vehículo acaba de sufrir un accidente y como es su herramienta principal de trabajo y de ingresos por tal motivo  necesitan el crédito para poder arreglar su herramienta de trabajo y así poder seguir llevando el pan del día para su familia. Agustin y su familia han logrado mantener a su hijo bajo las condiciones muy aceptables, y nunca le han hecho faltar nada, desean que en el futuro tenga una mejor condición de vida por ello dia a dia luchan para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Agustin Bisman and María Luisa have been married for five years.  They have an 8 year-old son called Agustin and live in Plan 3000 district, in Santa Cruz department.  They do not own their own home and so they live in a rental house.

Agustin provides an urban transport service as a taxi driver and his wife works as a house cleaner.  They both work since the money they earn is just enough to survive on.  Agustin's only tool for earning money is his taxi.  The risks he faces in his business are accidents.  His vehicle has just suffered an accident and, as it is his main work tool with which he makes money, he needs a loan so that he can repair it and thereby continue providing for his family.

Agustin and his wife have managed to support their son in very acceptable conditions and they have never let him want for anything.  They hope that, in the future, he will have better life and for this reason they struggle every day to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El cafetín que Rosario administra esta ubicado en la Municipalidad Distrital de Yarinacocha, ella ganó la licitación hace 2 años, en los cuales ha trabajado muy duro para sacarlo adelante. Ahora su cafetín esta muy bien equipado y atiende desde muy temprano a los trabajadores y personas que desean servirse algo sabroso y saludable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo su cafetín, ya que muchas veces se queda hasta muy tarde por la gran cantidad de clientes que tiene. En adelante, espera mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar los platillos que vende en su cafetín.
texts.en:
Rosario, 41, is a very kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her three beloved children that she wants to provide a better quality of education for.  

The snack bar that Rosario runs is located in the District Municipality of Yarinacocha.  She gained the right to it two years ago and has worked very hard all that time to make it successful.  Now, her snack bar is well equipped and serves workers and people who want something delicious and healthful starting very early.  

What she most enjoys about the work is tending to her customers.  She’s been in business four years and considers the most difficult part having to tend to the snack bar all day because often she has to stay until quite late because of the large number of customers she has.  In the future she’d like to improve her snack bar’s installations to thus provide better customers service.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with her payments.  She is a much respected member of her communal bank because of the responsibility she exhibits.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy the ingredients she needs to make the dishes she sells in her snack bar.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Ayidekon-Fifa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDEKON-FIFA est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Augustine Louise est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Augustine Louise est mariée à un soudeur du Thomas et a sept enfants qui sont scolarisés. Des sept enfants, cinq sont à sa charge. Augustine Louise et son mari supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Augustine Louise a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Augustine Louise exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans environs. A côté de cette activité, Augustine Louise vend des articles de mercerie dans son atelier. De façon secondaire, Augustine Louise vend des tissus, des chaussures, des sacs et des layettes dans son atelier. Augustine Louise s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Augustine Louise n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Augustine Louise et les autres membres du groupe AYIDEKON-FIFA sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Ayidekon-Fifa is composed of three residents of the same district in Benin. The group's representative, named Augustine Louise, is the woman raising her hand on the picture. This is the third time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to increase their level of activity.
Augustine Louise is married to a welder named Thomas and has seven children, who go to school. Out of the seven children, five depend on her financially. Augustine Louise and her husband take care of the family's various expenses together. Augustine Louise did not have much schooling, but she learned sewing. She has been in this business for about five years. In addition to this activity, Augustine Louise sells haberdashery items in her workshop. On the side, she also sells fabrics, shoes, bags and baby linen in her workshop. Augustine Louise gets her supplies in Benin and in Togo.
Demand from her customers is growing, and given her limited resources, Augustine Louise is having trouble meeting their requirements. Considering this and their limited resources, Augustine Louise and the other members of group Ayidekon-Fifa are requesting a collective loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, haberdashery items, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with two girls who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills, electricity bills and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing poultry feeds in her business. Fatuma dreams of purchasing more chicks and supplying as a wholesaler in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 50 chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira keeps livestock. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but the income is barely enough to meet their ends. Elmira would like to increase the livestock and develop agriculture. With the requested loan she plans to purchase calves and forage. Development of agriculture will help Elmira to increase her profit and improve her family's living conditions. Elmira lives together with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for calves and forage.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 40 years old, married, and has three grown children who live with her. She is from Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  To support her daily needs, Alma runs a small restaurant from her home.  The foods are personally cooked by her, and each month she is able to earn an income of about 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

In 2007, she joined KIva field partner GDMPC so she could access loans. Alma has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase soft drinks and food items to sell in her restaurant. She hopes that the loan will help her expand her business and allow her to earn more for a better living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and food items

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta  3ro de secundaria.
Lucia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de   S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de emoliente (bebida caliente a base de cebada).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres sacos de azúcar, plástico y gas, etc.,  para su negocio.  Ella trabaja sola en el negocia, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es comprarse un terreno en Puno para sus hijos y tener una tienda de abarrotes.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  el ahorro, la puntualidad y el préstamo de la cuenta interna
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli" communal bank, located in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 31, married, and has 2 children. She was in school until the third grade of secondary school.
Lucia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two cycles. Her first loan was for the sum of 500 Nuevo Soles, money that she invested in her business selling emoliente (a hot barley-based drink).
With this new loan of 700 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase three bags of sugar, plastic, pop, etc. for her business. She works alone in this business. Her husband works as a construction engineer.
Her dream is to buy a plot of land in Puno for her children, and to have a grocery store.
What she likes about the communal bank is the savings, the punctuality and the loans from the internal savings account.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of sugar; plastic; pop; etc.

loans.name: Araceli Del Carmen

texts.es: Araceli del Carmen tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella sale a vender todos los días para ofrecer la variedad de productos que tiene como es pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, cremas, tratamientos, shampoo entre otros. Araceli tiene como mayor desafío el brindarle a sus  clientes lo que le soliciten. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Araceli del Carmen is 40 years old and her business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this line of work for more than five years.  She goes out every day to sell her range of products which includes lipsticks, nail polish, creams, treatments and shampoos.  Araceli's biggest challenge is providing her customers with what they ask for.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, nail polish, creams, treatments, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and lives in the village of Sto. Niño in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.  She is married with three school-aged children.

To earn a living, Alma has a business selling a variety of vegetables in the local community such as eggplant, squash, potato, cabbage, ampalaya, green leafy vegetables, etc.  She has been running the business for over five years, and has learned many things from it - from customer care to budgeting for home and business. She earns about PHP 22,500 each month.  She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Alma joined GDMPC earlier this year and this is her second loan request made in the cooperative.  In the future she would like to improve and expand her product offerings to attract more customers, and lay aside some of the profits for her children's education. She also hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 29 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and has two school-aged children. 

Wilfredo owns and operates a motorcycle to earn a living. He is driving a two-wheeled vehicle that carries 2 to 6 passengers. Vehicles like this are commonly seen in rural and remote areas. The family has extra sources of income but it is this business they've relied on most for daily expenses. He has run the business for five years and earns about PHP 8,000 a month. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle tires and other spare parts. 

Wilfredo hopes to sustain the business much longer into the future. He plans to buy a motor cab to provide better accommodation to the passengers.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadira, una joven de 21 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua pero habita en el departamento de Estelí, es madre soltera. Ella es comerciante, tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada frente a un colegio de primaria, comenzó este negocio debido a que tenía buscar una medio de subsistencia para ella y su hijo que ahora tiene de 5 años de edad, pues se convirtió en madre a muy temprana edad, y no tenia como conseguir para solventar los gastos que le generaba su hijo, su madre la apoyo y junto con ella pusieron una pulpería . Hoy en día tienen 3 años de tenerla, ella y su mama administran este negocio, donde ambas se turnan para atenderlo.
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar inventario tales como leche, huevo, cereales, snacks, jugos, sodas, aceite, arroz, frijoles, jabones de limpieza. Con esta inversión podrá ofrecer mas productos sus clientes bridarles un servicio mejor, mejorar sus ventas, pues el objetivo de ella es que su negocio crezca y poderlo convertir en una miscelánea de productos varios, que cumpla con las necesidades de su vecindario.
texts.en:
Yadira, 21, is from the city of Managua but now lives in Estelí Department.  She’s a single mother.  She’s a merchant; she has a small grocery store located across from an elementary school.  She started the business because she had to find a way to support herself and her son who is now 5 years old because she became a mother at a very young age and had no way to cover expenses generated by her son.  Her mother helped her out and they opened a grocery store.  Today, they’ve had it for three years.  She and her mother run it and they take turns taking care of it.

She requested the loan to buy stock merchandise like milk, eggs, cereals, snacks, juices, soft-drinks, oil, rice, beans and cleaning supplies.  With this investment she’ll be able to offer more products to her customers and provide better service and improve sales for her objective is that her business grows to turn it into a variety store with varied products to meet her neighborhood’s needs.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Орзигул проживает в районе Яван. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Орзигул пять лет как занимается выпечкой. На сегодняшний день она у себя дома печет лепешку для торговли. Кредит берет для приобретения муки.
texts.en: Orzigul lives in the Yavan district.  She is 30 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in to-hire construction work.  Orzigul has been involved in baking for five years.  Today, she bakes flatbread at home for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: Sandra Veronica.D. 21 años D. edad y tiene un hijo,ella se dedica a la confeccion y venta D. tejidos tipicos desD. hace varios años,ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque aparte D. ser una actividad muy rentable le gusta su trabajo,ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos tipicosm, ya que por esta epoca es cuando se venD. mas,y es cuando pueD. aumentar mas su capital,el sueño D. ella es darle lo mejor a su hijo y que en un futuro sea un profecional.
texts.en: Sandra Veronica is 21 years old and has a child. She has been weaving and selling traditional fabrics for several years. She tells us that she is happy because apart from being a very profitable activity she likes her work. She is asking us for this loan to buy the raw materials to weave traditional fabrics since at this time of the year she sells the most material and it is when she can raise more capital. Her dream is to give her child the best and that in the future s/he become a professional.

loans.use: to weave and sell fabrics.

loans.name: Medel

texts.en:
Medel is 37 years old and married to Jeanette. He is engaged in a farming business and grows corn to sell. Farming is the main source of his income. Medel is hard-working person. 

Medel is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seed corn and fertilizer. This will allow him to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Francis Omondi

texts.en:
Francis Omondi is 32 years old. He is married and has a six year old son. He describes himself as outgoing, generous and ambitious. He has been a mechanic for the last ten years. His business faces a problem due to the increased cost of spare vehicle parts. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a bladder, a spray painting and a cutting machine. In the future, Francis wants to expand his business to neighboring towns and have more employees.

loans.use: To buy a spray painting and cutting machine and a bladder.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Ana Isabel,  reside en el municipio de Ticuantepe.  Posee  su negocio de pulpería desde hace 3 años, vendiendo todo tipo de productos siendo varios los clientes que ella posee y que le visitan en su localidad.

Ella está necesitando un crédito para invertirlo en la  compra de productos tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, pollo, carne, medicamentos, gaseosas, jugos enlatados, lácteos, detergente, y productos varios y de esa manera poder satisfacer a su clientela. 

Considera que Ceprodel le ha ayudado mucho en cuanto a los préstamos que le ha facilitado anteriormente, ya que ha mejorado su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Isabel lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She has had a convenience store for the past three years selling all kinds of products, and she has a number of clients from the neighborhood. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of products like rice, sugar, oil, beans, chicken, meat, medicines, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, detergents and other items, and in this way she can satisfy her customers. She says previous loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel have helped her a lot, since she improved her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, chicken, meat, medicines, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, detergent and other items.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet de 18 años de edad, convive con Rimer de 21 años, fruto de esta relación nació Jeremy que tiene 2 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Yanet es ama de casa, mientras que su esposo trabaja como agricultor cultivando cacao y piña. Ellos desean superarse, es por ello que en coordinación con su querido esposo se acercaron a la oficina de MFP a solicitar un credito para incrementar su capital con la finalidad de comprar una mototaxi con el que Rimer podrá dedicarse a brindar el servicio de transporte así obtener mejores ganancias. Ahora sabe que su sueño se hará realidad, ya que podrá contar con un mototaxi. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará una mototaxi.
texts.en: Yanet is 18 years old and lives with Rimer, who is 21 years old.  They have a two year old son named Jeremy.  They live in their own home in the district of Pichari.  Yanet cares for the home while her husband works as a farmer cultivating cocoa and pineapple.  They desire to get ahead, and that is why she and her dear husband came to the MFP office to ask for a loan to increase their capital to buy a moto-taxi so Rimer can work in transportation service and earn more money.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making the payments on time.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles, she will buy a moto-taxi.

loans.use: buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Phalany's Group

texts.en:
Phalany is a 48-year-old grocery seller living in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. She has been earning a living in this business for several years. She has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She currently earns less than US$5 per day and is able to save only around US$2 daily. 

This is Phalany's first group loan with VisionFund. She leads this group in applying for a loan. She will use the entire loan to pay her children's tuition. She hopes this loan will keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: To pay her children's tuition.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a married woman with three children. She is 33 years old. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. To earn a living, she is operating a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 2,000 KES doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 KES to repair a fishing boat used in her business. In 2008, Luciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat used in her business.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús de 56 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable, vive junto a su esposo y una pequeña nieta quien depende por completo de ella. Jesús trabaja como mensajera en una empresa pública donde tienen varios años de laborar, también con el fin de obtener ingresos extras, se dedica a la venta de cremas para el cuerpo y el rostro, maquillajes, cremas para manos y pies, perfumes y más, y algunos de estos productos los vende por catalogo. Ella es una persona muy amigable y muy querida por las personas, que desea salir adelante, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de cremas y cosméticos y así aumentar sus ventas lo cual es su deseo principal para poder tener una vida mejor junto  a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de cremas y cosméticos

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: BIDOSSESSI est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Judith Stanislas (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 43 ans. Judith Stanislas n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis dix sept ans à son domicile. Judith Stanislas est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. En dehors de cet enfant, le couple a un autre enfant scolarisé à sa charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Judith Stanislas et son mari. Pour cette raison, Judith Stanislas en plus de son activité vend des produits cosmétiques, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Judith Stanislas s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Judith Stanislas sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches, des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is applying for his second loan through Kiva after he finished paying off his first successfully. He originally started out by borrowing a little bit from his mother so that he could sell chicken out of their house. He realized that he would need to become a member of the market near his house in order to reach his customers. Two years have gone by, and everything is going well for Marcos. His wife and daughter constantly motivate him to work hard because Mr. Ordonez is the only source of income for the family right now. Marcos is applying for a new loan so that he can purchase items in cash at the local markets in order to get great discounts and pass the savings on to his customers. With this money he hopes to buy a refrigerator, as well as more chicken and eggs. Right now he claims that he does not have access to credit from a formal bank because he cannot meet the stringent, and often unforgiving, requirements that they impose. The profits generated from the business help Marcos to pay for personal costs, such as education for his daughter, medicine, and food.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: With this money he hopes to buy a refrigerator, as well as more chicken and eggs.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa's store sits on top of a hill overlooking her barrio of El Progreso. Community members take a short trek from their homes below to buy day-to-day necessities from Luisa's shop such as canned food, beverages, fresh vegetables and bread. She is prepared to expand her business that not only supports her neighbors, but provides income to care for her three children, ages 11, 9 and 8, whom she raises with her husband, Gregorio. Luisa's request for a loan is to add poultry and dairy products to her menu.

Geographic isolation and poor transportation options make Luisa's a convenient and necessary part of this impoverished community in the Los Alcarrizos region of this Caribbean country. Luisa has vocational training in commerce and continual support by her loan officer, Rebeca Almanzar Rosa. Her son and two daughters are able to go attend school rather than taking odd-jobs to help the family make a living. Their mother has the means to take care of them and with this new loan, their income will increase as she work her way out of poverty.

NOTE: Luisa is a member of the "La Triunfadora" group, along with four other entrepreneurs. They will be accountable to one another for paying back their loan of $750. This group lending method requires group members to help one another throughout the loan repayment process. Loans are paid back as a group. If one person is deficient on their loan, the group must make up the difference. Everyone in Luisa's group has gone through Esperanza's training and demonstrated to be responsible and determined.

loans.use: Purchase poultry, beans, cheese and additional goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock and move his grocery business to a permanent shop

loans.name: Phil

texts.en: Mrs. Phil P. is 29 years old and operates a small grocery stand out of her house in Phnom Penh.  She can earna bout $3/day from this business, while her husband earns $2/day working at a factory.  Together, they have 3 small children that they support.  Mrs. Phil P. wil use this loan to purchase grocery products to invest in her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Marie-Madeleine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Marie-Madeleine E., 58, was born in Djagblé, Togo, is married and mother of four children. She sells African print cloth (“pagnes”—used to make clothes and head wraps or as a sort of sarong) in order to earn her living. Ambitious and a hard worker, she would like to expand her business by buying the cloth wholesale which would increase her profit margin on each sale. Since she does not otherwise have the capital for this expansion, she is asking for a loan of US$ 800. This will enable her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame E. Marie-Madeleine est née en 1959 à Djagblé, mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce aux revenus de son commerce de pagnes. Très battante et ambitieuse, elle veut agrandir son commerce en achetant en gros les pagnes, ce qui augmenterait ses revenus. Mais faute de moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. Ceci améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying African print cloth wholesale for resale  Achat en gros et revente des tissus pagnes

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.ru:
Teyyub N. was born in 1971. He was born and lives in Agsu. Teyyub is a family man and has 2 children. Seven years ago he opened a small mini-market. He did not have enough resources to purchase additional inventory. He applied to the Agsu division of Normicro and borrowed $500. This sum helped him and he was able to purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нуриев Теюб 1971 года рождения. Родилься и проживает в городе Аксу. Семейный, имеет двоих детей. Семь лет тому назад он открыл небольщой мини маркет. Чтобы закупить больше товаров ему не хватало средство. Написав заявление в Нормикро Аксуниский филиал, Теюб взял кредит в размере 500$ . Это сумма помогло ему и товара стало больше.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: I request a loan of $250 for my husband who is a rickshaw driver. He already owns a rickshaw but he wants to buy an additional one. He will rent this rickshaw to supplement his current income. I am a mother of three children, all of whom are too young to attend the school. But when they will be of school age, I want to enroll them in a high-quality school. Therefore, we will save the income from this added rickshaw for our children's future.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes Barbosa E., married and with three children, completed sixth year of accounting school. She has her business at the municipal market at Chinandega. Her husband drives a moving truck but, as the income from this activity was insufficient, she decided to start selling meat, as a way of helping with the family’s expenses. Hers is presently among the strongest meat selling businesses.

Ms. Barbosa has been doing business with CEPRODEL for three years and relates that she is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been timely and granted quickly. Moreover, they have helped her make a living for her family and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Mercedes Barbosa E., casada y con tres hijos, cursó hasta el sexto año de contabilidad. Tiene el negocio en el Mercado Municipal de Chinandega. Su esposo trabaja con un camión en acarreo, pero, para obtener otros ingresos, ella decidió dedicarse al negocio de venta de carne, ya que los ingresos que le quedan del camión son muy pocos. Por tal razón, buscando la manera de ayudar al esposo con la carga de la familia, es que ella decide emprender este negocio. Actualmente este negocio es uno de los más fuertes en lo que respecta a la venta de carne de res.

La señora Barbosa trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres años, y nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues le han sido muy oportunos, brindados de manera muy ágil y, en su momento, le sirvieron para salir adelante con su familia, además de para el mejoramiento de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of meat.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena operates a small business selling baby clothes and supplies in Nikolaev, Ukraine. She has an attractively arranged little outdoor kiosk at the Ekur market in Nikolaev where she carries all sorts of necessary items for new mothers. Elena has been in business for about six years and has developed a stable, profitable enterprise based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her husband, Anotolyi. In a typical month she makes around $1300 in profit.

Elena’s business is growing. She has requested a loan of $1200 to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Kireka B1 B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine M.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. Christine is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a tailor. She has 2 children of ages 16 and 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 135000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Rose M., Hasifah N., Teddy N., and Aisha K.. Rose M. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand to bulk selling. Hasifah N. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Teddy N. operates a restaurant business and wants to buy more furniture. Aisha K. is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase hair oils and chemicals.

loans.use: To add in poultry business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick O. is married with 5 children, and he is 45 years old. He sells provisions and soap and has been in business since 2002. He is from Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan of $875 to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Sitha Neoum Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sitha N. lives in Banh Chhkol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She is the group leader of four members. She is 22 years old and the mother of one child.  She sells pots for a living. She is married to Mr. Chan Chheom, who is a security guard. Last year, she applied for a loan from AMK to buy a piece of land to resell for a profit. With the encouragement from her parents and husband, she would like to start another business. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, which she will keep in stock.  When the price of rice increases, she will sell it for a profit.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey P. is 32 years old and is working hard to grow rice day by day. She has been a rice farmer since 1999. She and her husband earn a combined daily income of $3 USD. The couple has two children who are both too young to attend school. They hope to be able to afford to send their children to school as their income becomes more stable.

Rice farming is a crucial profession in Cambodia. However, many farmers are selling their land and giving up traditional farming as big business pours into Cambodia looking for land to develop. As a result, rice crops are becoming smaller and smaller, causing a food shortage in the region. Thus, Srey P.’s profession is a crucial one.

She wants to dig a large basin by her field that she can use to store water for irrigation. This will save her money. Eventually, she hopes to branch out into raising pigs, as well.

loans.use: To dig an irrigation po d

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married and has one daughter. They live in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Sergei owns a vending business at a local market where he sells seeds and pesticides. He has been in this trade for 15 years. Presently, he earns approximately $700 each month. 

Sergei has an entrepreneurial mind that is always active.  He is constantly calculating and always on the lookout for the next big opportunity. His business is profitable and stable. However, Sergei would like to expand it even more. He is requesting a loan of 2500 grivnas to increase his stock and meet the growing demand during the upcoming summer season. 

(Note: this is a short term “seasonal” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: to purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
The group was formed in March 2008 and is made up of 18 hardworking women. The group is lead by María Rosa J. who sells foods. She decided to form her own group, sending invitations to many of her friends, the majority of which were part of a mothers group at the school in their town.

In the Group Divino Niño Jesús all of the members are in good standing with the payment of their balances and they value the opportunities granted to them by the Fundación Paraguaya through this program. They are now in their second cycle and are requesting a total sum of G. 7.600.000.

The group is very united and supportive as they help one another and the group continues to progress. All of them come from economic disadvantage but they are very hardworking. They wish to provide greater economic stability to their children and to be able to collaborate with their husbands to increase their household income.

This group will use the loan in order to buy milk, cheese, tobacco, sweets, fruits, chickens, flour, sugar, noodles, and vegetables among other things to sell, as these women primarily sell these products.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El Grupo fue constituido en el mes de marzo del 2.008, el Comité está integrado por 18 mujeres emprendedoras. El grupo es liderado por la señora María Rosa J. la cual se dedica a la venta de comidas, la misma decidió conformar su propio Comité realizando varias invitaciones a sus compañeras ya que la mayoría de ellas forma parte de una comisión de madres en una escuela de la pueblo.

En el Grupo Divino Niño Jesús todas las integrantes son muy cumplidas con el pago de sus cuotas y valoran la oportunidad que brinda la Fundación Paraguaya mediante éste programa. Ellas se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, en forma global desean retirar el monto de G. 7.600.000.

El grupo es muy unido y solidario ya que todas se ayudan entre sí para que el Comité vaya progresando. Todas son de escasos recursos pero muy emprendedoras, las mismas desean poder brindar una mejor estabilidad económica a sus hijos y poder colaborar con sus esposos al dar un ingreso más en sus hogares.

Este grupo retira el crédito para comprar leche, queso, tabaco, golosinas, frutas, gallinas, harina, azúcar, fideos, verduras entre otros para la venta, ya que estas señoras se dedican principalmente a la venta de estos productos.

loans.use: This group will use the loan in order to buy milk, cheese, tobacco, sweets, fruits, chickens, flour, sugar, noodles, and vegetables.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
K. Zarrina is 29 years old. She is married with three children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Spitamen town, where the demand is always very consistent and high. National dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. K. is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works for these dresses. She is very perseverant and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her store for 10 years. Zarrina has about $3500 in inventory at the moment.

Zarrina is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for quality results and Zarrina has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like her venture to continue to grow. Today, she is requesting a loan of $750 for 12 months to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future. One of her personal goals is to generate additional profit so she can remodel a new apartment she recently bought for her family.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics and increase the range of goods

loans.name: Butum

texts.en: Mrs. Butum M., 29, is a bread seller in her local market. She buys bread from the bread maker and sells them in the market for profit, earning around US$4 per day, while her husband earns around US$3 per day driving motorcycle taxi. The couple lives with four children in Kdol Commune, Battambang Province. To increase her family's income, she needs to add one more business of sugarcane juice, so she would like to request a loan to purchase a machine to make sugarcane juice for sell. The loan will allow her to add business for increasing income.

loans.use: To purchase machine to make sugarcane juice for sell

loans.name: José Rodrigo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León el señor José B. desde hace 25 años se dedica al negocio de elaboración de artesanías las cuales las elabora con el material de trabajo como es barro, arena y leña.

El señor B. tiene sus metas de convertirse en un gran comerciante y por este motivo es que se esfuerza a diario en el negocio. Por esto eso es que hoy en día acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar los materiales de trabajo y así continuar en el negocio que tanto requiere de inversión en este momento.
texts.en:
For 25 years, José B. has worked in the municipality of Telica in the city of León as an artisan, designing crafts with mud, sand and firewood as his work materials. Mr. B.'s goal is to become a sizeable retailer, and it is with this objective in mind that he strives daily in his business. He approached Kiva field partner Ceprodel to request a loan with which to buy work materials and thereby sustain the business that requires so much investment at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials.

loans.name: Djabo Tezi

texts.fr:
Agée de 50 ans madame A. Djabo Tezi est une mère de famille de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a pour activité, la vente des chaussures et produits de consommation courante. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1998 et s’approvisionne dans le marché d’Agoè. 
Actuellement son stock des produits d’alimentation général est presque épuisé et elle désire renouveler le stock par l’achat de 3 sacs de riz, 4 cartons de sucre, deux (2) bidons d’huile et deux (2) cartons de spaghetti.
texts.en:
Ms. Djabo Tezi A. is 50 years old and the mother of a family of four. Her work involves selling shoes and common consumables. She started this business in 1998 and gets her supplies from the Agoè marketplace. Currently, her stock of grocery items is almost exhausted, and she would like to renew the stock by buying 3 sacks of rice, 4 boxes of sugar, 2 drums of oil, and 2 boxes of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara P. sells tomatoes and is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children. Sara is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has five children, who all go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Celmit

texts.es: Celmit tiene 42 años, es madre de cuatro hijos maravillosos y vive con su conviviente quien la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la preparación de distintos platos de comida y bocadillos para diferentes eventos sociales donde la contraten, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años y hasta ahora está muy contenta con su negocio, que además le gusta porque se relaciona con muchas personas. Celmit trabaja solo por contratos con diferentes instituciones y persona particulares, y por ser muy conocida su buena sazón cada vez incrementa su clientela. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará los utensilios y vajilla, también alquilará un local que le sirva como almacén.
texts.en:
Celmit is 42 years old and the mother of four wonderful children. She lives with her common-law husband, who helps her a lot. She prepares different types of food and snacks for social events who hire her. She has been doing this for the past 3 years and so far is very happy with her business and also likes it because she deals with many people. Celmit works by contract with different organizations and individuals and because she is known as a good cook her clientele is growing. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting she will buy utensils and dinnerware as well as rent a storefont which can also be used for storage.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a storefont and buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Demian

texts.en:
Demian D. lives in Cimislia district, Suric village. She is a very responsible and optimistic person. D. wishes to develop her business, consisting of cattle raising, in her village because there is a very high demand for milk from the villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns.

D. is helped by her brother Alexander who lives in the same village and he also borrowed a loan from MicroInvest with the purpose of increasing the number of cattle, together with his sister. D. and Alexander are now faced with many problems because their parents are ill and they want to help them, however it is difficult for them. They find their way out in succeeding in business, so we hope that their capabilities and services provided by MicroInvest will help them improve the business.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Dope

texts.fr: Dope E. est une jeune femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse depuis 4 ans des bassines et ustensiles en plastiques au marché d’Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Avec ce crédit, Dope souhaite accroître la taille de son entreprise en approvisionnant son magasin.
texts.en:
Dope E. is a young woman, 33 years of age, married, and the mother of two. For four years, she has been a retailer of tubs, basins, and plastic utensils at the marketplace in Atakpamé, a city located in central Togo. With this loan, she would like to expand her enterprise by stocking her store.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Diana Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Urb. Las Almendras S/Nº, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 5 hijos, 4 que todavía dependen de ella

Se inició, con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, empezó vendiendo anticuchos, juanes, maduros y plátanos asados. Tiene más de 1 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio de venta de anticuchos, ubicada afuera de su casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, vecinos, amigos y moradores de la comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/800.00 que cancelará a plazo de 6 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la prepación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, aceites, servilletas; como también implementando su negocio, comprando mas mesas, sillas, platos, vasos y vajillas así dar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes.

En lo personal, se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y sabe tomar sus propias decisiones.

Diana Maria, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Diana Maria belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Urb. Las Almendras S/N, Picota district, San Martin state. She is single, 45 years old, and a mother of 5 children, 4 of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she started selling meat skewers, a rice dish, fruit, and grilled bananas. She has been workign with the bank for more than a year. Currently, she continues with this same business that is located outside of her home where she serves her customers, neighbors, friends, and others from the community. With this loan of S/ 800, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she would like to invest in the food preparation items such as rice, sugar, oils, and napkins. She would also like to buy tables, chairs, plates, glasses, and cups to establish her business and make her customers more comfortable. Personally, she feels more independent and responsible with her monthly payments and she knows how to make her own decisions. Diana Maria would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oils, napkins, tables, chairs, plates, glasses, and cups

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 39 years old and married with no child.  She sells foodstuffs, wholesale and retail to her customers.  She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  Grace says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sauiluma

texts.en: Sauiluma F., 37, is married with 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about US $148).  SPBD loans are Sauiluma’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and runs a vending business. She mostly sells fried peanuts and chips. Helen is happily married to Eduardo T.. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with two children. There is Edwin, who is 24 years old and a college graduate. He now works as an Overseas Foreign Worker (OFW). They also have Joel, who is 20 years old. He is currently in his second year in college and is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management.

Aside from snack vending, Helen sells frozen foods and makes native cakes to help generate more profit to meet her children’s needs. In the future, she hopes to have a permanent vending stall, which would make selling easier and generate more customers.

Currently, Helen does not have enough capital to expand her business. She is therefore requesting a loan amounting to PHP8,000.00 to further achieve her business goals. With the loan she will purchase additional items to sell. She prays to God to give her strength in order to become a successful entrepreneur and to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To grow the business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is divorced and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Faustina sells soft drinks such as Fanta, Coca Cola, and assorted fruit juices in Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Faustina uses all her income for paying school fees.

Faustina will use the loan to purchase more drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to save and re-invest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to dell

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha K. is twenty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to two children, both daughters. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Agatha is a food vendor. She fries and sells plantain chips. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell and also sells on a table by the roadside. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for barely one year and wants a loan to buy plantain in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy plantain in bulk

loans.name: Ramona's Group

texts.en:
Gregoria G. M., pictured second from the right and dressed in white, is the group coordinator for her 5-member group called "Trabajadores Unidos", which means "United Workers". She is the single mother of three children: a daughter of 22, and two boys ages 18, and 10. They reside in Paraiso Escondido, a small town in the sector of Punta de Villa Mella, in Santo Domingo Norte. Her daughter began studying law last year, her oldest son is a sophomore in high school, and her youngest son is a talented baseball player.

Her home, along with her previous business, a general store in her home, was swept away when a river flooded near her house last year, taking four other houses with it. As a result, her two oldest children had to stop going school to meet their basic needs. She is starting over now by opening up a similar store from her home, selling general care products and basic medicines.

Gregoria plans to invest in such products as hair-smoothing cream, deodorants, shampoos, medicines, and sandals, which she buys in bulk and says are the products in highest demand. The home she is living in now, Gregoria says, is located in a very strategic business location relative to her town. At the end of this loan, she hopes her store will be firmly reestablished, providing her once more with a steady source of income. With this steady income, she hopes to start saving for her daughter's education, and to be able to pay for her sons' schooling and for the baseball coaching and cleats for her youngest son. She also plans to continue working on finishing her current home, as she has placed 800 out of 1,300 cinder blocks for it so far. Since her business is run from her home, having it completed would allow her business to expand.

Some of her long-term goals are to be able to pay for her daughter's law school education, and also to be able to continue to encourage and support her youngest son, as they hope he makes it to the big leagues.

loans.use: To buy hair-smoothing cream, shampoos, deodorants, sandals and medicines

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes, tiene una pensión donde atiende almuerzos y platos extras, es una gran ayuda para su esposo ya que con su pensión puede solventar los gastos de alimentación de su familia.
Vive en la Zona de obrajes de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus suegros
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos (papa, verduras. Aceite arroz fideo y otros).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lourdes runs a boarding house where she serves breakfast and snacks. Her business is a great help to her husband because she is in charge of the food expenses for the family. She and her family live with her in-laws in the Obrajes district of the city of La Paz.

Her loan will be used to buy supplies (potatoes, vegetables, oil, rice, noodles and other products). This is her third loan with IMPRO. Her payment history qualifies her as a good client capable of making her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary A. is a villager in Tuol Kandal village in the Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small business. She is also a farmer who owns a plot of land on which to cultivate rice. For this plantation, she needs some money to hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Huon Khoeun, is a teacher in the local school. 

Mrs. Sotheary A. is 34 years old and the mother of three children, who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
el grupo Las Luchadoras esta formado por 3 mujeres las cuales se conocen desde hace muchos años atras, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan para ganarse la vida:

la sra. nancy G. M. tiene 25 años, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de comida, su mama les enseño a elaborar ricos platos de comida, actualmente tiene 6 años de tener su negocio y a logrado atraer muchos clientes por su forma de tratar a las personas, cabe mencionar que tambien tiene un molino de quebrar maiz, nos comento que su sueño es tener un restaurante grande y bonito.

la sra. Maria Z. tiene 29 años de edad, ella vende cosmeticos, estos productos en la ciudad de san Lorenzo son bien vendidos, ya que aqui hay muchas mujeres en toda la zona y tiene muchas clientes. Maria es una persona muy activa y muy capaz para las ventas. su sueño es tener un supermercado.

la sra. Maria A. tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales estan estudiando en la escuela primaria, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 6 años. su meta es poder tener un local para montar una tienda de ropa. 

todas ellas necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios que son la unica fuente de ingresos que tienen.

loans.use: compra de pollo, carnes de res y cerdo, frijoles, papas, harina, azucar, cafe, mantequilla, leche, refrescos, embutidos, lociones, pantalones, camisas, blusas, blumers.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Rosa L. se desempeña en su actividad de elaboración y venta de comida específicamente de vigorón siendo vendido a diario en su localidad y muy visitada por los clientes. El vigorón lleva en sus ingrediente yuca, chicharrón y ensalada por lo que estos ingredientes ella necesita para preparar este alimento.

Espera en que Ceprodel puede ayudarle para obtener el crédito y por eso lo solicitó con el fin de obtener la materia prima para continuar realizando el rquísimo vigorón en su localidad.
texts.en:
At the wholesale market in the city of Managua, Sra. Rosa L. prepares and sells food such as “vigorón”. She sells food every day from her vending post and is frequently visited by customers. Vigorón contains cassava, pork skins, and salad greens, so these ingredients are needed to prepare this type of food.

She hopes that CEPRODEL will help her obtain the loan she requested. Sra. Rosa plans to buy ingredients so that she can continue making vigorón from her post in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Zaiat

texts.en: Zaiat sells cooked foods like eba, moimoi, fufu, she has been in this business for long. She is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa D. is a 40-year-old entrepreneur from Pasay City. She is married to Emmanuel, 41, a train operator. Two of their three children are still in school. Nerissa is a dealer of ready-made foot rugs and round rugs. To help augment family income, she also rents out their family car to interested patrons. She earns P7,000 a month from these combined business activities. Nerissa came to know about and became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only last year. She has just finished repaying her previous CCT loan and has applied for a new loan in the amount of P10,000 since their car’s engine is due for overhauling. Nerissa dreams of managing a fleet of brand new cars for her car rental service. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To pay for engine overhaul of the car she rents out

loans.name: Maria De Fatima

texts.es:
La señora   María B. Gíler es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

María tiene 53 años, esta casada y es  madre de nueve hijos, desde hace treinta años se radicaron  en la comunidad Mejía, aquí vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos. Nuestra socia se dedica al trabajo doméstico en casas ajenas desde hace diez años de lunes a viernes, lava, plancha, cocina, limpia, etc. percibiendo un ingreso de 40 dólares por semana, también realiza otras actividades en sus ratos libres y fin de semana como preparar dulces, empanadas de verde y además  ayuda a su  esposo en la agricultura.

Con el préstamo que la fundación ESPOIR le entregue va a  comprar  pollos, alimento y vitaminas para su crecimiento para de esta manera cristalizar su  sueño de  montar un criadero  de pollos en su casa y contar con un ingreso extra para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
María B. Gíler is a member of the Mejía communal bank which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province. This is one of the most beautiful areas of Ecuador due to its beaches and gastronomy. María is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 9 children. They have lived in Mejía for the past 30 years. She lives here with her husband and two of her children. For the past 10 years she has worked Monday through Friday as a domestic in homes where she washes, irons, cooks, cleans, etc. for a salary of 40 dollars per week. In her free time and on weekends she also engages in other activities such as preparing sweets, green empanadas (turnovers), and she helps her husband with his farming. With the loan that ESPOIR will grant she intends to buy chickens, and feed and vitamins to raise them in order to see her dream of running a chicken hatchery from her home which will provide her with extra income to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and vitamins to set up a hatchery.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem P., 41, is a married woman and the mother of four children. Three of them are married and the other is a pupil and dependent on her income. To earn a living, Nhem P. always buys a various flowers in bulk from growers to sell retail along the streets around the community. To help be responsible for supporting the family, her husband owns a small vehicle repair business; he is shown in the picture.

Nhem P. has been using her old motorbike for her business for many years, so it is too old and often breaks down and affects her income. Nhem P. is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 700 which she will use to replace her existing motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace her existing motorcycle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa C. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Teresa is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional seedlings to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional seedlings to raise

loans.name: Yajaira Melissa

texts.es:
Yajaira es una mujer emprendedora y activa, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 21 años y es madre de dos pequeños.
Yajaira junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de repuestos y reparación de motos y motocar, pues ambos se han propuesto salir adelante y lograr sus metas. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” hace un año, donde se ha caracterizado por ser una socia puntual. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò lubricantes para motos y motocar. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 700.00 nuevos soles que utilizarà en la compra de accesorios de motocar. 
La meta de Yajaira es ampliar su taller de reparación de motos y motocar y de esa manera aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yajaira is an entrepreneurial and energetic woman. She lives in Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 21 years old and is the mother of two small children. Yajaira and her husband sell replacement parts and repair motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. Both have decided to get ahead in life and achieve their goals. She has been a part of the “Las Rosas” communal bank for a year, where she has shown herself to be a punctual member. The first loan she received was for PEN 300.00 and she bought lubricants for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. She currently needs a loan of PEN 700.00, which she will use to buy accessories for motorcycle taxis. Yajaira’s goal is to expand her motorcycle and motorcycle taxi repair shop so she can increase her number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy accessories for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin E. is from the village of Nabilid. He is 26 years old, is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Aldrin owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconut products such as copra in the local community. Aldrin has been engaged in his business for almost two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aldrin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aldrin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business and to improve  living conditions for his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 60 años, su esposo falleció, y actualmente vive con dos (mujeres) de sus 4 hijos. Su casa es propia y de material noble de un solo nivel.
Sus deseos de progresar la estimularon a incursionar en el negocio de la venta de productos comestibles. Se inició como vendedora ambulante, frente a su casa, con su carreta de muy pocos productos, con el correr de los años, poco a poco pudo incrementar su mercaderías, lo que le permitió acumular mayores ganancias, las cuales invertía en la educación de sus hijos y en la construcción de su casa, allí acondicionó un espacio apropiado para su bodega.
De los 15 años que lleva en este negocio, reconoce que lo que más disfruta es atender a sus clientes, pues está muy agradecida por la preferencia, por lo que siempre los recibe con gran amabilidad.

Este es su décimo cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo tanto sabe que debe trabajar duramente para no defraudar a sus compañeros de grupo, quienes depositaron su confianza en ella. Con los 600 soles solicitados comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para mantener surtida y atractiva su bodega.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 60, and her husband died. She currently lives with two (daughters) of her four children. Her house is her own, and it is one level made from solid material. Her desire to progress motivated her to set up a business selling food products. She started as a street vendor in front of her house with her cart and very few products. As time went by she was able to increase her inventory little by little. This allowed her to accumulate greater income, which she invested in her children’s education and building her house. She set up an appropriate space in her house for her convenience store. She has been in this business for 15 years. What she likes the most is waiting on her customers. She is very grateful for their business, and she always greets them in a very friendly way. This is her 14th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she needs to work hard in order to not cause problems for her colleagues in the group. They have put their faith in her. She will use the 600 PEN she is requesting to buy more merchandise to keep her convenience store well stocked and attractive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La sra. Wilma es una cliente antigua, muy puntual y responsable de nuestra institución, ella se dedica a las manualidades, elabora trabajos de pintura en tela, bordados, y muñecos en soft, es muy conocida por la zona y por eso tiene bastanates pedidos de manteles juegos de baño y demás adornos, para las fiestas de fin de año tuvo pedidos de adornos navideños y estuvo también distando clases. Tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes y cada uno ya tiene su familia, pero siempre están con ella, vive en la zona de Pampahasi en una casa en alquiler, en la misma casa vive también su hija, por lo que ella está con sus nietos. 
El crédito que solicita es para compra de material para dictar clases de pintura en madera.						
						
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Wilma is a long-standing, punctual and responsible client of our institution. She makes handicrafts. She paints on fabric, does embroidery, makes plush toys. She is very well-known in her neighborhood so she has many orders for tablecloths, bathroom sets and other home decorations. At the end of the year festivities, she had many orders for Christmas decorations and she also taught some crafts classes. She has three children who are all independent and have their own families. However, they are always with her. She lives in the Pampahasi neighborhood in a leased house. Her daughter also lives in the same house so Wilma cares for her grandchildren. She will use the funds to buy supplies for her paint-on-wood crafts classes. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her enough to grant the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Griselda Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo, la señora Griselda se dedica con gran ahínco al negocio de venta de discos compactos de videos y música ofertados en su propio establecimiento donde a diario vende los discos con el fin de obtener ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los discos compactos para continuar ofreciéndolos en el mercado y así realizar sus ventas con el fin de obtener el ingreso necesario para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Griselda sells CDs and DVDs in the Mayoreo market every day in order to generate income to improve her family's quality of life. She is asking for funding to buy CDs in order to be able to continue to offer them for sale and earn income sufficient to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 24-year-old single woman living alone. After getting her university certificates, she started working as a private teacher from her home. She helps her family members who live in the village by sending income to them. 

Today, Rita is requesting $1,000 to buy a laptop computer and a printer with scanner. This will improve her work and facilitate her research and homework preparation because she's planning to receive more students.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer and a printer with scanner

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce M. makes palm kernel oil for sale at Elmina. Joyce has received junior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder. She helps her husband in taking care of her children. Her loan will be added to her income to buy more palm nuts to make the kernel oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house on an already bought piece of land. This picture was taken at the site where she makes the oil.

loans.use: Her loan will be added to her income to buy more palm nuts to make the kernel oil for sale

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es: Rubén Z. H. de 48 años de edad, reside en San Marcos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad. Rubén posee una venta de verduras, la cual esta ubicada en la terminal del sur, lugar en el cual llegan los buses desde el occidente del país, lo cual lo hace un lugar muy apto para este tipo de comercio, así mismo Rubén se sube a los buses a ofrecer sus productos, los cuales los coloca dentro de una bolsa plástica, con una medida exacta, para ofrecerlos a los pasajeros del transporte público, mientras tanto su esposa se encarga de atender el negocio. Desde hace 6 años que él junto a su esposa se dedican a este tipo de trabajo, lo cual les ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario para contar con una vida estable. Rubén solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, en gran variedad de estas, ya que a este lugar llegan diferentes tipos de personas con diversos gustos. Todo esto les permitirá crecer en su negocio y de esta manera tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rubén Z. H. is 48 years old and resides in San Marcos, located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 11 and 12. Rubén has a vegetable stand located in the south terminal where all the buses arrive from the western part of the country. This place is suitable for this type of business since the vegetables he offers are shipped in by bus. He packages the vegetables into plastic bags and weighs them precisely before offering them to the bus passengers for sale. Meanwhile, his wife is in charge of attending to the customers. Rubén and his wife have been in this business for six years and it has permitted them to have everything necessary to live a stable life.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy a large quantity and variety of vegetables so that he can cater to different types of people with different tastes. This will allow him to grow in his business and achieve a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector La Pradera de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad conocida a nivel nacional como Ciudad de la Amistad, es uno de los principales ejes comerciales del norte peruano, dado su movimiento comercial, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza vía catálogo, empezó en este negocio debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos adicionales que le permitieran ayudar al sostenimiento familiar. Empezó buscando sus propios clientes y durante este tiempo ella se ha esforzado por salir adelante y poco a poco sus ventas se han incrementado, actualmente ha logrado ascender al cargo de coordinadora de un grupo de vendedoras, esto la llena de orgullo y ganas de seguir trabajando.

Virginia desea instalar en su vivienda un pequeño puesto de venta donde pueda mostrar un stock permanente de productos, siguiendo este objetivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a adquirir la mercadería que necesita. Esta acción le permitirá vender productos de belleza cuando el cliente lo necesite, sin necesidad de que tengan que esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando el pedido llega a sus manos.
