Virginia es una mujer entregada a su familia y que se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para sacarlos adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 44 and lives with her husband and 2 children in the La Pradera area of the city of Chiclayo, a city known at the national level as the City of Friendship. It is one of the main commercial axes in northern Peru. Given its commercial activity, it is the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has sold cosmetics and beauty products by catalog for more than 5 years. She started this business due to the need to obtain additional income to allow her to help sustain her family. She started looking for her own customers, and during this time, she has strived to get ahead. Little by litte, her sales have increased. Currently, she has managed to assume the role of coordinating a group of saleswomen. This fills her with pride and the desire to keep working. Virginia hopes to install a small sales stand in her home where she can display a permanent stock of products. To accomplish this objective, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN, which she will use to acquire the merchandise she neeeds. This will let her sell more beauty products, which her customers need, without the need to wait until the end of the month, which is when her delivery arrives. Virginia is a woman who is devoted to her family, and she has decided to work to take good care of them. She has already worked previously with our institution, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to intall a small sales stand in her home

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 38-year-old woman who lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms in which she has been living with her family for the past 15 years.
   
She is a mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder daughter reads in 12th standard, the next reads in 6th standard and the youngest one reads in 2nd standard. Her elder son reads in 4th standard and the next two read in kindergarten. Zahida dreams of seeing her children with good educations and settled in good positions. 

To achieve her dream, she performs her duty of a seamstress. Her duty pays her a reward in a shape of money, which she saves for the future of her kids. She has been doing this work for over three years. Her clientele base includes her neighbors.
 
Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a tea stall in the food market. His tea stall is famous with customers. His presentation attracts more customers to his tea stall. He offers a variety of tea, such as milky, creamy and green. His stall is going well because the people of Pakistan are fond of tea in every season, whether it is summer or winter. He has eight years of experience running the tea stall.
 
Zahida has successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for a loan for the second time to purchase items (milk, tea and sugar) to expand her husband’s tea-stall business.

loans.use: Purcahse items for tea stand

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia F. is from the village of Canitoan, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 56 years old, married the mother of eight adult-aged children.  She owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling phone cards in her community.  Claudia has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Claudia joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  Claudia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to expand her business.  She wants to add more products to sell.  This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her income.
-------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn H. (in the photo) is a widow with four sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside of the family home and the other three children work in a garment factory. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Simorn has been selling fruit for more than twenty years. She buys fruit from her villagers and transports to sell at a market in Phnom Penh. Simorn applied for a Kiva loan one time already. Now she wants to build a kitchen because she does not have a proper place to cook.  Therefore, she is she requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to use for the project.

loans.use: To build a kitchen where she can cook.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna J. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Luna is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Luna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Luna has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luna is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Martha Maria tiene 41 años, reside en San Miguel, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de las edades de 6 y 7 años, tiene una venta de hot dog de forma ambulante. 
Es originaria de Nicaragua, que emigro con el sueño de iniciar su propio negocio y para enviar dinero a los padres que residen en su país natal, ella vende panes de forma ambulante en una bicicleta de carga, recorre las calles de San Miguel  para obtener mejores ventas. Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de dos bicicletas y  compra de materia prima para elaboración de panes,(pan salchichas, salsa de tomate, mayonesa). Esto contribuirá a mejorar  el negocio y generar trabajo.
Las aspiraciones son mejorar la calidad  de vida los padres, ya que dependen económicamente de ella, lograr de los hijos pueda estudiar para tener mejores oportunidades en la vida .
texts.en:
Martha María is 41 years old. She lives in San Miguel and is a single mother of two children, aged 6 and 7. She sells hotdogs as a street vendor. She is from Nicaragua and immigrated with the dream of staring her own business and to send money to her parents who live in her native country. She sells hotdogs as as a street vendor in a cargo bike. She travels the streets of San Miguel to get better sales. She is asking for a loan to invest in purchasing two bicycles and raw material to make hotdogs (hotdog buns, ketchup, mayonnaise). This will help to improve her business and generate work. Her aspirations are to improve her parents' quality of life, since they depend on her financially, and for her children to be able to go to school so they can have better opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two bicyles, hotdog buns, ketchup, mayonnaise.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 52, married and a father of four.  His wife is a farmer and he runs a retail shop.  He also helps his wife in farming.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  He is a member of Ikinya Ria Mbere group in Faulu Kenya where he saves his money.  The members of the group also guarantee each other's loan. Therefore, he has requested 50,000 KES to purchase sugar, maize flour and salt. He dreams of buying a plot in the future. He wants to own a supermarket in ten years.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and salt

loans.name: Janett

texts.en:
Janett Q. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Janett owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like banana kabab in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Janett joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janett is now requesting her first loan from HSPFI, worth 4,000 PHP.  She will use this money to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food stall. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an of accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Urantuya

texts.en: Urantuya D. is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Her two children both attend university. She has been managing a dental clinic since 1990. She usually produces dentures for a price of 10,000-80,000 MNT per tooth. She has gained many years of work experience. She travels to the sub-provinces once a month to get customers' requests and to deliver dentures. Traveling through neighboring sub-provinces is very profitable as the service she provides is very rare. She has a good moral character. Urantuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to fund traveling to more sub-provinces to provide dental services for her customers.

loans.use: to go to more sub-provinces to provide dental services

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan C. is from the city of Macupa Tangub City. She is 44 years old. Susan is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Susan grows coconuts, which she sells. Susan has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly L. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Nelly is married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 21 years old and the youngest is 6. To make a living, Nelly owns & operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelly also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes to acquire more pigs to raise.

Nelly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nelly has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies, feed and additional piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, feeds and additional piglets.

loans.name: Sai

texts.en:
Sai P., 45, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. P. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 66 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new tuk-tuk for her husband to improve his transportation business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new tuk tuk (a motorcycle with a cabin) to improve the business

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo sont des femmes mariées  dans des familles polygames, avec en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et résidant toutes dans le centre de Fakola l’une des Sous préfecture de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font toutes le commerce de céréales sauf Bakoro Koné, un des membres du groupe excelle  dans l’achat vente des articles divers. Elle achète  les paquets de cigarettes, bonbons, sucre, thés  etc.
Dans le but d’étoffer leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier   prêt solidaire. 
Bakoro Koné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des articles divers  auprès des grossistes au marché de Fakola. Bakoro effectue sa vente à domicile, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes qui achètent au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group are married women in polygamous families, on average 35 years old with four children, and all residing in the centre of Fakola, one of the sub-prefectures of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They became acquainted as neighbours and all are retailers of grain cereals excepting Bakoro Kone, who excels in retailing various items. She retails cigarettes, candy, sugar, tea, etc.

Wanting to bolster their stock supply and diversify the items for sale, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso where they are beginning a first group loan cycle.

Bakoro Kone wants to use her loan to buy various items from wholesalers at the Fakola market. Bakoro sells door-to-door, to mainly women customers, for cash and sometimes for credit.

As with other group members, she hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 18,000 FCFA which will serve to reimburse the loan and take care of the family’s food condiment needs.

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, tiene 54 años de edad,  estado civil casada, con ocho hijos y sin estudio.
La señora tiene su negocio de venta de pescado entre ellos Carachi y pejerrey. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero utilizo para comprar redes de pesca, actividad realizada por su esposo.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the “San Salvador” community bank which is located in Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department.  She is 54 years old, married and has 8 children.  She never attended school.

Francisca has a business selling different types of fish including 'carachi' and 'pejerrey'.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to buy fishing nets for her husband.

She is now requesting a loan for 1,500 nuevo soles which she will use to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to succeed in her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is the savings.

loans.use: To increase the working capital of her business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret T. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children all of whom are currently in school.  Margret operates a bar as a business which she has had for five years.  She also does art and craft  

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more millet for making local beer. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Margret hopes to own a plot. Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To buy more millet for making local beer

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida M. is from the village of Bagong Silang Centro West, Santiago. She is 43 years old. Leonida is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Leonida M..

Leonida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her manicure/pedicure service

location.town: Bagong Silang Centro West , Santiago City

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 06 hijos, la señora realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  R. desde hace 02  años,  su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales menores.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con el que podrá comprar en gran cantidad de cuy, gallinas, cuenta que hará sus casas de los animales, participan en este negocio sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción.

Su visión es que sus hijos salgan profesionales para que no tengan problemas económicos.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y intercambiar palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank, "3 de Mayo II," located in the Puno district of Puno province in the department of Puno. She is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. She has a high school education.

María has been working with Movimiento Manuela R. for two years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles. She invested those funds in her business selling small animals. 

Her new loan is in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles. This loan will allow her to buy a large quantity of guinea pigs and hens. She also plans to build housing for them. Her children help her with her business and her husband works in construction.

Her dream is that her children will become professionals so that they won't have any financial worries. She appreciates the punctuality of her communal bank and the fact that it gives her the opportunity to talk with the other bank members.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals such as hens and guinea pigs, among others.

loans.name: Constance Nyevu

texts.en:
Constance Nyevu K. is 23 years old and lives in Tezo in Kilifi. She is married and they have one child. Constance’s husband brings in additional income from his carpentry business. 

Constance owns a food kiosk and has been in this business for the last six years. Her business is doing well. This marks her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase flour, maize meal, cereals and cooking oil. 

The anticipated profits will be used to open another food kiosk. Constance's dream and hope is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: Purchase flour, maize meal, cereals and cooking oil

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alfredo; el tiene 32 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en las diferentes obras que le solicitan él es maestro constructor  y de esta manera el saca  a su familia adelante siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento el socio es una persona bien optimista y desea comprar materiales de trabajo ya que algunos de sus materiales lo perdió y desea reponerlo ya que sin sus materiales él no puede trabajar de manera optima el socio desea seguir trabajando ya que mediante este trabajo el saca  a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales de madera para su trabajo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Alfredo is a member of the village bank "AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA".  The bank is located in the district of Saylla, in the province and department of Cusco.  

He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children.  He works on different projects for which is is commissioned. He is a master carpenter, and this is how he takes care of his family, since this is the only activity that he is undertaking right now.  He is a very optimistic person and wants to buy materials for his work since some of his materials were lost and he wants to replace them.  Without his materials he cannot do his work fully and he wishes to keep working in order to maintain his family.

He asks for a loan to buy wood materials for his work.

He is happy about the loan and promises to meet the payment quotas.

loans.use: To buy wood materials for work

loans.name: Julius Kinyua

texts.en:
Julius has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. He is 34 years old, married to Jane Gathoni and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan amount to clear paying for land he has purchased.

In the future, Julius hopes to start dairy farming on the piece of land he just bought.

loans.use: To pay off purchased land

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga M. is thirty years old.  He is married to a business lady and they do not yet have any children. 

Mutunga's business is located at Mama Ngina, Kizingo Estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites and its white beaches on the Indian ocean. 

Mutunga does photography, video editing as well as sell films for a living. He has been in this business for eleven years and has managed to provide employment for one person. His major customers are tourists who go to the coast. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However he works very hard from morning to evening to keep his business doing well.

Mutunga is using this loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a video machine to grow his business. He hopes to own a big studio in future. He describes himself as focused and persuasive.

loans.use: To buy video machine

loans.name: Yang's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen members who will use their portions to support different purposes. Mrs. Yang, born in 1963, has been selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Yang’s husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small amount of income to support their family. The couple doesn’t have any children. Mrs. Yang earns a living by selling both vegetables and fish in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it but does not have enough money to do so. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more vegetables and fish for supporting and enlarging her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fish to expand her business

loans.name: Abubakarr

texts.en: Abubakarr T. is 59 years old, married, and has six children. In 1999, he established his electrical and building materials business. He began his business as a means of livelihood for his family. His customers use his materials to repair their old buildings. Working seven days a week, 12 hours a day, Abubakarr earns about 950,000 SLL every month. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy more electrical and other building materials. In the future, Abubakarr plans to educate all his children to university level and purchase a piece of land where he will build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase electrical and other building materials

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis W. is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  He sells clothes and has been in this business for 13 years. He also owns a rental house in Shanzu, Mombasa.  Francis is requesting his third loan from  KADET, which he will use to finance his business by adding more clothes for sale and to renovate his rental house. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of the house and repayment of the loan. Francis’s dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell and to renovate his rental house

loans.name: Esperanza Para Vivir 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Bienvenida lives in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. The economy depends on agricultural industries. Bienvenida and her group of 10 members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Esperanza para vivir 1, & 2 (Hope to live).

Bienvenida requires a loan to purchase underwear and accessories. She runs a small business selling in her neighborhood and by walking through different communities. This is Bienvenida´s first loan with Esperanza International. She will take a step toward improving her business by investing this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over two years, after she decided to start doing business and identified that underwear sales was the right activity to do.
 
She says that her favorite things are to cook and to rest at her home.  Bienvenida and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear and accessories to sell

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha Lorena, tiene la edad de 46 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , séptima calle , junto a su esposo el cual labora como chofer para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos que actualmente estudian y le apoyan con las actividades del hogar , doña Martha labora como domestica en una casa privada , lo cual sus ingresos no le permiten realizar compras de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , ella quiere el préstamo para la compra de zinc ya que se acerca el invierno y no logro quitar todas las laminas dañadas , al igual que perlines , pintura y otros materiales que requiere la inversión . Se siente contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic para poder mejorar su condición de vida siendo una persona humilde y muy sencilla.
texts.en: Martha Lorena, 46 years old, lives at Ticuantepe, Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, Seventh Street, with her husband, who works as a chauffeur to help with household expenses. They have two children in their care who are currently studying and who help them with household chores. Martha works as a maid in a private home; her wages aren't enough to help them with this one-time construction material purchase. She wants a loan to purchase zinc since it is getting close to winter and they weren't able to strip all the damaged roofing sheets. She also needs to purchase beams, paint, and other materials that cost money. She is happy with the help that Kiva partner Afodenic provides to help her improve her living conditions, as she is humble and simple.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Numonjon

texts.en:
Numonjon is married and has one young child.  He has a small store where he sells men’s shoes and clothing.  He runs the store with his mother, who encouraged him to start the business and is very supportive.  Numonjon has been in this business for three years. 

He is requesting a loan of $2000 USD to purchase more clothing goods.  The business is currently in its high season.  Numonjon believes that opening second retail business will give him an advantage over his competitors and provide more profits for his family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy clothing for sale

loans.name: Sainkhuu

texts.en:
Sainkhuu is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and parents-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife are a newly wed couple and currently they don’t have their own house. 

Sainkhuu has been running a farming business since 1996 by growing vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, cabbages and onions. He is an experienced farmer. 

He used to rent a van to deliver his products to the market, but recently, he bought a minivan. Now he uses his minivan to transport his own vegetables to market and he transports other farmers' vegetables to market as well. 

The loan he is taking will be partly used to invest in his farming business and partly to build a garage for his minivan.

loans.use: To invest in his farming business by extending his land plot and also to build a garage for his minivan.

loans.name: Berania Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Berania Auxiliadora es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada de 25 años de edad. Ella tiene un salón de belleza desde hace cinco años el cual inicio con unos ahorros en su comienzo era pequeño y contaba con lo necesario. Hoy en día el negocio ha ido creciendo además vende gaseosas y jugos enlatados.
 Berania sueña con tener un negocio grande con todo lo necesario e invertirá el crédito en la compra de cosméticos, tinte, vanidades…etc.
texts.en: Berania is a hard-working 25-year-old woman. She has had a beauty salon for the past five years, which she started with her savings. At first it was small and she only had what was necessary. Today the business is growing and she also sells soft drinks and juices. Berania's dream is to have a bigger business with everything she needs. She plans to invest in the loan in the purchase of cosmetics, dye, vanities, etc.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, dye, vanities, etc.

loans.name: Chichicazapa Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Nuevo Paso Nazareno ó Chichicazapa la cual se caraccteriza por ser una comunidad indigina en la donde todos sus habitantes hablan el dialecto Mazateco, el esta localidad existe una UDE (grupo integrado por mas de 10 personas) la cual lleva el nombre de su comunidad "Chichicazapa" porque ellos asi se identifican mas, est grupo esta integrado por 10 personas.
Uno de los integrantes de este grupo es Amada ella tiene la edad de 20 años, se encuentra soltera y solo estudio hasta el segundo años de Telesecundaria, ella nos platica que actualmente vive con sus padres y dos de sus hermanos, y que desde que dejo de estudiar tuvo que iniciar a trabajar pero como su comunidad es pequeña no hay muchas fuentes de trabajo asi que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, ella realiza sus ventas los dias miercoles pero un dia antes ofrece con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad sus carne y al otro despues de aliñar el cerdo, entrega los pedidos.
Ella nos platica que la venta de carne de cerdo es algo muy laborioso y trabajoso porque desde dias antes tiene que salir a otros pueblos a comprar el cerdo que va a aliñar y en alguas ocaciones le es muy dificil encontrar cerdo y tiene que ir mas lejos a Playa V. pero ella es una mujer muy luchona ya que tiene que salcar a adelante a su familia y a el mas pequeño de sus hermanos que esta enfermo de una pierna.
Amada necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos, alimento y bolsas platicas para poder realizar su venta.
Ella nos comenta que espera que con este credito su negocio prospere y que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y hermanos y tambien que sus hermanos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una profesion para que en un futuro puedan tener una mejor vida.
Los demas intengrantes del grupo son:
Minerva- Venta de pollo
Juana- Venta de refrescos
Sara- Venta de ropa
Cecilia-Venta de refrescos
Margarita Venta de Antojitos Mexicanos
Marcelina-  Venta de Antojitos Mexicanos
Edith- Venta de refrescos
Juana- Venta de carne
Luisa- Venta de refrescos
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called Nuevo Paso Nazareno, or Chichicazapa, which is an indigenous community where all of the inhabitants speak the Mazateco dialect.  Here there is a communal bank (made up of 10 people) that carries the "Chichicazapa," name of its community, because this is the name they identify with the most.  This group has 10 members.

One of the members of this group is Amada.  She is 20 years old, single, and completed only two years of secondary school.  She tells us that now she lives with her parents and two of her brothers.  Ever since she left school she started to work, but since her community is small there are not a lot of job opportunities so she decided to start her own business selling pork meat.  She makes her sales on Wednesdays, but the day before she offers her meat to her friends and neighbors in the community.  The next day, after seasoning the pork, she delivers her orders. 

She tells us that selling pork is a difficult and arduous business because days before she has to go out to the other towns to buy the pig that she will prepare, and at times it is very difficult to find a pig and she has to go very far from Playa V..  But she is a very tenacious woman, since she has to support her family and also her youngest brother, who has a hurt leg.

Amada needs this loan to invest in the purchase of pigs, feed and plastic bags to make her sales.  She tells us that she hopes that with this loan her business will prosper.  She wants to provide a better quality of life to her parents and brothers, and she also hopes that her brothers will have the opportunity to study a profession so that in the future they will have a better life.  

The other members of the group are:

Minerva- who sells chicken
Juana- who sells soft drinks
Sara- who sells clothing
Cecilia-who sells drinks
Margarita - who sells traditional Mexican snacks
Marcelina-  who sells traditional Mexican snacks
Edith- who sells drinks
Juana- who sells meat
Luisa- who sells drinks

loans.use: to sell meat, drinks, clothing and traditional Mexican snacks

location.town: Nuevo Paso Nasareno, San Miguel Soyaltepec, oaxaca

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel, tiene la edad de 45 años, está soltero  y vive solo actualmente. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con la plantación ya establecida ya en un área apta y lo que pretende es mejorarla para obtener mayores ganancias y cosechas. El pretende salir adelanta con su proyecto, generar las ganancias para crecer como caficultor de la zona y tener un futuro económico más estable para su bienestar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 45 years old, single, and currently lives alone.  He wants to use the money from this loan to buy supplies for his coffee crop.  He has an established plantation in a good area and he wants to improve it so that he can improve his harvest and income.  He wants to move forward with his project, generate income, grow as a grower in the zone, and have a more stable financial future for his own well-being.

This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He had not had previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted him this one with ease and at much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to improve his coffee crop

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and married with six children.  She earns a living by farming rice, which she has been doing for a year.  She also earns income from selling vegetables.

Lolita is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through Kiva field partner NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 51 years old. She is married with one child to care for. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. While not her only source of income, Remedios has been working on her farm for 1 year now. Every month she receives a total of PHP 5,000.
In 2007, Remedios joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for milling and to plow the field for the next production cycle. In the coming years she hopes to reap a very good harvest and is plowing and cultivating additional land to generate more income.

loans.use: To pay for milling and for plowing

loans.name: Esailama

texts.en:
Proudly a New Orleans original, Bissap Breeze is a non-alcoholic beverage, with a smooth blend of brewed hibiscus flowers, organic blue agave nectar, natural extracts and spices. 

Husband and wife team Esailama and Tyrone were first introduced by Abdoulaye “Papa” Camara, a native from Senegal and one of the founders of the Sengalese National Dance Company. Esailama explains that their mom and pop company is a perfect marriage of her business administration background and her husband’s entrepreneurial skill (he has had a successful line of oils, incense, and shampoos as an herbalist for over a decade). Camara introduced Esailama, a dancer, and Tyrone, a drummer, and was a mainstay in their lives and the New Orleans cultural community for many years. Camara was stranded for many days after Katrina and died from complications caused by cancer not long after being evacuated and returning to his native Senegal. The couple sees their company as part of a cultural and vocational heritage he bequeathed to them. Six years after Katrina, some of Tyrone’s family are still displaced. Esailama explains that the company melds together family traditions and culture, and their product includes spices that have been passed down in the family for many generations.  

“Bissap” is a West African word for “hibiscus.” In many cultures globally, the hibiscus is valued for its medicinal properties. High in antioxidants and vitamin C, the Bissap Breeze product can be used as a tea, in cooking, or as a cocktail mix. The company launched its first product sales of Bissap Breeze at the French Market during Jazz Fest weekend earlier this year, and the company has rapidly expanded. A portion of the proceeds from the sale of each bottle are used to support the performing arts and ensure that the cultural legacy of dance and music live on in New Orleans.  

This Kiva loan will be used to purchase organic agave, the most expensive ingredient in the product, as well as for marketing expenses and working capital.  “We’re not just out to make a product,” says Esailama, “but to us this is about creating something that is life-giving."

loans.use: to purchase the ingredient organic agave, and for marketing and other working capital expenses.

loans.name: Solidaridad De Tecoac Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Solidaridad D. Tecoac", esta ubicada en el Estado D. Mexico. Esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es L. septima vez que solicitan un prestamo. Isabel es L. tesorera del grupo. ElL. tiene 33 años, estudio hasta L. secundaria, se dedica a L. costura D. ropa, tiene en total 4 hijos; 2 hijas y 2 varones. ElL. tiene un pequeño taller D. costura, se dedica a reparar prendas D. vestir, tales como: pantalones, cierres, sueter, camisas y hace vesturiarios para festivales en las escuelas. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años aproximadamente.  Solicita el prestamo para comprar hilos, telas y refacciones para L. maquina que tiene. Con esto espera obtener mayor ingresos para su familia, ademas elL. anheL. con las ganancias que obtenga y sus ahorros comprar otra maquina para poder tener a alguien que L. apoye cuando tenga bastante trabajo y pedidos. Al momento D. solicitar el prestamo elL. se siente feliz porque cuenta con L. oportunidad D. poder invertirlo en su negocio.
texts.en: This group is called "Solidaridad D. Tecoac". It is located in the state of Mexico. It is maD. up of 10 members and this is the seventh time they have asked for a loan. Isabel is the group's treasurer. She is 33, went to high school, and sews clothing. She has 4 children, 2 daughters and 2 sons. She has a small sewing shop, and she repairs clothing such as: pants, zippers, sweaters, and shirts. She also makes costumes for school festivals. She started this business about 8 years ago. She is asking for the loan to buy thread, fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine. With this, she hopes to have more income for her family. She also wants to buy another machine with her income and savings in order to have someone help her when there is a lot of work and orders. At this time, while asking for this loan, she is happy because she has the chance to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products (flour, rice, oil, fish, etc.) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

loans.name: Dioclesiano

texts.en:
Dioclesiano is married and has three school-aged children. He is 42 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Dioclesiano is a farmer and grows palay (unhulled rice) to earn a living. He takes good care of his fields. Farming is considered the dominant means of livelihood in this place. He has been cultivating this land for three years. The family also has alternative sources of income and that allows the family to earn PHP 10,000 a month. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase farm fertilizers to boost production. 

In the future, Dioclesiano hopes to have a good return on investment and farm more land. He dreams of being financially stable and giving a better living situation to his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers to boost production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase radiators and exhaust systems.

loans.name: Alafia A Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Alafia A” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small-town in Western Sierra Leone, near Freetown. “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch in this town specifically to help mothers of school-aged girls. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata.  Fatmata is age 55.  She was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is a social worker.  Two of her children are attending primary school and 3 are in secondary school. 

For more than 20 years now, Fatmata has been a businesswoman. She sells palm-oil, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), rice, etc.  With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, gari, rice, etc, at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy merchandise used for auto repairs.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a mini-hardware store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has been running the mini-hardware for 11 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. Christina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Lulasi

texts.en:
Lulasi, age 50, earns her living by selling food items in Kator, South Sudan. She has operated her business for ten years.
 
Lulasi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts and breads to offer for sale. She will use the extra income expected from this loan to help pay the school fees of her four children, who are between the ages of five and 20 years old. Three of her children are enrolled in school.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts and breads to offer for sale

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Danelia una humilde comerciante de 47 años de edad, casada, se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Cuando ella inicio fue vendiendo dulces que ella misma elaboraba y también vendía toallas , después consiguió un lugar para vender en la acera del Mercado de Granada y justo ahí comenzó a vender mercadería entre ellos juguetes , artículos usados, sabanas. Es muy conocida pues la afluencia de clientes es muy seguida y su peculiar forma de atender a sus cliente y el cariño con que ofrece su mercadería la hace muy solicitada. Además ella tiene una mini pulpería  
En su casa de habitación ya que son parte de su segundo ingresos aunque la falta de productos que ofrecer no le ha permito crecer a su mini pulpería. Es por ello que realizo el crédito para compra de granos básico, sopas, pan , dulces, galletas, productos de limpieza, aceite, frijoles. Pues necesita ofrecer estos productos para poder ofrecer calidad y mejorar los ingresos de su negocio. Una de sus expectativas es establecer  un tramo con buenas condiciones ya que es donde esta actualmente es al aire libre y no cuenta con seguridad.
texts.en:
Danelia is a humble merchant, 47 years old and married, who sells general merchandise. When she began, she sold sweets that she made herself, as well as towels. Later, she secured a place to sell in the area near the Market of Grenada. That's where she began selling other merchandise, such as toys, used items, and sheets. She's very well known so her customers' support is continuous. Her unique way of waiting on her customers and the care with which she sells her merchandise leaves her very sought after. 

In addition, she has a small corner store in her house, which makes up part of her secondary income, though a lack of products to offer has kept her from growing her store. Therefore, she needs this loan to buy basic grains, soups, bread, sweets, crackers, cleaning products, oils, and beans so that she can 
offer quality merchandise and increase the revenues of her business. 

One of her ambitions is to establish a better quality site of her own, as she currently sells in the open air with no guarantee of safety.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, bread, sweets, crackers, cleaning products, oils, and beans.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 52 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Manuel está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de maíz, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Jose aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 

Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.

Manuel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 52-year-old man who lives with his family in a community in the southern zone of Costa Rica, in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural and livestock production, particularly the growing of tubers, coffee, corn and beans, and livestock raising.

Manuel is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones so that he can care for his crops, buying fertilizer and fungicide to protect his corn seed crops as it is a reliable and sustainable choice.  With these fertilizers, Manuel will increase the soil's capacity to absorb different nutritional elements.  He will use the fungicides to avoid fungus appearing on his plantations so that his customers will not risk ingesting them and becoming ill.

In this way, Manuel will provide good-quality produce to his customers.  He will reach the sales goal that he has set out for each month.  He will also be able to meet his obligations and payments so that he can provide for his large family.

Manuel is a member of the Danta community loan company, one of 150 community loan companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides for growing corn

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en:
Israfil is a 27 year old young man and is married with one daughter. Israfil is IDP. He has been raising fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. His father taught him the best experience in raising crops. 

Israfil usually sells his crop in the central market. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in an Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.

Israfil would like to increase the number of products he sells and for this purpose he applied for 600 AZN loan. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rosario

texts.es:
Carmen es una microempresaria que hecha y vende tortillas en su casa de habitación desde hace cinco años.

Tiene dos trabajadoras en el negocio quienes les paga su salario generando empleo a dos cabezas de familias, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, cal, etc.
texts.en:
Carmen has run a small business making and selling tortillas in her house for the past five years. She employs two female workers, thus providing an income for two heads of households.

The money from the loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, lime etc.

loans.use: buy corn, firewood, lime etc.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en: Ravshan is widowed. She is careful mother of 3 children. Ravshan has been busy with sewing more than 12 years. Her business is the only source of her family income. Ravshan sews Tajik national women dresses. She has regular customers thanks to the good service. Ravshan always tries for education of her children. Her son is a student. Ravshan must to pay for his tuition but she has not enough money. Ravshan is asking for a loan to pay for tuition of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition of her son

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria M. M. is a single mother. She has a small coffee shop inside an elementary school here in Nuevo Laredo. Her menu is tacos, burritos, corn, juice, soda and some snacks, and she sells her food to the students at lunch time. She wants to incorporate more healthy food for the students instead of only snacks, and this is why she is applying for a loan of $900. With this money she will buy more ingredients to make healthy snacks and give a better option to the students and this will also increase her family income.

Español

La Sra. Candelaria Martínez Martínez es Madre soltera y tiene una pequeña tiendita en una escuela primaria de Nuevo Laredo en la cual les vende alimentos a los estudiantes (como tacos, lonches, fritos, elotes, refrescos, jugos y etc.) en la hora de recreo. Ella quiere elaborar comida más saludable para los estudiantes de la escuela y con esto generar un mejor ingreso para su familia, incrementando sus ventas y dando mejores opciones de alimentación a los estudiantes, por ello solicita un préstamo de $900.00 con los cuales pretende comprar los ingredientes para su proyecto. Este crédito piensa pagarlo en un año y generar un mejor ingreso familiar.

loans.use: healthy food

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif is an IDP from occupied Khodjali district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. Married, has three children. He started his business in 2002, and borrowed two Normicro loans from Baku branch totalling $1350. Now he would like to borrow $850.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa F. is 41 years old. She owns her own home in Alpacoma on the outskirts of La Paz where she lives with her husband Jose Vargas and their six children, four of them minors. She sells groceries from a kiosk in El Alto. She would like to build a wall around her three-room home. This loan will pay to remove soil from the yard and build a wall around it. This is her second construction loan from IMPRO. Their first-class record with IMPRO shows them to be good borrowers, capable of making monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Teresa Fernández tiene 41 años, vive en una vivienda de su propiedad en la zona Alpacoma a las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a su esposo, el señor José Vargas y sus seis hijos, de los cuales cuatro aun son menores de edad, realiza compra y venta de abarrotes en un quiosco ( puesto de venta en la calle) en la ciudad de El Alto. La vivienda de la señora Teresa Fernández cuenta con tres habitaciones, pero no tiene amurallado. El crédito solicitado será para la construcción de un muro de contención y remoción de tierra del patio en una primera fase. Esta es la segunda vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito para construcción (la anterior fue para terminar de construir una habitación). Su historial en nuestra institución los clasifica como clientes 1 al ser puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales lo que le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Construction.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs Som S. is 31 years old. She works as a laundress. Her husband is a construction foreman. They have 5 children and their combined revenue is around 6 dollars per day. She has applied for a loan to purchase tools to repair their home.

loans.use: To purchase tools to repair her home

loans.name: Ahovi Christine

texts.fr:
Aged 37, Mrs. Ahovi Christine A. is married and has five children. Abandoning her studies during high school, she started selling fruit and plantain banana fritters. Due to lack of funds, she can no longer sell fruit and now just sells fritters. But there is virtually no profit in these. Worried about her living conditions and those of her family, she is asking for a loan of $600 to be able to start up the fruit business again, which is very profitable.

Agée de 37 ans, Madame A. Ahovi Christine est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Abandonnant ses études au cours secondaire, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des fruits et des beignets de bananes plantains. Par manque de moyens, elle n’arrive plus à faire le commerce de fruit et se contente de celui des beignets. Mais les revenus n’existent presque pas sur ce dernier. Soucieuse de sa condition de vie et celle de sa famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir reprendre le commerce de fruit qui est très rentable.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling fruit

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 42 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She sells foodstuff and has been in this business since 1992. She has been a LAPO client for the past 2 years. She is requesting a $250 loan, which she will repay within 8 months.  She will be use to buy more foodstuff for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I am a mother of seven children, three boys and four girls. I live in a small rented house with my husband and children. My husband is a daily wage laborer, I make thread reels and my eldest son makes electric heaters. Winter is around the corner and heaters will be high in demand. We want to expand our business and produce a high quantity of heaters.  We request a loan of $250 to buy the materials required to manufacture these heaters in bulk. We hope to generate higher profits this year, which we will save to marry one of our daughters.

loans.use: To expand heater business

loans.name: Rofelio

texts.es:
Rofelio is a hard working man who has worked for 18 years in agricultural activities. Everyday he wakes up early to go to the fields to pasture his livestock. He works carefully, caring for every details fo the animals' feeding. He learned this from her father an mother, who also work caring for livestock. Now as a responsible father, Rofelio works with his four children in mind, hoping to give them security and well being. Rofelio is familiar with the hard times that can bring need, and for that reason, he takes advantage of every day to see that his loved ones do not have problems. His next goal is to increase the number of livestock which he has in order to use them to raise his family's quality of life. We ask you to support this loving father so that he can continue on the road to success.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Rofelio, es muy trabajador y empeñoso es por ello que ya lleva 18 años dedicándose a las actividades agrícolas, cada día se levanta muy temprano para ir al campo a pastar su ganado, se dedica con tanto empeño que cuida cada detalle en su alimentación, esto lo aprendió de su padre y su madre que también son ganaderos y hoy por hoy como padre responsable asume sus roles pensando en sus cuatro hijos con el objetivo de brindarles seguridad y bienestar.Rofelio, es conocedor de las situaciones difíciles que ocasionan necesidades y es por ello que día a día se esfuerza al máximo a fin de que los suyos se desenvuelvas sin problemas. Su próxima meta es incrementar la cantidad de animales para acrecentar con ellos su nivel de vida familiar.Posibilitemos su petición para que este amoroso padre continúe por el camino del éxito.

loans.use: Purchase additional and greater variety of livestock

loans.name: Masanda D(Ii) Group

texts.en: Edith is 23 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a mechanic. She sells used clothes for a living. Edith wants to use the extra business profits to re-invest in her clothes business. Agnes has a stone quarry business, while Christine is a poultry farmer.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Jayanti K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, which is located in Lalitpur district of Nepal. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. K. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband, and her sons. Her sons are studying in grade 7 and 3, respectively.

Mrs. K. and her husband, Mr. Bishnu K., started their poultry farm five years ago. Her father-in-law and mother-in-law also help them in their work. They used to sell their chickens in the local market. Now Mrs. K. is requesting her second loan of Rs15000.00 to buy small chickens.

loans.use: To buy small chickens for her farm

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: O. Joy is married with 3 children. She is 25 years old and has been in business since 2005. She is from Edo State Nigeria and sells fruits. She needs the loan of $350 to buy more fruit for sale.

loans.use: To buy pawpaw and pineapple for sale

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Bùi Thị Vân, 34, participates in TYM fund since 1998. She is married and has 2 school aged children. Her main occupation is buying/collecting waste material to resell to recycling companies. This is very hard work physically. Everyday she has to cycle long distance to collect/buy the waste material from the people. At the end of the day, she has to sort it into different categories to sell to the recycling companies. She makes 3-5 USD a day, this provides her with cash flow to cover the everyday expenses and the weekly payment toward the loan. This time she is seeking a loan of 450 USD so that she would be able to buy a lot more waste material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Vân, 34 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998. Chị Vân đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc chính hiện nay của chị là thu mua phế liệu. Đây là một công việc vất vả, hàng ngày chị phải đạp xe đi hàng chục km thu mua hàng. Cuối ngày chị phân loại và bán lại cho các cơ sở sản xuất và tái chế nguyên liệu. Nhờ chịu khó nên mỗi ngày chị Vân kiếm được khoảng 3-5USD. Thu nhập thường xuyên giúp chị chi trả những chi phí sinh hoạt hàng ngày và tiền tuần. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD để có thể thu mua được nhiều phế liệu hơn.

loans.use: Buy wasted materials

loans.name: Ghafooran's Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran B., wife of M., is a mother of two sons. She successfully repaid a previous loan which she used to purchase a sewing machine and stitch clothes for neighbors. Her daily income is three to five dollars. Her husband is a trader by profession. She would like a second loan for her husband to expand his trading business.

The other members of the group have various needs for the loan. Zahooran B. wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Nargis B. wants the money to change the body of auto rickshaw. Sajida B. wants a loan to start a dental clinic and Nargis B. wants a loan to expand her clinic.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand businesses, repair a rickshaw and purchase a donkey cart.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la fabricacion de fritas de yuca-elote con azucar, tengo varios años haciendo este trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el suentento de mi famila, en estos momentos tengo contratadas dos mujeres para la reparticion de mi producto, pero necesito tener mayor produccion ya que las ventas se han ido arriba y no me doy abasto con las necesidas de mis clientes, por lo tanto solicito su apoyo para poder comprar mas materia prima y tener una produccion mayor, con parte de las ganancias que obtenga deseo seguir ayudando a mi nieto que esta en la escuela.

loans.use: compra de yuca, manteca, sal, aceite, leña, fosforos, azucar, elotes

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Mrs. Lean L., 58, is a grocery seller in Chub Village, Siem Reap Province. She earns around $2 per day. Her husband, 70, is a construction worker as well as driving a car taxi and he earns around $3 per day. Together they have one child who is a still young and in school. In order to expand her business and increase their income, Mrs. Lean L. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more grocery products to sell. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase gas to sell. The loan will allow her to expand her grocery selling business and improve the family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and gas to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Duch Sokheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank which is located in Boeng Krum Leu Village in Kandal Province consists of twelve people. Mrs. Duch S. is the village bank president. She was born in 1966 and she now lives in the village mentioned. She is a pig breeder who is raising twelve pigs.

Since her pigs are now growing bigger and bigger, Mrs. Duch S. faces a problem because she does not have enough money for pig feed to support them. Thus, Mrs. Duch S. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Keth Nai, is a policeman who can make KHR 12, 5000 (US$ 32) to support his family. Mrs. Duch S. has five children, one of whom is 20 years old and he is a policeman who can make the same salaR. as his father. The remaining four are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Charly Smith

texts.es:
Charly  tiene 21 años. Hace dos  años empezó su negocio de zapatería, al cual le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo.
El empeño que pone en su trabajo se lo debe al nacimiento de su hija, la cual apenas tiene dos meses de nacida.

El último crédito que recibo Charly le sirvió para comprar materiales para su zapatería, como suelas y pegamento. 
Además, él cuenta que necesita hacer crecer su negocio, ya que con los ingresos que tiene muchas veces no le alcanza para mantener a su hija recién nacida.
texts.en:
Charly is 21 years old. Two years ago, he opened his own shoe repair shop, to which he devotes most of his time. All the effort that he puts in his work is due to the birth of his daughter, who is only two months old. The last loan that Charly received was used to purchase materials, such as soles and glue, for his shoe repair shop. Furthermore, he needs to make his business grow because often times he does not earn enough income to support his newborn daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in materials for shoe repair shop

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La  señora Olga C., trabaja con nuestra institución desD. el 15 D. mayo  D. este año y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado gran responsabilidad. Tiene como actividad principal un puesto D. venta al detalle en una D. las calles más populares D. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia. Vive en una casa propia, que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos D. sanidad y con ella viven sus dos pequeños niños, uno D. 9 años y otro D. 12 años, sin embargo, en las que viven no son tan cómodas debido a que trabaja D. lunes a domingo. Es viuda desD. hace tres años, por ello su trabajo es la única fuente D. ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Olga C. started working with our institution on May 15th of this year. During this time, she has demonstrated great responsability. Her main job is a stand which she services located in one of the most popular streets in the City of La Paz, Bolivia. She owns her home and her 2 sons live with her. One who is 9 years old and the other is 12 years old. She hardly sees her kids because she works everyday from Monday thru Sunday. She's been a widower for over 3 years. Her job is the only source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun S. is a villager in Trapeang Sragei village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand her business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Chhem Kim, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn his living. Mrs. Choeun S. is 50 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Sidonie

texts.fr: Née vers 1968 à  HÊTIN DOGODO  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame H. Sidonie est mariée et mère de 3enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GF DJIDJOHO DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du riz. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 120 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1968 in Hetin Dogodo, in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Sidonie H. is married and the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Djidjoho of Hetin Sota, situated near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells rice.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Sidonie H. has requested a loan of 120,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Fouvale

texts.en: Fouvale F., 25, is married with 1 child. She has 2 years of experience in a uniform, t-shirt and puletasi business. She sells to the village people, public and families 3 days per week. She is a new member, with just one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala. SPBD loans are Fouvale’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is forty years old. She is a single parent and has two children. They are both in school. She is a food vendor and sells “kenkey”. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish or soup. She has many customers because kenkey is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. Florence sells on the street in the mornings and evenings. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise her income to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and fish

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. sells food supplies like plantain, banana and other items at Atobiase, near Elmina. Mercy has received primary level education.  She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter. Mercy has been selling food supplies like plantain and bananas since 2007. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the house keeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house that she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R. is a doctor. Her main activity has been the provision of medical services for more than 15 years. Elena works in the hospital district and in the afternoon hours she works at home. She has a room that needs repair, according to sanitary requirements.
